Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: Connie G
Reviews.Content: Great for family of 5. Hard to find hotels that will accommodate the 5th. Hotel brought up a very comfortable cot for my 15 year old son. Room was large enough to fit cot with plenty of movement space. Front desk very pleasant and helpful. Construction was going on working on the outside of the hotel. A little noisy in the late morning--hotel has a nice late check out (noon)--staff was very nice to try and compensate for any inconvenience. Perfect location, close to everything, safe, historic and classy.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, great room.”
Reviews.Author: Bingbangboing
Reviews.Content: Likley the best Starwood property in downtown Toronto. I have stayed at the Westin and the Sheraton Centre. The King Edward wins. Great old hotel in fantastic shape. My only negative is the aging decor and furniture in the room. It's still the best. Nice lounge and a great upgrade for SPG Platinum. Great job.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPant
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the king eddy on a work trip for 2 weeks. I thought the rooms were excellent very big and spacious. I thought the rooms were very clean the staff did an excellent job of cleaning them daily. The hotel operator I amazing, I called an average of 5 times per day and I was always treated very politely. My request room service took max 40 min. Items delivery 10 min max. My only complaints are that the hotel had two blackout nights after 12 pm including the shut down of the air. The hotel is not explicit regarding the process of sheet changing, and one day I did not have my room cleaned

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravellers2008
Reviews.Content: Posh, nice, great service, nice rooms, great food, close to everything, only here 1 night but would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Historical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PLESLIE23
Reviews.Content: Very stylish and comfortably renovated, historical hotel in Toronto. You can imagine yourself back in old Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “OK - not great”
Reviews.Author: Tjm100
Reviews.Content: Functionality ok for a business traveler, no in room wireless, desk has no work chair, rooms are overly decorated which distracts from doing work, room faced a blind wall. The good thing is that they had a free warm breakfast on the 11th floor

Reviews.Title: “No parking”
Reviews.Author: beetle025
Reviews.Content: We tried this hotel because there were lots of good reviews about it. I was disappointed. I was expecting more. The hotel was "okay" but for the same price, you can get a better place in the area. There were constructions going on and we didn't know. It was too late to back out since we've already paid our room and we were too tired. If you are driving here, be prepared to pay $45 for their valet parking. But here's a tip, beside the hotel is an overnight parking space where you only pay $25 until 6pm of the next morning. You can just walk from there to the hotel's main door. A few steps will save you 20 bucks. This is actually great because even if you've checked out from the hotel the next morning (around 11am), you can still roam around downtown without worrying where to park. You can grab an "All Day" pass for the subway and street cars for a better tour of the city. Staffs are friendly and nice - no complains. The person in the concierge was helpful, she gave me a map of the places we can visit. Their continental breakfast though is very limited, they don't even have eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Class”
Reviews.Author: maltyone
Reviews.Content: Petty consistent, higher end member of the Starwood family. Expansive lobby and a feel that is more typical for the Fairmont chain. Pro's Location, a block from Yonge Street, can't be much more central. Club lounge is one of the better ones, broken up into areas if you need to meet to discuss business. Exercise room has everything you would need and doesn't seem to get that much use. Neg's Really not much, the rooms are generally on the dark side lighting wise. Not sure why but they haven't gone to fluorescent and there are insufficient incandescent units in either my room or my colleagues. No issue for those with better eyes... Desk chair is also not adjustable, which is unfortunate. All in all, a great spot, no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay at one of the Grand Old Dames of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: CubaAfficionado
Reviews.Content: It was my wife's birthday and I had to find a Hotel which would not disappoint her on this very important day. My mother was going to take care of our 3 and 4 year old children for the night so I did not want to leave anything to chance. We don't get out as much as before we had children so it was important to book the right hotel. I had decided on the King Eddie because of it's location right on the subway line. Also, we would only need to take a streetcar to get to the Toronto Symphony at Roy Thomson Hall later that evening. So with this in mind, and not wanting to leave anything to chance, I trudged on down a few days before to check out the various rooms that I would consider for our evening out. I met Adi and Janice at the Front Desk and explained my situation. They could not have been more helpful. They found someone to show me the various rooms available and give me a tour of the Royal Club Lounge. After the tour, I was pretty sure I had made the right choice to stay here. However as with all Hotels, rooms are subject to availability so I would not know which room would be available for my stay. I arrived a few days later with my wife to check in and was pleasantly surprised to find that my room had been upgraded and I would be getting a corner suite on the 11th floor which is the same floor as the Royal Club Lounge. The room was very bright, with a nice view and was elegantly furnished. The bed looked very inviting and comfortable and there was bottled water on our night tables. Shortly after our check in there was a knock at the door and a cheese cake was presented to my wife. I had mentioned to Janice at the front desk about my wife's birthday and she had arranged this for us. Totally unexpected and such a thoughtful gesture. My wife said she wanted to take a quick nap before we had a bite in the Royal Club Lounge. First mistake when you have a bed more comfortable than at home. She did not want to get out of bed and subsequently said she would meet me in the lounge a little later. So I headed off to the Club Lounge solo not knowing what to expect. We were prepared to eat in the Consort Bar downstairs depending on the food available in the lounge. I was in for quite a surprise as the food available was delectable. Perhaps a little to good to be honest. I knew that dinner would not be necessary this evening. I chose from two different types of quiches, pita with Hummus, Tzatziki and Baba Ganoush, a lovely meat dish, brie, cheddar and swiss cheeses. Various olives and crisp vegetable slices, ( different peppers, carrots, etc ). There were nuts and chips and tortilla chips available as well. White and red wine and different beers were also available for us. My wife finally arose from her nap and seconded my opinion of the "snacks". After a few glasses of wine, some more food and some of her cheesecake we were stuffed. We would not be needing to eat dinner out tonight. We returned to a great night's sleep and I awoke in the morning ready for a workout in the gym. It is equipped with assorted exercise machines, ( rowing, elliptical, bikes etc. ), weight machines, free weights, exercise balls and more. I had a great workout and enjoyed more of the hotel's included bottled water. My wife stayed in bed again as I headed for the breakfast buffet. Again, I was not disappointed as I chose from eggs, cheese, ham, croissants, bagels, muffins, cereals and lots of fresh fruit. It was accompanied by fresh squeezed orange juice, tea and coffee. I had more than enough to last me until well after lunch. My wife arrived a little later and was similarly impressed with the breakfast buffet. We made our way back to the room but not before using the computer and printer provided in the Royal Club Lounge. I needed to print a document and this was done in seconds. We have stayed at the Fairmont Royal York in Toronto, as well as the Fairmont Queen Elizabeth in Montreal and the Fairmont Chateau Frontenac in Quebec City. We were on the Gold floor at these hotels which is the equivalent of the Royal Club. The King Edward was every bit as nice with more affordable prices. If you are wavering about whether it is worth staying in a Royal Club Room, don't hesitate as it is worth every penny. Of course, the staff are always so important and they did not disappoint at all. I would highly commend Janice and Adi at the Front Desk for their great service. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my family and friends and my wife is already planning a return with her mother for another stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but past its prime”
Reviews.Author: Adavidson1
Reviews.Content: Got into town late for business and got to the hotel and was greeted by very friendly staff. Unfortunately, just as I was about to get on the elevator, the fire alarm went off because of the renovations and got stuck downstairs in the lobby. I was going to change to another hotel after about 20 minutes of waiting but just as I was rebooking, everything cleared up, so up I went. Got into my room and while I thought it smelled like smoke, turns out it was just the smell of "old." Everything in the rooms are floral print and just generally old looking. Carpet in the room was fine but saw that it was falling apart in the hallway. No wireless internet in the rooms, either. I know that the hotel is undergoing major renovations and heard that internet will be fixed and I assume the rooms will be updated. So would I stay here again? Yeah, after the renovations are done. Until then, I think I'll stay in a real modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, spacious room 734”
Reviews.Author: jlondon7
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel half price using Hotwire. $109/night. Was concerned about the reviews re: construction. There was no construction during the weekend. Room was on the 7th floor. Quiet. 300 sq. feet 3 Closets, refrigerator, safe, 2 comfy queen sized beds, flat screen tv, sofa & coffee table. Very nice bathroom. Was able to get milk and juice at Shoppers Drug Mart 1 block away. No coffee maker in room but lots of coffee shops 1 block away. Staff was courteous, free WiFi in lobby, quick elevators, great location for theatre. We walked from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in grand old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ntlch06
Reviews.Content: This was the first time staying at King Edward. We had a girls weekend away to Toronto. We had a Mirvish Package that included a theatre/hotel/dinner. There are 3 hotels to choose from and had yet to stay at King Edward. Upon arrival the lobby was the first thing that was stunning to look at. Checking in was done very professionally with a very friendly atmosphere. We had asked for early check in and that was not a problem. They had our room ready for us. The consierge was extemely knowlegable about everything we needed to know and made it very easy for us to find where we wanted to go. He gave us some really amazing tips about really interesting things to see while we were there. The room was really large and well kept. The bedding was amazing. You almost did not want to get out of bed it was so comfortable. Everything about this hotel makes me want to go back again. The location is great. Short cab ride to the entertainment district or if the weather is noce it would be about a 20 min. walk. Lots of restaurants to choose from. We will definately be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmcg40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the King Eddy and were not disappointed. It is an old hotel -1903- so the rooms are small, but we knew that and they were well kept. It's also getting some refacing done to the exterior, but that's not a problem. The location's great - short streetcar ride to the entertainment district. We got a deal from travelzoo and chose to upgrade to the "club" rooms which include hot/cold snacks and wine/beer, along with a continental breakfast. Well worth the $30. The bar is serving dinners, and while we didn't eat there, the food looked very good. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “I like the King Eddie”
Reviews.Author: musicmansimpson
Reviews.Content: I have a soft spot for this hotel. I love the lobby and I find the service to be excellent. Yes, the rooms are a little (a lot) tired, but apparently they will be upgraded, which is nice to hear. I was here two weeks ago with a group of guys for a bachelor party, and we got a great suite as home base with the other rooms all on the same floor for a rock-botom price of $109 a night. I stayed here again this week for the same price, and got upgraded to that same suite. The Knig Eddie always treats their platinum guests really well, with terrific upgrades, car service in the morning, club lounge snacks and booze, breakfast, etc. I can't imagine they're making much money off of me for the rate they charge. Staying here is a treat. I go back and forth between here and the Sheraton. My wife likes the Sheraton; I like it here. No doubt the club lounge is nicer and food better at the Sheraton, and my wife likes the rooms there better. I like the free booze in the lounge at the Eddie. I recommend this hotel highly, as I've always had a good time here. Let's wait and see what happens with the renos, but they'll be able to compete nicely with the big players.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: travelbugnut
Reviews.Content: Great location and very good hotel. We asked for an early check-in upon our arrival by train and got the room as soon as we arrived around noon. We had requested a quiet room far from an elevator and got one. The carpet and chair show a little age but it`s not that important. The room was super clean and the beds very comfortable. The ladies at reception for checking-in and out were very welcoming and kind and so was the Guest Service Manager by e-mail.We did not deal with other staff so not able to comment. My only bad comment concerns the prices for food and mini-bar at this hotel which are extremely overpriced. But there is a lot to choose from nearby. Good value because we got a winter discount.

Reviews.Title: “No booking there again”
Reviews.Author: Ken A
Reviews.Content: I booked one night at Le MÃ©ridien King Edward Toronto.Front desk staff was friendly at arrival time.Soon we went up too excited since the room details were quite nice, well we were in the 6thfloor the smell in the hall was very humid and dusty soon we entered the room the same smell and very noisy since the hotel is under construction (at the time of booking no one at the hotel mentioned to us) and the Worse was went we went to shower and the courtins were so nasty (dont feel like giving details)my husband had to go to the front desk for them to come and change the courtins in the bathroom.We aso had a reservation at the Consort Bar and we waited for 25 minutes to be seat since all tables were full BUT we had a reservation after the waiter came along saying she did not notice was a reserve table in the upper level.Food was just OK for a Consort bar but very $$$$.I dont main paying went service and queality come together.Never booking there again

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service in Bar”
Reviews.Author: CharleyToronto
Reviews.Content: I have been holding weekly business meetings in the bar at King Eddie. The poor service has forced me to unfortunately find another location. I cannot for the life of me understand why it is so difficult for the servers to do their job. Horrible service!

Reviews.Title: “King Eddy -- Character and Location, Location,....Also Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Kirochka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a historic Toronto hotel, in the best location downtown, right next to a subway station and minutes away from all the office towers and the best shopping. The staff are welcoming, the halls are airy, the rooms are big with traditional furniture. And the price is very good for a top hotel. The first time I stayed I thought it would not be affordable, or would be rundown at the price. But it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old world class with a contemporary renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Le Meridien King Edward I prepayed via priceline the front desk attendant was very polite and gave me a beautiful room with a King sized bed even though I was booked for two queens - I was alone so I was much happier with the nicer bed. It was very soft. The lobby in the hotel is so beautiful and Victorian with an enormous portrait of King Edward VII after which the hotel is named. The room had all the expected ammenities including a good television, a minibar, ironing board, small safe in the room etc. all the ammenities which were advertised as promised. Valet parking was a little high but it included in and out privileges for 45 cdn whereas the self park around the corner (which the valet generously pointed out for me was only 21 cdn for 24 hours but did not include in and out privileges - so if you need the car use the valet parking its worth it. The hotel itself was immaculate and my room was immaculate. I was so pleased with my experience at this beautiful hotel. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor value”
Reviews.Author: DMF3758
Reviews.Content: From the outside this hotel has a grey and forbidding appearance. Inside the grandeur has faded badly. The mail from my travel agent described the room I had paid for as a Deluxe oversized room. (CAD 195+taxes) The check-in guy told me they had given me a lovely queen sized room with a court view. The reality was a tiny, dreary room with one very small window right in the corner which gave onto a dark shaft. If you are feeling mildly suicidal in Toronto and have been booked into this hotel try to avoid room 822 unless you have a bottle of benzodiazapines handy. If you plan to use the room's heating system a pair of earplugs will also be useful as it has a roar like a 747 warming up for take-off. Chased from my room by a premonition of self-harm I took refuge in the bar as the restaurant was closed for a function. It's one of those under-lit darkwood jobs that passes for old-fashioned and exclusive on this side of the Atlantic. At fifty I was the youngest patron by a good decade. This is definitley the go-to venue in Toronto if you have a new Zimmer-frame to show off. As in the rest of the hotel attention to detail is poor. An excellent local draft beer was served with a small bowl of rather stale broken biscuits. I finally had a very good piece of poached salmon from the bar menu, although I did wonder half an hour after ordering it and still waiting, whether the chef hadn't dispatched an angler off to the Yukon to catch it. I had a good tarte tatin for dessert but despite waiting another twenty minutes to get it, it was served cold. This hotel doesn't live up to its pretensions or its prices. If you want to run a premium hotel you can't get away with supplying guests with two small ancient towels in the bathroom, worn and stained furniture in the bedroom or air-conditioning so noisy that you can't sleep with it on. The next night, for 40 dollars less I had a vast and tastefully decorated corner suite in the Toronto Hilton just up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, large rooms, great location downtown”
Reviews.Author: seth2930
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 days/nights. Standard room was very large and spacious, which was nice. Bed was very comfortable. Lobby and hotel personnel were very friendly and helpful. A couple of the downsides were as follows: For a luxury hotel, I expected really nice towels. Yet the towels seemed old and flat - not very fluffy. And they were a bit on the small side. Also, the room had plastic cups (in addition to glasses). I don't think a luxury hotel should ever use plastic cups. In addition, there was no wireless Internet in the room - you have to plug in. Finally, the gym could use some updating. The treadmills were very old and would literally shake while running on them. But overall, it was a nice hotel and I would recommend it for business and/or family travel.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy elegance in the heart of Toronto's financial district.”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustYYT
Reviews.Content: No denying this place is old school. Stay with club floor benefits and it feels just like home. The building as any buildings of that age show a little aging however the original regal architecture is stunning. A few minor bumps along the way but overall a very pleasant home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great location large rooms and perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: CubaFun123
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay...and am still here. Just had a great workout in the very well suited gym (Bright airy...modern equipment ...chilled bottled water and towels provided). The rooms are very large and well kept....large bathrooms....clean And the staff is great. This is a very classy hotel with old world charm but certainly NOT old rooms. The beds were very comfortable with both our beds having 2 feather pillows and 2 non feather pillows. Wonderful. The only downside I would say is that there is no wireless Internet in the rooms just wired. This didn't work for me as I had an iPad . I think the hotel will be getting wireless soon. It's available in the lobby for free as well as the lounge if you are a platinum member. The free wireless in the lobby was very quick. Another downer was that the valet parking was a bit steep even for Toronto so we only had them park us one night. We found street parking close by for about 12 dollars per night. Other than those 2 points I would highly recommend this hotel. It was a nice warm feeling returning in the evenings and enter into the wonderful grand lobby. Thanks king Eddy....I will for sure be back!

Reviews.Title: “Central, comfortable - felt like a business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: greyster
Reviews.Content: I have no quibbles with this hotel. It is one of the more luxurous and established hotels I've stayed in and felt like it was in a listed building. The hotel is in the business district of Toronto, it was a quiet season so the hotel was practically empty. The staff in the restaurant were still in holiday mode as well with slow service. The rooms and service overall however was excellent. Although a business location it is still central downtown toronto and if you get a good rate you should go for it. All the good downtown attractions are walking distance. Therefore fine for business people, friends and family. It doesn't have a romantic feel so you may want to avoid if you are on a honeymoon. As I forementioned, this hotel is really geared to serving the local business community. I recommend eating outside as the hotel menu is very limited. Quality is fine, so its OK for one night. You have a large range of nearby restaurants to pick from.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: damien
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were attending a Burn's Dinner last Saturday night at the Albany Club so decided to stay in Toronto for the night. I checked prices on various web sites but found that booking through the hotel directly was a very good price at $109 plus tax. I requested a deluxe King size quiet room on a higher floor with a coffee maker. We got a room on the 16th floor at the back of the hotel so it was very quiet. The room was spotless and the bed very comfortable. We had a very good view of St Jame's Cathedral to the left and Lake Ontario the right. Check in was very fast. Gary gave us all the details of what was available at the hotel. When we unpacked I made a cup of Nabob coffee which was supplied. We enjoyed with a couple of cookies that I had brought with us. We were delighted to find that the club was only a 3 minute walk away. On Sunday morning we got 2 complementary cups of excellent coffee in the lobby out side the restaurant. We then went to 10 am Mass at St Michael's Cathedral which was about 10 minutes fast walk away. If you do not want to pay the $40 for parking there is indoor parking a few minutes away just south of King on Church at Ideal parking. It was $6 flat rate for Saturday and the same for Sunday. This hotel has a very elegant peaceful lobby which I admired while my husband was getting the car. We will most certainly stay there the next time we want to stay overnight in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Travellingnurse50
Reviews.Content: We stay at Starwood properties all the time, including in Toronto, but this was our first visit to the King Eddie and we'll be back. Just off Yonge Street, the location is convenient for all downtown venues. Front desk staff were very friendly and put us in an Executive King room - very large but dated, especially the bathroom. The hotel is under renovation (lots of scaffolding outside) and hopefully the rooms will get a do-over too. Our major disappointment was the workout room - OLD treadmills (one not working) and elliptical machines (no built in TVs on either) but good weights and resistance machine. We had a pass to the Royal Club - the usual evening hors de oeuvres and breakfast - just okay in quality. Still - great staff, great atmosphere, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wait til construction is done”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveller99
Reviews.Content: I like old hotels in general, but I am not enamoured with this one. The long narrow room configuration is very strange, making the room i stayed in uncomfortable. No wifi in the room, construction noise and the cake topper, a fire alarm at 6am that took a long time to resolve as just an alarm. This one was not up to the Meridien snuff in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Timeless King Eddie”
Reviews.Author: cristobalcanada
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently had an occasion to stay at the King Eddie. We hadn't stayed there for several years, not since it had been renovated. As a child growing up in Niagara in the 50's, my Dad would get a room there and take us for the weekend to see the Santa Claus parade and Eatons windows. We all thought it was really grand. We had a family wedding at Ontario Place last weekend. The bridal party was booked into the Westin Harbour Castle, and they suggested that to the rest of the out-of-town guests. We thought of the King Eddie........and were we pleased!!!! First: Westin $169 vs King Eddie $109. We took four rooms. Our room was one of the huge older rooms that today would be called a suite. It was totally re-furbished and modernized, but still had that old elegant feel. It was very luxurious and well appointed.The morning after the wedding we opted to have brunch in King Eddie's Grand Ballroom. This was one of the finest Brunches we had ever enjoyed. Shrimp, crab, scallops, smoked salmon and trout, Beef Wellington, Glazed Ham, Eggs Benedict, salads,desserts etc., all accompanied by the soft strings of the harpist. At one point my wife ask, 'did you ask how much the Brunch is ?' I replied,'who cares, how much could it be?' When the bill arrived for the ten of us, including 2 granchildren at 1/2 price and no alcohol at all.....it was $658.00 including tax and built-in gratuity. We all enjoyed a good laugh at ourselves the "Country Cousins" from Grimsby,....and decided to do it again the next time we had an occasion to stay in Toronto. We love you King Eddie, and WILL do it again! Chris Tew Grimsby, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located in Toronto Downtown”
Reviews.Author: EgonOlsen
Reviews.Content: First stay and I'd definitely come back. Hotel is very conveniently located in the very heart of Toronto. Service was excellent, very prompt and helpful. Rooms are very spacious, clean and well maintained. Both for business trip and for leisure recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and convenient”
Reviews.Author: LifeOptimist
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night over Christmas holidays and chose it because of its convenient location, not too far from Union Station. (King Station is almost right outside the front door also) The side of the building was under construction, but once inside, it was beautiful and regal. Our room was on the Starwood Preferred Guest floor and very spacious. The 1920's style furnishings were beautiful to look at, but I found the lamps did not offer quite enough light. Still, the bed was grand and comfortable and the flatscreen HDTV and radio/iPod dock very modern. Our bathroom was also spacious and had a bidet, but was lacking in terms of hangers or shelf space to put our stuff. Toiletries were very basic - soap, shampoo, lotion - and not really as luxurious as you think such a nice bathroom would contain. I wouldn't say the hallways were the cleanest I've ever seen, however. The carpet was stained and many people left garbage/dishes outside their doors, which wasn't often picked up. Otherwise the staff were extremely efficient and professional. I have no complaints about them! There are also a lot of fast food places nearby, like Tim Horton's and Subway, as well as a Shopper's Drug Mart on the corner. I paid a little over $100 for the room, booking through ViaRail, and I paid extra for late check out. If I were to stay again, I would probably try to grab a similar deal and not spend too much on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Bruce S
Reviews.Content: This a beautiful old hotel that is fit for a King. The check-in service was quick, friendly, and exceeded expectations. As a platinum Starwood member we we automatically upgraded, and told to call if it did not meet expectations. Upon reaching our room, it was at the end of a long hallway, and had two doors. The suite was spectacular, and beyond our expectations. This hotel is perfectly located in the heart of down-town close to everything. We were surprised by how quiet the room was, we heard little if any street noise. We will definitely be back again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect place for romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: ech_zed
Reviews.Content: wow what an amazing hotel. We were so warmly greeted and they even upgraded our room to a suite. We had such a gorgeous room , we felt like royalty. That night the concierge recommended a fantastic restaurant (JUMP) that we feel in love with. The surroundings, and friendliness made this weekend such a beautiful one. Hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, spacious, elegant”
Reviews.Author: museum-a-day
Reviews.Content: About 100 yards from the King subway stop at King and Yonge, the venerable old King Eddy is delightfully quiet at night â€“ as itâ€™s in the financial district, which pretty much empties out after 6 pm. The foyer with its 5 storey atrium is impressive â€“ very old world. For excitement, the Queen Street West strip and the Entertainment District is a pleasant 15 minute walk north and west. The room itself was very large â€“ lots of seating area â€“ with high quality bed, and best of all, blissfully quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Yiota”
Reviews.Author: bri3000
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the King Edward but Yiota (the Maid) made the stay even better, great serivce and very friendly! It was like my mother came to clean my room, very nice lady!

Reviews.Title: “Our hotel of choice in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: choptliva
Reviews.Content: True, the King Eddy is no longer top of the food chain in terms of luxury hotels. And true, some of the rooms are not as modern and high tech as the newer properties sprouting all over town. But if you like, as we do, genuinely good service, quality build, spacious rooms, comfortable beds, etc., you will probably like the King Eddy as we do. We returned recently to celebrate our anniversary, and the hotel management so kindly upgraded us to an executive suite (all 800 sq ft of it), and sent up wine and cheese. As SPG PLT we were given access to the Lounge, and that was as usual a wonderful thing. Very good quality food, and free beer even. I've always found service to be excellent and very responsive. This time was no exception. Everyone we met was wonderful. There are a bit of construction going on, so we had a bit of diffiicult stopping and parking in front of the hotel. But the doorman asked a taxi to move back a bit, and we managed to get near the curb so as to not block the street car. A bit of a hassle, but that wasn't really anything of a major issue. Wish they would maybe move the valet parking area to the side of the building. No matter. The King Eddy is our hotel of choice in the downtown area. We stay here basically 90% of the time we are downtown. If you want uber-modern stuff like the W or the Germains, you won't like this place much. If you prefer older world charm and quality, this may be more your taste.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious but could use an update”
Reviews.Author: choubella
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was accomodating to our needs and upgraded us to the deluxe double queen room, which has two queen beds, and a fairly spacious living room area where we were able to spread out lugguage with space left to spare. The high ceilings added to the comfort. The bathroom is a bit dated and dim. There was a drainage issue in the shower. A nice drugstore and a couple of cafes are located outside the hotel within walking distance, so pretty convenient. Not the best out there, but it does the job. Just very old and needs a face lift.

Reviews.Title: “wow! can i afford this?!”
Reviews.Author: DGA69
Reviews.Content: thankfully i booked through priceline so i could afford this luxury hotel. it's old school charm and makes you feel like you're in Dynasty! :) they upgraded us for free to a room with 2 beds & it was also a corner room with a beautiful view of the city. the room was also very spacious with high ceilings. the bathroom had 2 time zones i think?! ;) the only complaint is that the price includes NOTHING. everything is extra...except the elevator ride. thank you priceline for helping me to be able to afford to spoil myself for a change! :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Karageen
Reviews.Content: My wife and have stayed at a number of hotels in Toronto. Our most recent stay at the King Edward was the best experience yet. We upgraded to a suite that was well appointed and spotless. The highlight was the staff; front desk, valet, bell boy and concierge were the best. Kind, courteous and willing to go the extra mile. We'd purchased seafood at the St. Lawrence Market and the hotel refrigerated it for us before our trip home. Great location with a 10 minute walk to the St. Lawrence Market, and 15 minutes to the Eaton Centre. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Room tired and in need of Reno”
Reviews.Author: Mayapoe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the king Edward for 3 days on a conference. Main lobby was well kept and grand. However, room itself was tiny, dated and worn looking. I used Priceline so I no doubt must have gotten the worse room of the hotel but still for a 5 star rated hotel it was clearly disappointing. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nouvelle Maria Spa: Much needed treatments required...for the spa itself!”
Reviews.Author: ImogenDharma
Reviews.Content: Over the holidays, I decided to treat myself to a much deserved massage. I went to Nouvelle Maria Spa at the King Edward Hotel because I used to go there quite frequently before I moved away 10 years ago. I have since returned to the area. I arrived to a friendly welcome and was asked if I had been there before and was given a quick overview of how to use the locker key and was given a towel, flip flops and robe. My coat was taken and hung up and an employee escorted me to the change room and I was shown where the lounge was to await my treatment. Change Room: Upon entering the change room, I couldn't help but notice in how disrepair it was. The whole room and the bathroom needs to be gutted and updated. The shower was unappealing and I didn't dare set foot in the sauna. Robe and Flip flops: The robe was a very comfortable size and seemed of decent quality (I didn't read the label). The flip flops were something you would find in Chinatown for probably $5 for 20 pairs. Not very attractive and made my feet sweat which was uncomfortable as inevitably, my RMT would be touching them. Lounge: Dated. Looked like the same furniture I remember 10 years ago, even had the same material. The furniture was old and uncomfortable - the cushions desperately needed replacement as they sagged terribly when you sat on them. It was a very cold day and I wasn't offered any hot honey water with lemon until about 2 minutes before the RMT came to get me for my treatment so I couldn't enjoy it. RMT/Treatment: The treatment room was nothing to be inspired about. The music through the sound system was relaxing but the treatment room left much to be desired. It wasn't a soothing relaxing enviroment as it needed a new paint job badly, and the rest of the room just needed sprucing up and was not very tidy. There wasn't even a hook on the wall for me to hang my robe - I had to place it on a stool of some sort. I could also hear clearly from the treatment room beside me. RMT was nice enough, listened to what I needed and went forward in administering the treatment. A few minutes in I heard sniffling and every so often I would feel one hand or the other leaving my body to what I had to assume was so that the RMT would wipe his nose. There were tissues right on the counter and I didn't even know what to say. First, you'd think that the spa would have informed me that the RMT had a cold and asked if I wanted a different RMT! The RMT should have also told me, so now he's wiping his excressions as he's touching me - very unprofessional. I really should have stopped the treatment and said something looking back now but I guess I was just in shock. I was asked if I had any services booked afterwards and said no. I wasn't offered cold water or hot honey water with lemon to enjoy in the lounge and relax after the treatment. I went back to the change room and got dressed then proceeded to pay. No issue with the payment process. So in closing, I could go to The Stillwater Spa or The Elmwood Spa and get the same treatment for the same money but actually be in a relaxing enviroment and enjoy other free amenities that the Nouvelle Maria Spa does not offer. There is a lot of competition out there and there are a lot of people with generous company health benefits (like myself) who can go to the spa monthly for free. Nouvelle Maria Spa needs to invest in the actual spa facility, make it inviting and enjoyable enviroment for visitors and ensure visitors feel as though they don't have to leave right after their treatment(s). There is a lot of competition out there - I recommend that the spa do some research and bring it's facility into the 21st century - the 80s are over. Repeat business is the bread and butter these days but maybe they're surviving on the one offs the King Edward hotel provides. With the new King Edward hotel condominums being built now is the time for a fantastic referb! Imagine the hundreds of prospective clients the Nouvelle Maria Spa could have as repeat visitors. I only hope they come around. I could have been a loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Afternoon Tea”
Reviews.Author: gcaz
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travel home to Toronto I meet my friend at Victoria's for Afternoon Tea. It never dissapoints. The tea was as good as usual but the service was a little slow. The sandwiches and the pasteries were tasty. I think it's the best tea in town.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dated, Poor Service, Cold Food”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a Christmas event. We used to stay here often in the 80s and I have to say that I don't think they have spent much money on the rooms since then. The room we checked into was poorly lit and worn. There was a dog in a nearby room that was barking non stop for over an hour so we had to change rooms. We were upgraded to a suite which was a larger version of the room we had just moved from. Also worn by time but not in an elegant way. There was only one small light in the bathroom making it difficult to put makeup on before leaving for dinner It was a very disappointing experience. We were at an event with about 200 people. It took them over an hour to serve the entree following the starter. All the food was cold at our table and those surrounding ours. Although they tried to correct the problem it was a little too late. At breakfast we also waited over an hour for our food to come. The staff provided a lot of apologies and the bill was reduced but this is not what is expected at a fine hotel. Out thoughts are that this hotel is undergoing change with many of the rooms being converted to condominiums. These changes are impacting overall service levels.

Reviews.Title: “amazing night, amazing memories”
Reviews.Author: funinhotthottsun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is BY FAR one of the BEST i've ever stayed in... Parking is $25 for the night RIGHT BESIDE the hotel, and downtown toronto that is unheard of. The Hotel is absolutely STUNNING! I cannot wait to go back... the rooms are beautiful, tons of space, and the BEDS are really the MOST comfortable bed i have ever slept in!! the duvet and mattress was amazing. this hotels is a must see.

Reviews.Title: “This place needs a refurb...”
Reviews.Author: JCG123DXB
Reviews.Content: For a place that rates on its 5* reputation it is getting a bit run down and old like grandma's once great mansion it's a monument to 1980s decor and fittings. Basically it's in a great location but the rooms need updating. Other hotels in the area are better value, cleaner and more up to date. No wifi at all in rooms. And why why why can't starwoods get that free wifi will increase the number of bookings in their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: TeeJayGirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights as a quick stop over and to get over our jet lag. It was a nice hotel. The room we had was spacious, tidy, neat, clean and the bed comfortable, which was most important for us. The only thing that bothered us was the noisy heating in the room, which made a loud constant hum and at times kept us awake but we were tired enough to sleep through it most of the time. I would not stay in that room with the noise longer than to get over our jet lag. Overall, good value for the amount we paid, good location with walking distance to main attractions in the Old Town and Shopping malls.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic”
Reviews.Author: Paul045
Reviews.Content: This is a great old hotel in an excellent location. We stayed for one night after a work function. If you like hotels with 12 foot ceilings and a classic feel, this is a great hotel. Front desk and concierge staff were excellent and very friendly. Bed was comfortable. The room could use a coffee maker. This hotel is close to restaurants and shopping. We were on the 6th floor and the only view was of the neighbouring building. I suggest at least 10th floor or higher for a few of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel, Super Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mary K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of my favorites in Toronto. I have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions. Just recently i was at an event (my first at this hotel) and was very impressed. The entire set up seemed effortless. Having a planning background i was able to appreciate the time it took to pull off an event. I would really like to acknowledge the staff at this hotel for working so hard behind the scenes (AV - Graham, Chefs, Servers, Front Desk staff, and many many others) who do not always receive credit. Thank you all! I hope to be at many more events in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Excellent AV service”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the King Edward a number of times and have always had a pleasant experience. The staff are friendly and the amenities are numerous. Only recently did I have the opportunity to host a conference at the King Edward, where we used their in-house AV company - PSAV. Well, if the hotel is great...PSAV is excellent! I could not believe the quality of show they organized for us and how efficient and helpful their staff were. Graeme and Gerben went out of their way to ensure that our last minute changes were met and satisfactory. They both truly went above and beyond to meet our requests and make sure that we were happy with the set-up :-) Thanks guys! I will definitely be using PSAV for any future conferences I plan!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but Horrible computer "business center"”
Reviews.Author: sobearies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and conveniently located steps away from King Station. It's within walking distance from theatres and restaurants. The staff is great. The hotel is quiet. I had a good night's sleep. My room entry key card had to be reset twice in 4 nights for some bizarre reason. My reservation was in order. It was a bit annoying to wait in line at the front desk after a long day, to fix this issue. I was there on business. Used their computer "business center". Ohhhh!!! Big mistake!!! It's handled by an outside vendor company and they are terrible. I didn't get my print out and was charged a lot of money on my credit card (not to mention the huge waste of time!). Just to log in is $5. Dealing with this company has been terrible. I should've tried to find a cyber cafe or something. I would've been better off. The hotel's staff tried to help me. She was very kind and did the best she could. She used her own cell phone to speak to a vendor's rep. That rep assured me the charge would be reversed. When I checked my card statement a couple of weeks later, It was not reversed. The hotel's person gave me a card of her supervisor, but when I called regarding the problem he had been transferred. I feel bad for giving this hotel an "average" review because of my experience with their outside vendor.

Reviews.Title: “Club lounge excellent”
Reviews.Author: WayneinCollingwood
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite hotels in Toronto (or anywhere for that matter) is better than ever. There's new furniture in the club lounge and now there's a morning host with lots of personality. Breakfast in the lounge has always been good but a greeting from 'Gary' really makes the start of the day great. He takes the time to enquire about your stay and ensure all is fine. The evening host is excellent too. All the staff are welcoming and while some parts of the hotel may be showing their age, this is one of those cases where it just adds to the character of the place. We hope new rennovations don't destroy this character.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff”
Reviews.Author: drbrksmith
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 3 night stay at the King Edward. Staff at this hotel couldn't have been better on my recent stay, everyone I met was professional, courteous and friendly. The rooms are big but old fashioned and unfortunately this includes the fixtures and fittings - the lighting really is pretty bad, with no overhead lights in the main part of the bedroom. Also no WIFI available in the guest rooms. I believe the rooms are due to be refurbished soon which is definitely needed. A good 4 star hotel in a great location. With refurbishment it can hopefully get towards its old grandeur once more. Also very good at recognising SPG status.

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Teacherbear
Reviews.Content: We again had the great pleasure of being guests of the King Edward in Toronto at the beginning of December. The special treatment begins with a wonderful greeting from teh doorman and continues with check in. We had the great pleasure of have Toya as our front desk person. She always makes one feel extra special and more like a returning friend then a quest. As usual the check in was smooth and efficient. Our room was something extra special, I love the fact all the rooms at the hotel are large and are not â€˜ cookie cutterâ€™ in their layout. This executive suite was outstanding! The special treatment was carried through with our treatment in the Royal Lounge. It is well worth the extra money to book a room with lounge access. Not only do you have retreat from the hectic pace of travel, but the food and libations are five star. We really enjoy the evening reception and appetizers plus of course the breakfast. The facilities at the King Edward are wonderful but it is the staff which makes the stay extra special. As someone who stays in a variety of hotels , it is so nice to be treated as a returning friend and not just another guest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service...very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pooms
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Toronto and stayed there last two nights before got back to Miami. We were very enjoy staying there. Service was fantastic, room was dated but very comfortable. Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent comfort and value for money”
Reviews.Author: PatioPete
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and comfortable. The staff is helpful and courteous. Everything is in good conditions. A very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tyrico
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed this hotel tremendously. The location if perfect , as its walking distance from Eaton Center and all the nice restaurants and shopping. The lobby is quite grand and formal and the staff friendly and helpful. The rooms need refurbishing, but was still comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Date Night With My Wife”
Reviews.Author: 502SS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got to enjoy a rare night out alone and decided to spend the night at the King Eddie. Wow.. what a great night, the hotel staff was great, friendly and helpful. The room was a bit dated but very clean and quite. The bed was soft and comfy. We enjoyed breakfast the next morning very much.. a bit pricey. Overall a great time !

Reviews.Title: “Grand property, central location, but desperately in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: LinnieMaple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday night and used my Starwood points and I wish I hadn't bothered. The hotel is a traditional property and the bedroom rooms are showing their age. Unfortunately, on the night I stayed there was a wedding party staying on our floor and the revellers had no regard for other hotel guests since they made a ton of noise coming back to their rooms at various times through the night up until 2.30am and then again at 5.30am when they returned from a club. The room doors are heavy and they slam shut which reverberates around the hallway. My partner and I had about 2 hours sleep. Otherwise, the room was OK, no minibar, so you have to order room service, bathroom was acceptable, no bath robes and only one bath towel so had to get more delivered. All in all, very average and the renovation is well overdue. Staff are very welcoming, professional and certainly handled my complaint with politeness professionalism and understanding. In fairness, when I complained they offered to reimburse my points and have subsequently written to offer a free upgrade next time I stay - I guess I'll make that stay after the renovation has been completed!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the King Eddie”
Reviews.Author: AnotherOntarioguy
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times recently. I find as a Starwood Platinum member that they treat me very well. Despite booking the cheapest room option at the time I am always upgraded to a very large room or suite. The rooms are sometimes a bit worn around the edges but everthing works and the beds are new and comfortable. I do have a beef with the light bulbs. They apppear to be first generation compact flourescent and take a long time to develop light and are low wattage for the area they are covering. The executive lounge on 11 is great. Complimentary beer, wine and snacks in the evening and an expansive continental breakfast in the morning. Fitness room is large and I never seem to have trouble getting a machine.

Reviews.Title: “Classic atmosphere and dog-friendly too”
Reviews.Author: chasinchelsea
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the King Edward several times before and find it top-notch with a very affable staff. I was given a nice, large, bright room on a high floor -- the club floor I was told. This time, for a 3-night stay, I scored an incredible deal under their "Birth Year" promotion which worked out to less than $100 nightly. The hotel doesn't charge a fee for dogs either. In fact, they even brought me a dog bed, placemat and water dish. There's a nice park less than a block away. My only quibble: there was a suspicious-looking smear on my window and even though I left a note for the maid, she probably didn't see it and I had to track her down to clean it.

Reviews.Title: “Good base in Toronto, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: MrsBison
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, the King Eddy has seen better days. I think the reason it gets such mixed reviews is that it has the look (from the outside and lobby) of a grand, five star property, but the rooms and facilities have not been kept up to five star standard. And, in fact, this hotel is only rated as four stars so I think this should be kept in mind when reviewing it. If it were passing itself off today as a five star property I would have felt ripped off even at the discounted rate that I paid. However, for a four star, I was satisfied with our quiet, spacious, east facing room on the 12th floor (Club level). The bed was very comfortable and the bed linens of a high quality. The bedroom and bathroom were decorated in a classic way that was probably the height of luxury in the 80s/90s but now just looks a bit old-fashioned. I probably wouldn't have even noticed the dated decor, except there was a noticeable stain on the carpet and another stain on the ottoman at the end of the bed which made me look around and realise the property probably hasn't been updated in about 25 years. One other criticism about the rooms - you are charged a daily rate for wi-fi (I think it was $13 or so?) but wi-fi is free in the club lounge so if you stay in a room on the club floors you can take your laptop along to the lounge. That's what we did - no big deal, but it would have been more convenient in the room! On the plus side, we were happy with the (included) continental breakfast provided on the 11th floor club lounge, which included a range of cereals (including oatmeal! yum!), fresh fruit, pastries, toast, juices, cold meats and cheese, boiled eggs, juice etc. The only downside to the breakfast was the coffee, but then I had a hard time finding a good cup of coffee in Toronto (if, like me, you find Starbucks coffee too weak/tasteless, go to Bulldog on the corner of Church & Granby or Crema on Bloor just east of Yonge). The club lounge also has a happy hour with free wine/beer/canapes every evening but we were always out at that time. Aside from breakfast in the club lounge, we didn't go to the hotel restaurants so my room service club sandwich was the only other hotel food that I tried -- it was big and tasty and the accompanying fries were excellent. Service at the King Edward was very friendly, prompt and efficient - my room service order arrived promptly. This hotel is in a good location, right next to King St subway station and walking distance from lots of shopping and tourist attractions. There are also great shops and restaurants along King St East - we had a delicious meal at Jamie Kennedy's Wine Bar on Church St below Front St.

Reviews.Title: “Very Old Property & Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Dennis H
Reviews.Content: I was awakened at 1am but the noise of a large compressor that did not shut off until 5 am so needless to say I did not sleep. Spoke to the Manager of the Hotel in the am and he just shrugged it off - no offer to make up for a terrible nights sleep Service was very slow when I checked in Hotel is Old and Tired but more importantly noisy

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: MaggieEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as part of a "Canadian Affair" package, total cost for the room being Â£188. The room was spacious but shabby, the bed comfortable. The low energy lightbulbs used in the bathroom meant that the lights had to be switched on about 10 minutes before my husband could see clearly in order to shave.I doubt whether anyone over 6 feet tall could have used the shower comfortably.The door to the room had a gap all the way round so that the light from the corridor shone in to the room all night. This gap was somewhat worrying when I read that in the event of a fire and not being able to vacate the room one should place wet towels around the door frame. We did in fact have a fire alarm on our second morning which eventually turned out to be false but being on the eighth floor with a sealed window did make me a bit nervous.No coffee making facility seemed a bit strange in a North American hotel of this calibre. The bar prices seemed a bit excessive and the surly barman didn't make us want to stay despite the truly awful weather. All in all a bit of a disappointment

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: Artandvino
Reviews.Content: We visited Toronto at the end of September and stayed at the King Edward. We were expecting a really traditional room and read some of the reviews of how "old" the decor was. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to an absolutely beautiful modern suite and had exceptional service to boot. We could not have asked for a better stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but could use a bit of reno”
Reviews.Author: DandD142
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently as a result of placing the highest bid in a silent auction. Our room was large enough, clean, but the furnishings are very worn, wallpaper is a bit shabby, not nearly as impressive as the lobby and grand ballrooms. The bed was very comfortable, great pillows. Hotel staff were gracious and welcoming, not snobby at all. You have to call for ice and there are no coffee making facilities. We travelled by public transit so that we wouldn't have to pay $40+ for parking. You can walk to everything and the Yonge subway is a 2 min walk, as is the St. Lawrence Market, and there's lots to do in the area. We felt safe walking from a restaurant nearby at almost midnight. I would stay here again, but probably only if I got a great deal, I wouldn't pay $225 (the rate including tax if we had paid full price).

Reviews.Title: “5* Hotel??”
Reviews.Author: behanjjp
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in Le Meridien in Toronto and the hotel is very well located very close to the shoping areas and quite a few of the attractions in the city. The hotel is well serviced by friendly and well informed porter's that dole out all types of friendly advice, directions, bars that show premier league matches. The hotel is plush and the staff friendly. The rooms were a bit small for the price and the amenities are not 5*, there is no pool, and the gym/leisure area is a not quite up to 5* service, no sauna, steamroom, jauzzi for guests. Yes there is a spa and you can avail of some excellent services.

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit”
Reviews.Author: BWHITE6132
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was first rate. The check-process was smooth and the front desk clerk made sure that he found the best room for us. Our room was very large and spacious. The linens were first rate and the pillows were perfect. I thought the room itself could use a little updating. The carpet was threadbare and the furniture was nicked in places. The bathroom was very large and well appointed. We called the front desk to ask for several items and all were delivered with due speed and good humor. I think the hotel would benefit by the addition of an actual restaurant. Breakfast was served in a part of the lobby and dinners in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience staying at The King Edward " a piece of history"”
Reviews.Author: 94KellyGirl96
Reviews.Content: From the time we pulled up in our vehicle we were treated with great service. Our bags were handled with care and our vehicle was parked in a secured area. The front desk staff were wonderful and filled every request that we had. We stayed for 3 nights, we were given a lovely tour of the hotel by Mark, the front desk director of service and he followed up to make sure we were enjoying our stay. We had a beautiful executive suite with a lovely view of down town. We ate a few meals at the hotel and went to the bar for drinks with friends and were pleased with everything. We were in town for an event and attended a gala at the hotel and the meal was lovely. I would recommend the King Edward and will be staying there again next year! Thank you Mark and staff for everything! Kelly & Ken in Ottawa, ON .. .

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: sarah5b
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel! The staff were so friendly and attentive. The hotel itself was amazing and the room we stayed in was fantastic. This hotel was in a great location and it was easy to explore Toronto from here. The crowning moment was arriving back in our room to find that they had left a complimentary bottle of champagne on account of it being our honeymoon, a really nice touch. Prices were reasonable for such an upmarket hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, needs an update”
Reviews.Author: warren04
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the King Eddie for a quick getaway. The hotel has a lot going for it but it really needs to be upgraded. The hotel is conveniently located in the financial district and right on the subway and street car lines. This makes it easy to walk south to the lake or north to Queen West or Dundas Square. The entrance, lobby and ballroom areas are very impressive and still retain the grandeur that the hotel must have had in days gone by. The rooms are typical of an older hotel in that they have irregular shapes and high ceilings. Unlike other reviewers, I did not have any issue with the housekeeping and thought the carpets and rooms seemed very clean. However, I was disappointed to discover that the rooms have not been updated in a long time. The wallpaper and curtains are dingy and the furniture is tired and unattractive. Also, the wall are quite thin and we could hear the couple next door having a fight. The general feeling does not compare to a room at the Waldorf or even the Royal York in Toronto, both hotels being of a similar vintage as the King Edward. I would not stay here on business but the room rate is quite reasonable and the hotel is good as a base for a fun weekend in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory”
Reviews.Author: Namellor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the old King Eddy during Nuit Blanche because the location was perfect. The hotel was obviously renovated in the 80's and not updated since then. It was clean with spacious rooms. Not much wrong with it but nothing really interesting either. It's time to overhaul this landmark hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a great deal !”
Reviews.Author: Scouser-Sue
Reviews.Content: We 4 nights at the King Edward during our holiday in Canada. Checking in was smooth and when I enquired about an upgrade (we had booked through an offer so knew our room was going to be one of the less expensive ones) Jing on Reception was happy to explain that if we paid $75 per night we would then be eligible for Club Lounge class . As this included a junior suite, all day coffee, free wifi access, continental breakfast each day and snacks and drinks (wine, beer, soft drinks) every day at 5.30pm - we decided to go for it. It was well worth the money and having a suite made our stay perfect. The location is great. Whereas the Four Seasons, Hyatt and Marriott are way up the top of Yonge St area, the King Edward is well placed for the shopping area, access to the PATH,the lake front area, CN Tower and the old DIstillery and St Lawrence market areas. You can pay much more to stay at the others but we thought we had great value and a great location for less money, even with the cost of the upgrade !

Reviews.Title: “Deppressing, tired and worn-out: avoid”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTravel88
Reviews.Content: Checked in one rainy night into a small, dark room overlooking an air shaft. Very "The Shining" kind of feeling, if you've seen that horror film. Not nice, and smelled musty. On top of this, the hotel has painfully slow internet service. I mean, we're back to dial-up speeds, although they claim it's DSL. The front desk was very accommodating, but they can't make up for the fact that this is a hotel whose best days are literally decades behind it. Avoid it at all costs if you're a business person looking for get some work done, or a pleasure traveler looking for a fresh and updated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dust and noise of the king”
Reviews.Author: bidibodi
Reviews.Content: well, the building it's great while the location is average.. people at the front desk seem kind but no one thought to advice me regarding the refurbishment in act therefore i woke up at 7 in the morning when the drilling and hammering started believe me it' not at all nice after a long day of work away from home the cleaningness of the place it's also somehow a matter on the frist day the tv wasn't working properly and when the maintenance man come and turned the tv I discovered that no one had dusted on the back since very long time. Very disappointing! also the room smells of rotten humidity

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but rooms feel dated”
Reviews.Author: Laurenkarl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work so did not have a chance to enjoy all of the amenities but had a good experience none the less. The rooms seem a little dated to me (lots of chintz) but were large and well appointed. Beautiful lobby and bar area.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: mmvmm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago, and it had deteriorated into a sad state of shabbiness. Risked it again, and this time it had clearly been renovated. Clean, immaculate. Lots and lots of space, and exceedingly comfortable. Location excellent. Comfort level high.

Reviews.Title: “Faded Glory”
Reviews.Author: ACanadianAbroad
Reviews.Content: The "King Eddie" is showing it's age. The room we had (2 queens) was huge but the carpet was very worn as were the furnishing. Price wise we had an incredible deal so I wasn't too perturbed by the room's lack of decor. The staff was very helpful and courteous but they initially refused to let us split the payment for a 2 night stay between my sister and I. The receptionist claimed it could not be done?

Reviews.Title: “great old world hotel”
Reviews.Author: jochenm
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a weekend, celebrating a special occasion and were very impressed. The hotel on the web actually looks less impressive than in reality. It is upgraded and modernized where needed (i.e. elevators and bathrooms) but still has the charm of a hundred year old hotel. Very friendly staff, great junior suite with view over Toronto, and all the amenities youâ€™d expect from a 4 star hotel. Sure, there are many more modern and upscale places in Toronto these days, but the mix of old and new is hard to find. Location is perfect for downtown visitors. The concierge even suggested to park in a public garage one block east, as the hotel charges $45 for valet but the public garage only $6 on the weekend. The Spa is also great â€“ and very popular; book early.

Reviews.Title: “Why here?”
Reviews.Author: Trackie67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as an spg member for location. I travel a lot in north america and europe and This is far and away the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Sad, old, musty, decrepit, forgotten. Staff know it. I can't imagine why spg bothers. Fairmont knows how how to to make an old horse brilliant, spg just let's it rot. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sluzby
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the King Edward more than once and each time my stays were excellent. The rooms are nice and very quiet, during each stay I was unable to hear outside noise. The breakfast at the hotel was very good and the service in the restaurant was amazingly friendly and attentive. The bellmen always greeted us warmly and were friendly. I've only had one issue during my stay and it was solved to my satisfaction by maintenance staff. After my good experiences here, I recommended this hotel to my friends for a wedding block and the King Edward did not disappoint. I wish parking and Internet were free (or at least less expensive), but I understand it is normal for hotels of this caliber to charge. Overall, a fantastic hotel I would return to again (and certainly look forward to visiting again!)

Reviews.Title: “Time for refurbishment; excellent service though”
Reviews.Author: YeVoyage
Reviews.Content: A rather tired grande dame. No wifi in rooms, bathrooms, style is outdated and worn. Exemplary service from the staff easily make this the best Starwood property in town. Now to revitalize the lobby and bring in a decent restaurant - sad to see the ornate Cafe Victoria reduced to a banquet room - used to be THE power breakfast spot.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: haggisCanada
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Meridien King Edward in September 2011,i cannot say enough good things about my stay, the sevice was the best , the staff could not do enough for us, the location was right were we wanted to be, close to everything.Mark Crooks who is the director of front office, made our stay the best i have had in a while, keep up the great work mark.i rate this Hotel 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: heng h
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel twice in Sept. First 3 nites in room 1119, and then 4 nites in 1121. The hotel is elegant. Worth the stay on the club floors. Staff were pleasant and quite helpful. Would stay again. Had issues with the room, could have been handled more quickly, but all was good in the end. The bed in room 1119 was not comfortable at all, but room 1121 made up for it. The space in 1121, is well worth it. As others have mentioned, it is centrally located. Big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: JMComerford
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while I was in Toronto for business. The hotel was nice. Very clean. THe room was not huge - but I was alone so it didn't matter. The bed was not that comfortable. Normally I love business travel and getting a king size bed to myself but this one had a lump in the middle. The other weird thing was that the lights in the bathroom were not very bright. I ended up getting ready in the mirror above the desk as much as I could because the light was barely sufficient in the bathroom. I didn't get a chance to check out the amenities of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb mix of old and new”
Reviews.Author: Aalife
Reviews.Content: The hotel was spectacular! It had a great mix of older architecture and detailing with the comfort of newer luxury. It was in a great location downtown in Toronto and everything we wanted to do was within walking distance. The service was great too!!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: xforce
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night to attend a trade show. Rooms were huge, the 10ft ceilings gave a great sense of space and 3 large windows gave a lot of light. Rooms are dated (I don't think floor to ceiling floral drapes with swags and jabot'sare still in style, but they are fitting in this hotel). Great central location, and service at front desk, housekeeping and concierge was fantastic! Fun to step back into a more elegant time for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Historical and elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: omd17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the King Eddy for one night this summer..Redeemed Starwood Preferred Guest cash and points which was a great deal at $60. Had a very good experience. Service at the front desk was friendly and efficient. The lobby is very elegant, located in the lobby is the Consort Bar, which is a comfortable place to enjoy a drink. The room was very spacious and comfortable, with classic furniture. Location is in the financial district.. reasonable walking distance to many attractions in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: howardsenduk
Reviews.Content: While parts of Le Meridien, King Eddie, could do with a bit of updating, the service provided by Syreeta, Baz and Hector was first class and more than made up for one or two little hiccups we experienced. We would certainly recommend this hotel, and would stay there again. The tourist buses stop right outside and the PATH system entrance is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanikaH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the King Edward for the second time this week. This hotel is wonderful: cozy, elegant, with comfortable rooms that are large for a hotel of this age. Bed + pillows amazing as always with Le Meridien hotels. But the best feature of this hotel is the incredibly friendly and welcoming staff. They are polite and helpful, and always make me feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: MarakiOttawa
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at this hotel for a conference and I was stunned to see how run down it is. The hallways, the rooms need a major reno. My room was dirty (there were crumbs on the night stand) and I didn't realize until after my shower that there were no towels! I was surprised at the size of the room though: very big. All the gym equipment except for 2 elliptical machines are from the dinosaur ages. The only good thing about this hotel is that the food they served was very good. I would never go back to this hotel if I had a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: amazed43
Reviews.Content: Lobby is elegant, and rooms are very comfortable and attractive. Bathrooms updated despite the fact that the hotel is quite old. Concierge and door men especially helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not one complaint.....”
Reviews.Author: markcarla
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and i stayed here and had an amazing time. The service was top notch, the room was large, clean and well kept and the food was great. The personality of the hotel was grand with great architecture. I would most definitely stay here again. Seems to be a popular place for weddings too.

Reviews.Title: “Top shelf service!”
Reviews.Author: RESlyder
Reviews.Content: Customer service. Customer service. Customer service! These guys are as good as it gets in that dept. The hotel itself has a classic, regal feel, along with some general quirkiness. The room layouts are sometimes a little random, but anything that might throw you off about the decor, layout, etc, they make up for with an excellent staff that does everything they can to make your stay enjoyable. We have come to Toronto a lot for business, and always make a point to make a reservation at the King Eddie! The cocktail lounge in the lobby is a great place to unwind after a long day. Stefano makes a mean gin gimlet!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of 'time gone by' in downtown Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: SBA-NYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the feel of a century ago - perhaps the portrait of King Edward VII hanging over the fireplace helps. If you're looking for trendy, this isn't it, although the wireless access in the lobby helps. But it's beautiful & comfortable with a polite & attentive staff. I had a large, sun-filled room that was twice the size of my NY apt and it was at the end of a hallway so very quiet. It is right downtown which makes it convenient to tourist sites, theatre district and a walk or short taxi ride to Toronto's gay "village" area. I'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “grand hotel at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: jan6494
Reviews.Content: We have just visited toronto for the second time and stayed at the King edward. we booked through a travel site and got an excellent price. Check in was quick and we were upgraded a room at no extra cost. Our room was very clean and of a decent size. Although we were a little disappointed at the absence of tea and coffee making facilities, we could have ordered through room service but found it a little expensive. Luckily there were plenty of coffee shops in the area. The location of this hotel is excellent for sight seeing and business alike. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful grand old hotel”
Reviews.Author: reotton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Toronto to deliver our son to university. We chose the "King Eddy" based in part on its rating by TripAdvisor. We made the reservation through a travel rewards program, which offered us a fantastic rate. The hotel was lovely. We had ordered a cot for our son, for the night before moving him into his university residence. Upon check-in our room was immediately upgraded for free to a larger room, which gave us more than ample space for the cot. We were delighted with room, service, comfort, and cleanliness of the hotel--all impeccable. Calls to the front desk were usually answered on the first ring. Miscellanceous requested items (our son's toothbrush was packed in the car, at the bottom of everything he'll need for the year!) were delivered promptly to our room. The valet parking worked flawlessly. The one meal we had in the restaurant (breakfast) was very nice. The only mis-step was slight understaffing in the restaurant that morning (Labour Day Monday), which we gathered from the lone waitress was a combination of unexpected absences and the expectation that it would not be a busy day. Despite handling a large dining room on her own, she was very gracious, and made breakfast a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: maggiestravels
Reviews.Content: The room was large and very clean. The bed and pillows were so comfortable. The only complaint I would have to be that their "business center" was right smack in the middle of the lobby, and usage was not free. But overall, very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not friendly reception”
Reviews.Author: Marco3354
Reviews.Content: I was there for a business trip while we had a workshop there, few times I asked about wake up call and they forgot...After I left they charged me big ammount of money on my credit card when I asked them to check my room while I was having breakfast... Would not recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Decieving”
Reviews.Author: Kooche
Reviews.Content: Hey, went to the King Edward never being to Toronto and having read a few reviews for the price I thought we'd try it. We were very pleased with Hotel itself, it is gorgeous and the location was top notch for everything. The rooms were large and the beds/pillows were very comfy. Try it, I would definately go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Elegance in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: RMORTON
Reviews.Content: This is where you will find the true colonial elegance and service befitting this remnant of the British Empire.
