From the moment of your warm welcome at the doorway, you will experience personal service of the highest caliber. The rooms are excellent, spotless and well appointed. The restaurant is first class. The bar is a place to bring friends and business associates for a drink or for a lighter delicious meal. Try the traditional English afternoon tea for a regal colonial experience. The hotel is well situated for the business district of Toronto. This is not your every day North American hotel! Experience true quality.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service of any hotel in the city!”
Reviews.Author: c l
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and I have stayed at the King Edward many times as it is centrally located to the financial district where I work. This weekend was special in that my wife joined me, (her first time visiting) and we stayed to view the sites around the city. I asked the Concierge for ideas, and Vanessa, at the desk, helped reserve a bus tour that was the highlight of our weekend. You can â€˜hop on hop offâ€™ and see the best of Toronto including the Ontario Museum, CN Tower, and other great places to shope and dine. We had a fantastic experience and it was all due to Vanessa and her attention to detail and listening to what we needed. The reason I continue to stay at the King Eddy hotel is for the outstanding service such as this. I highly recommend this hotel as a great place to stay while visiting Canada!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: mapesae
Reviews.Content: Le Meridien was a wonderful stay. Located in the Financial District, it was close to plenty of entertainment, shops, restaurants, and accessible by public transport.

Reviews.Title: “The room was large and very nicely decorated, good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BrabDAveB
Reviews.Content: They only have valet parking so you just pull up to the front of the hotel and they take it from there. Just look for the blue awning

Reviews.Title: “An Old Gem”
Reviews.Author: antitourists
Reviews.Content: I love staying here, but I adore history. I dislike Toronto after living there for years but if I have to go there to show people around I stay here. It's best quality is that it is cheap - don't pay more than $129 per night. The rooms are huge. It doesn't have bedbugs. It's being converted into condos so there is a bit of demoralization in the air, but that doesn't detract from the gorgeous lobby or the super helpful staff. Plus, for tourists, the hotel is at the foot Yonge street and at the King St TTC stop. Walk directly south of the hotel for Pravda Vodka bar and some fun snotty Toronto restaurants. Or walk directly north for trashy tourist food. Win-win.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service.”
Reviews.Author: Visiting22
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with expected upscale feel and service. There are no ice machines on any floor and no robes in the room but they will deliver it upon request. The bathrooms are bit tight and could be more brightly lit. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Wedding Anniversary Surprise”
Reviews.Author: heathermaria33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 2nd wedding anniversary and just LOVED this hotel. From the grand entrance lobby to the most professional and well spoken desk clerk ( I wish I had gotten his name- because he was simply amazing), to a complimentary upgrade to a king suite because it was our anniversary, to the most comfortable bed in the world, to the excellent room service that brought us two forks at 2am with a smile and to a shower that actually has pressure in a hotel. FINALLY, a hotle that truely cares about their guests!!! We loved every minute of our stay and will definitely be staying here again. Too bad I can't say the same about our choice restaraunt "Sultan's Tent"- read my review and you will understand why we will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful building”
Reviews.Author: dwkoontz
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to get a great discounted rate which made this hotel affordable. We also had a friends place where we were able to park the car free (otherwise $40). The room was clean and well appointed. The location was perfect! Easy to access from the QWE. Only minutes walk to shopping, 5 min to the Market, 25 to the Royal Ontario Museum, 20 to the Brewery District. We would definitely go back if we ever go to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Barriemeansbusiness
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Le Meridian King Edward on Labor Day weekend with our adult children and spouses. We had 3 rooms on the 7th floor. The rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Everything we needed was there. The beds were extremely comfortable and we had an excellent nights sleep. You just cant beat the location of this hotel for any downtown activities. Yes the Hotel is historic and was at one time Toronto's place to be. The glory days are gone but the hotel is charming and clean. Lots of elevators seem to run very efficiently - never waited more that a few seconds for an elevator. We parked in the valet at the hotel. The cost was $40. with unlimited in and out privileges. I think our only complaint was that on sunday it took about 25 minutes to get our car. We did call ahead but somehow our request got lost in the shuffle. Mistakes happen - it didn't ruin our opinion of the hotel or its friendly helpful staff. We got a great price on the room and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. We didn't use any of the hotels restaurants or bars so cant comment on other services. Tim Hortons is conveniently located across the street for morning coffee and we dined at the Beer Bistro which is also across the street which was excellent and reasonably priced. I would definitely recommend this hotel to tourists and travelers. There is internet available for a charge. Frankly I really don't understand why some hotels don't jump on the wireless bandwagon and just provide this service to its guests for no charge. More hotels provide it for free than not. This could be a deciding factor for some business travelers choosing not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friedly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: DaMaTravel
Reviews.Content: Most of the sightseeing items are in walking distance. The hotel is near to the underground station and 10 minutes walk from the main station.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, e'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Mary11569
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very busy with a conference at the time we wanted to stay, We were helped with complicated reservation by Pearl, and were thrilled with the room & service. The staff is exceptional. Beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The club bar!!”
Reviews.Author: 2AJ
Reviews.Content: The king eddie (to use the Canadian name) is a fantastic old school classy hotel. The rooms are huge, the service is very good. The bar staff were very attentive and personable. If you get the chance the club bar is well worth it. Offering free drinks and snacks daily( including breakfast) which is exceptional. This should be considered due to expensive nature of downtown Toronto!! We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Service and amenities did not live up to class”
Reviews.Author: aelysium
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that's a category 5 class in the Starwoods portfolio, and the reputation, I was disappointed in the amenities offered, the customer service, and the housekeeping. There is no toiletry kit; the concierge did not listen and is not knowledgeable; and the housekeeping inadequate. It's a great location, but for the price, it's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nice and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: sep65
Reviews.Content: well located, nice, quiet and comfortable hotel friendly staff, good room service very well location - close to harbour and city center

Reviews.Title: “Tired overated hotel that does not live up to 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: leesh96
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel on Priceline at a very aggressive rate since we wanted to stay in downtown Toronto for a couple of nights on a mini-getaway without kids. We have many friends in Toronto and when we told them that we were staying in the King Edward, they all told us how it was "6 star" hotel and how it represented the royalty of Toronto. When we pressed our friends for more detail none of them could vouch for these rumors with first hand accounts. Anyway, despite that, our expectations were elated. When we first arrived through the large revolving door, we were beholden with an opulent lobby that one would expect in a four star traditional hotel - similar to what one see in a classic Ritz-Carlton or Fairmont hotel. One thing was visibly absent however...the staff, customers and the typical hustle and bustle of this class of hotel. Strange but we didn't think much of it until later on. Check in was prompt and courteous if nothing special and we were assigned to a king bed room on the 6th floor. The room was not large but was comfortable enough for the two of us. It was reasonably clean but one could tell that it was a very old hotel that has been refurbished multiple times in attempts to stay competitive. In any case, it was in the bathroom, I had my first surprise...plastic disposable cups! Normally I don't care about these things but it certainly reflects badly on a supposed "4-star" hotel. Just not expected in such a venue...It just makes me wonder, what other corners are they cutting? The shower water pressure was strong and the provided toiletries were of decent quality. The bed was decent with a thin pillow top layer and I was able to get a good night's sleep on it...at least until 8AM in the morning when we were woken to a very loud drilling noise which seemed to happen 1 wall away from our room! First of all, who starts this so early in the morning when some people are obviously still sleeping? Second of all, why didn't they put a notice or sign in the lobby about this construction or at least tell us about it during check in? Finally, why did they even put us anywhere near the construction? Upsetting and unacceptable to say the least. It also happened on both mornings of our stay! On the multiple trips up in and out of the hotel, I can safely say that they must run their hotel very short staffed since I didn't see too many folks too often in the lobby including at the concierge. They obviously couldn't afford the staff to do an evening turn down service as well which is typical of many 4-star hotels. In conclusion, this hotel is average at best and needs to work on it's communication and perception to its customers. I would safely re-categorize this hotel as a 3-star and certainly dispel any myths about "5 or 6 stars!"

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: samisamisami
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two nights. All I can say is that this hotel is clean, comfortable, and beautiful. The bed is huge (king). very very comfortable, the bathroom is clean and very nice. Staff very friendly and helpful. the parking is expensive, but if you go and park right next to the hotel it would be MUCH MUCH cheaper. DO NOT PARK AT THE HOTEL it is VERY EXPENSIVE.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Wonderful, Accomodations Weak”
Reviews.Author: sazanneannne
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from participating in a Mirvish Theatre package which included a night at The King Edward. Having done this in June (where everything was terrific) I was so looking forward to a repeat experience. Let me preface this by stating that the staff on call during the afternoon, evening hours was wonderful, however......... as my travelling companion is claustrophobic and unable to get into elevators I had requested a room on a lower floor ( I am also a Starwood member). Upon signing in we were given our room cards for the 6th floor. I took the luggage and my friend proceeded up the stairwells. I reached the designated room and found my card did not work. Returning to the front desk "Toya" proceeded to check again and issue me new cards, back to the room I went. This time I got in with no difficulty...But..imagine my surprise when I found not only a suite, but rooms obviously occupied. I quickly retreated and returned to the front desk. Toya was very concerned and rechecked the envelopes which had been prepared earlier in the morning. We both agreed that the room number was written as 678. However, then we tried 673 and it was up and running. Now my concern is regarding safety. Obviously the staff member who processed this room on the morning shift needs guidance in penmanship. Due to his/her carelessness that room could have been robbed! It did make me think twice about room security in the future. My friend navigating the stairwell did notice that perhaps a little sweeping would be helpful. We realize that this is mainly a fire route or staff access stairwell but there may well be other patrons who can not take an elevator who would need to take the stairs. As to the room itself, I was so surprised. Unlike my room in June this time the broadloom definitely needed a good cleaning, as did the stains on the chairs. Also, while we were out at the theatre the air conditioning broke. Upon our return we spoke to "Oscar" who was very apologetic---as there were no other rooms on this muggy evening he did arrange for two fans to be sent to the room. Oscar also offered us a complimentary breakfast in the lounge but upon realizing it was on the 11th floor ( which in the morning would have been quite a trek up the stairs and down) he changed it to room service. He was in an awkward position and we did appreciate his apology and graciousness. I do hope to return but I will be concerned about the security as well as hoping for one of the more updated and 'fresher' rooms in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Toronto hotel”
Reviews.Author: darrennelson
Reviews.Content: I stay here quite often while in Toronto depending on their rates. The hotel is in a great location as many state on here (lots of restaurants, close to subway). I like the King Edward because, yes, it is a little dated though still a nice smaller boutique alternative to the Sheraton and other large hotels. The service is fantastic and the rooms (though older) are nice, and many are quite spacious. I have used the lounge (as a platinum member) and it is OK ... not as good as some of the Starwood lounges and probably would not suggest paying for it. The restaurant in the lobby had good food (though a little pricey); I went there tonight for dinner for the first time (Soup, dinner and one beer = $53 CDN). I would suggest to look at the SPG website as the prices change quite often. My last three trips have ranged in price from $99-$169 per night ... the regular rack rate can be quite higher. Overall, if you can get a good rate, I would highly recommend this hotel over many of the other options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: yelsel71
Reviews.Content: I actually booked this on priceline and saved a bundle but this place is so nice I'd pay regular price to stay again. The rooms were massive, really high ceilings with tall windows. We actually had two rooms the adjoined with friends. Our room was a king and theirs was two doubles, both different looking and had comfortable beds. Its a very classy hotel but without all the modern flare that some hotels have.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, would definitely return at rate paid”
Reviews.Author: nemorino79
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and having read the mixed reviews, we were a bit apprehensive. On the other side, our rate was just 130,- CAD per night including tax. As previous reviewers have stated, the King Edward hotel is probably past it's prime and an update of the guest-rooms and of public spaces might be a good idea, so if you want a state-of-the-art top-luxury hotel, look elsewhere and be prepared to pay much more. Taking into account our room-rate, our experience at the King Edward was excellent: The lobby is classic and impressive and must have been even more elegant before they put the internet-station smack in the middle of it. Check-in was smooth and friendly, our room very spacious, clean and nicely appointed, showing only minor signs of wear and tear. The bed was maybe a little too soft for us. We noticed that the door to the corridor as well as the connecting door to another guest room were not very well sound-proofed but fortunately, there was no noise in the corridor and the family next door switched off their tv soon and went to bed early (hope they had a good sleep as well as we were jet-lagged and got up at 4am to a good long shower). Internet access was rather expensive as expected and other extras (room-service, breakfast, parking) probably would have been expensive as well, but due to the excellent location of the hotel you can get everything you need nearby and at better prices, if only you are prepared to walk a few steps. Also, a subway-station is conveniently located just one block away which greatly improved our sightseeing-range. On our last day, a very nice girl at the front-desk kindly let us have our room until almost 4 pm so that we could thoroughly enjoy our lunch at nearby Canoe restaurant and then come back, change and pack. Special thanks for that. At the rate we paid, the King Edward provided excellent value and we would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: tjonesbari
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. The location is unbeatable and the amenities are incredible. The rooms are impeccably appointed; spacious, comfortable and quiet. The lobby is grand, elegant but perfectly fine for intimate conversation. I would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the great city of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stellar experience.”
Reviews.Author: ZoDMeister
Reviews.Content: My stay at the King Street, Toronto facility was nothing less than a stellar experience. And the highlight of this experience was a gentleman staff member by the name of LauMing. His good character, kindness and attention to detail was exemplary. In fact, he has set the standard for what service excellence means to me, which has resulted in my intention to stay with the Le Meridien on all future visits to Toronto. Allan Gaudette

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable classic”
Reviews.Author: MarkTwain1910
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four days on a business trip. Excellent location and comfortable room. The only drawback was LeRoyal Club. It is offered for $75 at check-in. Be sure you understand that it is $75 per night. It offers access to the Club Lounge where a continental breakfast is served in the morning and snacks in the afternoon along with free internet access. Unfortunately, I found it to not be worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “very nice but.. no wi-fi in room and extremely expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: Mauri-e-Paola
Reviews.Content: perfect position in center of town, tastefully styled, quick check in, the size of room was more that we expected, everybody looks professional and extremely kind but.. couldn't believe when discovered there was no wi-fi internet connection in my room and fee for car parking is pretty "out of thread" ok we are in Toronto down town, ok we're talking about a real 4 stars hotel but 40bugs is next to a steal

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joey965
Reviews.Content: I am sitting at the airport waiting for my flight as I checked out this afternoon after a 5 day stay at the King Edward. My husband had 2 days of business and we had a wedding over the weekend and this hotel made our stay delightful. As I approach my sixties, my top three desires in a hotel are a great bed/pillows, a shower with fabulous water pressure and a cool room. This hotel more than delivered on all three. Best bed, linens and pillows! I know some of the other reviews talked about their room being too cool, but we had a suite and there was a thermostat control in each room so I had full control over the temperature. The concierges were wonderful and helped me plan my two days out solo while hubby worked. We had breakfast in the restaurant 2 days and the food was wonderful. Everyone we came into contact with at this hotel was desiring to please. Our only negative comment was about the club lounge (we are platinum members) due to the fact that I went in their on two separate days to get some water and soda but the refrigerator was empty. On the second day I called down and to their credit they sent up to our room a bucket off ice filled with water and soda. Very classy. The only other comment is that they do not have wireless in the room, only a hookup. I only travel with my iPad so that was a little inconvenient. The other negative comments on this site were about their rooms being worn down. Ours was defintely not. It was lovely and very clean. Thotel was super and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if you get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: cherryghost13
Reviews.Content: Great location, competent and friendly staff. Room was nice, but not outstanding. Very comfortable bed, nice tv. We used our AAA rate which was $129/night. Reasonable for location

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Iambells
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline. I had read mixed reviews and was fairly nervous as a result. However, I had no reason to worry. The hotel was great and the staff even better. Upon check-in, we were given a Deluxe King instead of a Deluxe Queen, which is what we really wanted. The staff were extremely helpful from the folks at the front desk to the concierge, housekeeping, and the doormen. Our room was clean and fairly spacious. I agree that the rooms could use some updating, but they were still very nice, and we really enjoyed our stay. The only negatives over the course of our stay, were of course, lack of free internet access and the cost of valet parking. We visited a nearby Starbucks each am for internet access, and parked at a public lot which was about 2 blocks away for half of the valet price. So, with that in mind, I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The best in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: Geekontherun
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel originally to complete my Starwood bonus. I planned on staying one night and extended my stay. It is truly magnificent, the service is impecable, they have EVERYTHING you could ask for! It is a beautiful historic hotel that is just as gorgeous inside with old world service. If you are driving you do have to valet park (there is a parking lot next to the hotel but I would not bother. Pull in anywhere on the side of the building on king street and mid way you will find the bellman and they will take your luggage from the car along with the keys. I checked in, i did get upgraded and headed up to my room which was amazing! It reminded me of the Biltmore hotel in Coral Gables. I got an amazing amenity for my status a fruit and cheese platter. The room is beautifully done on the inside and has a separate living space that you can close off the bedroom and entertain! They have a mini fridge in the room with sodas and on top snacks and wine. They bring up plenty of water (free). I love the fridge so if you get hungry in the middle of the night or check in late you can snack :) The hotel food is amazing with a menu that can satisfy every member of the family. They do have high tea you can make same day reservations with the concierge and I was able to do so on a holiday weekend! They do have a spa onsite with all the services including hair! This is the first one that I have been at that has a hair salon (OMG)! There is a concierge lounge (Royal Club Lounge) and it is open weekends unlike the states! It is close to shopping, restaurants, any events you could be attending. I could not find a negative of this hotel at all even if I tried....I WILL BE BACK HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing old world elegance”
Reviews.Author: gourmand47
Reviews.Content: We were going to Toronto for my son's wedding, and this hotel was chosen by my in-laws for all of our guests. Of course, we did get a special rate, but it is a little pricier than a hotel we might stay in normally. That being said, it was one of the best experience we have ever had in a hotel. Just walking into the lobby is wonderful, and if you are in the area, do that just for the experience. You are taken back to a more tranquil and splendid era, when gentlemen and ladies took high tea, and enjoyed the more genteel lifestyle. The rooms are enormous, with elegant furnishings and high ceilings, still having modern amenities like TV, WiFi, etc. The hotel is extremely clean, and well maintained. There is a nice restaurant and bar off the lobby, but there are a plethora of restaurants in the neighborhood. The King Eddie, as the locals call it, has a wonderful concierge service that will gladly give you a map of the area and direct you to anyplace you would like to go and how to get there. We parked the car at the hotel, it was a bit pricey at 20 dollars a day, that was for valet service, just in case we wanted the car. You could park more cheaply at parking lots within a block or two of the hotel. All in all, we really loved the King Edward, for it's elegance, service and comfort. It would be high on the list when returning to downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Convenient, and Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: BillyinNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the King Edward for three nights for a friend's wedding and had an enjoyable stay. The hotel staff is nice and professional, the lobby area was clean and attractive, free coffee in the lobby each day, with snacks for guests. The room was traditionally decorated, fairly large, and the bed was extremely comfortable! It was a quiet night's stay as well, and the hotel is located to some good eating options--love the Swiss market/self-serve restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Carly17
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 2 nights at Le Meridien King Edward in July. We were in Toronto for a wedding and wanted to be less than a $10 cab ride away from the venue and weren't all that picky about the hotel, so we booked it through Hotwire. It was a steal! We arrived at the hotel at around 1 AM on Thursday night, exhausted and ready to sleep anywhere, and when we walked into the lobby we instantly perked up. It's beautiful, open, and feels quite grand. We went to the front desk, and the gentleman who checked us in was very friendly. He tapped away on his computer for a little while, and apologized that it was taking longer than usual as he was trying to find the "best room available" for us. Having booked through Hotwire, I didn't expect the royal treatment or anything, so I was willing to wait. He ended up upgrading us to a suite! It was lovely. It was huge, with a spacious seperate living room, walk in closet, big bathroom with a soaker tub, and a seperate bedroom with a king sized bed. We wanted to order room service but it was quite pricey, $26 (+ tax, tip, and delivery) for a standard bacon and egg breakfast, so we opted to go out instead. The location was awesome, I used an app on my phone to find a good breakfast place, and there were tons of great restaurants around. We had breakfast, walked to the St. Lawrence Market, and then spent a little time on Yonge Street before getting ready for the wedding. It was wonderful! I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JamieDenise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel extensively...and we are very impressed with the character of this hotel and the excellent service offered by the staff members

Reviews.Title: “Okaaay”
Reviews.Author: Kumiko72
Reviews.Content: The best I can say about this hotel is that the doorman who took my car, gave me directions, and secured me a cab was awesome! The rest of the hotel stay was lacking in alot of things. First off, there are no directions indicating that if you turn off Jarvis, you will have to drive quite a bit to find a street to get onto the other side of the road during check-in hours (which are rush-hours). My room was really nice but FREEZING COLD though (there were no temperature controls so it was NOT pleasant being in 17 degree temps), the bed was heavenly, but in the morning, upon waking, I realized the room didn't have any coffee! I should have checked better but I was under the assumption that all 4+ star hotels would have coffeemakers in room and temperature controls! Another shocker was waking up to find the bill under my door and realizing parking cost.... $45 dollars per night!?!?!?!?!?! Oh well. Lesson learned! Would be a great place to stay if you don't have high expectations and don't mind hiking to Starbucks down the street when you wake up...

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite jewel in the centre of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: johannabertin
Reviews.Content: The Meridien King Edward is an old fashioned hotel offering comfort, location, good food and impeccable service - all so often missing in hotels today. My room was attractive, spacious, and light. The hotel restaurant was reasonable priced and had attractively served meals of good food. There is a spa on site - a welcome addition when travelling. All the staff were courteous and efficient. The lobby is worth a visit just for the delight of it's architecture and the talking elevator was entertaining!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a Princess”
Reviews.Author: jcassells
Reviews.Content: one of my best experiences for business travel. Staff was very courteous and i got everything i needed. Please keep up the good work and your continued focus on guest satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Big city hotel with a boutique-like charm”
Reviews.Author: Steve_MC_2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for business in the hottest part of July. Staff was super-friendly and very professional. Guest Services Manager saved my bacon as I had not reserved for my second night. Although he had a full house and could have booked my room, he gave me a call and helped me sort things out.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant”
Reviews.Author: keithoflondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I read of a deal with Mirvish productions for dinner out, the musical Billy Elliott and a night at Le Meridien King Edward Hotel. We were warmly welcomed by the doorman who took our bags. The desk staff were very attentive (we had early check in reserved). Our large room was very well appointed and the airconditioning was much appreciated. There are many wonderful amenities to this grand old hotel. After the play we retired to bed, a very comfortable bed. Room service in the morning brought a very delicious and substantial breakfast. We stayed at inn in Picton recently that could learn about service and food preparation and presentation from this hotel. We hated to check out and return home, but we will return.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back soon”
Reviews.Author: Marie154996
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by Chris the door man he was very friendly and kind very nice smile. While they parked my car we went to the front desk to check in. Michael at the front desk was very helpful any questions we had he answered with a smile. The King Edward is such a beautiful Hotel you can't help but look up and all around when you walk into the hotel and they have a lounge that is so peaceful and relaxing that once your in there you don't want to leave. All I know is that I want to go back there over and over again. In the morning we ordered room service and we were told that it might take a little longer because it was mothers day and they were sold out for mothers day bruch but they brought our food up to our room on time it only took 20 minutes, I think that's great service. Oh and I can't forget Mark the front deak manager what a sweet man he greeted us with a big smile and asked us if everything was ok and if we needed anything to just call. Now that was great service.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and in need of a renovation.”
Reviews.Author: global84
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite at the King Edward last week. The hotel has great potential, however, it is completely dated and in need over a major renovation. All aspects of the hotel (with the exception of the lobby bar) are generic and mundane. The room that I stayed in was very, very dark, lacked wifi, and was filled with 1980's / early 90's hospitality furniture. All was not lost as the staff is friendly and attentive but if you are visiting Toronto please consider a different hotel ie Thompson*, Inter-Continental, or Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great historical property with superb service”
Reviews.Author: Runner821
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to travel to Toronto--one of the world's most diversely populated cities. After considering hotel possibilities, we decided to stay at the the King Edward--largely because of its amenities and a great price on a prepaid room. (I love older hotels, and my decision was guided by this preference.) We stayed in a large executive suite with a king bed, sofa, chair, desk, and entertainment chest among other features. Service was exemplary. Any and all requests were met rapidly and graciously. The only shortcomings were the lack of premium television channels and quite expensive wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: caity9228
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the King Edward - Le Meridien in Toronto for business and yet again have found the service to be outstanding and the accommodations immaculate. The staff truly go out of their way to make sure everything is seeming-less and surpasses guests' expectations. It is certainly a 5 Star hotel in my book and I cannot wait to return again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very Tired Decor, Average at Best”
Reviews.Author: caycay_can
Reviews.Content: I`d stayed at the King Edward twice before, and was excited about returning. The five years in-between my stays hasn't been kind to the hotel, and its now a very tired and somewhat dirty looking property. On the plus side, the hotel lobby is gorgeous, and I've always been treated well at the lobby bar. The front desk staff were very attentive when I asked to switch rooms, and my request was handled promptly. On the other hand, you could clearly hear *everything* out in the hallway in my first room, and I was woken up both in the wee hours and early the next morning by other guests and maintenance staff passing by. Both my original room and the second room I was given were well worn, with loose carpeting and stains on the wallpaper. I also tried the on-site spa, and it also looked tired and dated. The waiting area was in particular need of attention, as it looked like someone's old (and dirty) living room couch and chairs was used in the waiting area. I was excited to stay here, but now I'm pretty sure I won't be back. I booked directly with the hotel (instead of a discount booking site), so paid hansomely for what I thought was a premium hotel. I will most certainly look around at other hotels before returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised!!!!”
Reviews.Author: likeditalot
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely wonderful stay at The Meriian King Edward Hotel from July 7th-July 10th, 2011. I'd booked with Hotwire.com and got an unbelievable rate for such a beautiul, high quality hotel. After booking, I read some of the reviews and found that they were quite mixed so I was a little apprehensive about what to expect. When we arrived the staff was very attentive and helpful and much to our delight they had upgraded us to a Deluxe King Room. It was huge and very nicely decorated with a beautiful big bathroom and 2 flat screen tvs We felt like royalty. As it was our honeymoon, I had requested a small fridge and a coffee maker for our room, both of which were there when we arrived. The only disappointing thing was the parking, it's very expensive but there are several local garages where you can leave your car safely at a third of the cost. I would highly recommend the Meridian King Edward to anybody, we will definately return on our next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been so much better”
Reviews.Author: cumulus96
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel towards the end of out first visit to Canada and stayed for 4 nights in a deluxe room. Our room was very large but furnishings were rather tired with ill fitting carpet, tiny closet and what turned out to be noisy air conditioning - no veiw. We were also very tired at this time and so decided not to request another room, just settling for more storage which was provided. Probably a mistake. We had generally found service in Canadian hotels to be very good but our experience at King Edward was disappointing and we felt that they did not really cater well for our (non- business) needs. We were billed for DVDs not wached and dreadful room service coffee- these chrges were removed on request. Although the central location was good, we would not choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff at an Old, Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDatYVR
Reviews.Content: Saw a few poor reviews about the Le Meridien King Edward and thought to clarify that it's really not that terrible. Nothing to really complain about, but also nothing to write home about. Stayed in July in a Club Level Queen-sized room, so internet (wi-fi) was complimentary. The service overall was great - check-in/out was fast and efficient, while room service staff was prompt and polite. Although the doormen may need to be reminded that they are there to assist guests with luggage up and down the stairs, as opposed to standing and staring while I struggled with my bags. My room was on the 10th floor facing an internal courtyard. When the elevator door opened on the 10th floor, the hallway was stuffy and hot, as there was no air conditioning or air flow of any sort. The room itself was spacious with a seating area, large walk-in closet, work desk and queen-sized bed. While the decor matched the majestic-feel that it was trying to convey, I can't help but notice that the wall paper and paint were peeling, the carpet was old and certain furniture could use some repair. There is no central light switch; rather, you have to switch each lamp on in order to get sufficient light at night. The bathroom was standard - nothing to rave or complain about. However, the water pressure of the toilet was rather weak, so you have to press down longer to ensure that it completely flushes. The Club Lounge has a great coffee machine and offers continental breakfast from 7 a.m., along with a reception with hors d'oeuvres and wine/beer from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. It's not crowded and is quite convenient for those who need to continue working. If you like older historic hotels, this is on par with the Fairmont Royal York and is also located within walking distance of the Financial District.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and run down”
Reviews.Author: NSEWtraveller
Reviews.Content: King Edward Hotel in Toronto is still ideally situated downtown, especially if you are visiting for a short time and need to see the major banks and broker-dealers. But boy, this hotel is in dire need of a renovation. It's definitely a throw-back at least to the seventies, right down to the musty odor that pervades the place. Hopefully, Le Meridien will see fit to upgrade this property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: courtlwal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on business at Le Meridien King Edward, and it was wonderful! The room was beautiful, large, and very clean, and the staff was extremely kind and accomodating. The location of the hotel is ideal, is within walking distance of most downtown Toronto sights, and across the street from a streetcar stop. If I come back to Toronto for business or vacation, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its best!!”
Reviews.Author: ApKa
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! The rooms are stunning and so timeless! I had the privilege of staying at the King Edward for my wedding night! What a beautiful back drop for my video and pictures! The service was outstanding - the staff is very patient and courteous! I would stay again and again! And get ready for the best sleep of your life - the beds are super comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “My short weekend stay was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: swiftcreek30
Reviews.Content: Wow! I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel this past weekend. It is in an excellent location and you can walk to so many places. My hotel room was so pretty and it looked just like the photos on the website. The room didnâ€™t have a wireless internet connection and HBO though. I know that HBO is a hit and miss sometimes at various hotels but my beloved True Blood was on last night and I really wanted to see it. LOL. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: DFletcher47
Reviews.Content: Recently my friend and I decided to treat ourselves to a weekend in the city, so we chose to stay at the King Edward. Wrong choice. I should have known that it was going to go wrong from check-in. I asked for early check in...showed up room wasn't ready. Come back for the regualr check in time. So we did and had to wait 45 minutes in the lobby. Got to our room finally to notice taht the lighting was awful...you had to crawl over a bed to get to the tiny closet, yo uhad to shower in the dark, and our room had a view of a brick wall. Later we decided to watch some tv..only to be greeted by static. After our day out in the sun, we ordered room service only to have the wrong food sent up. We called back and they said oh yes you didn't order that, we will make a new one, might be 30 minutes. UNACCEPTABLE!!! I thought this was one of the finer hotels in Toronto - I was sadly mistaken.

Reviews.Title: “impressive hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: torontogirl68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the King Edward for one night (July 2). The lobby is very impressive, as is the room we were assigned (1009). The employee who helped us, Jing, was extremely pleasant, ensuring we were given a quiet, spacious room. The room was very tastefully decorated and very clean and the bed was comfortable. The complimentary apples, bottled water and newspaper are wonderful. The location is fabulous and the late check-out of noon is apprecaited. The only drawback is the low water pressure in the shower. We will definitely stay at the King Edward again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome vacation”
Reviews.Author: chocolatetwistcone
Reviews.Content: My husband and i arrived just prior to midnight and were greeted by wonderfully attentive staff, with big smiles and lots of help even though it was quite late. Although we booked under an internet travel special deal, we were also instantly upgraded to an executive suite which was awesome. Huge King bed, 2 bathrooms, living room etc. the bed was soooo comfortable and we had a corner room that was never disturbed by street noise. Although the minibar was locked with a key and you had to call down for it, this wasnt a big deal since we never bothered using it anyways. Internet was wired in the rooms and wireless in the lobby. Although there was an issue with the wired connection, someone came up immediately to fix it and it worked great afterwards. Would definitely recommend this as a great place to stay in downtown Toronto, very close to st. lawrence market, and the harbourfront. We were there at the same time as the IIFA show, and were so very glad we stayed here as opposed to the royal york which was just swarmed with people and crowds. We were able to sample the room service breakfast of bluberry pancakes which were out of this world and came up to the room on a fully laid out portable table. The sunday brunch here is fantastic, hot and cold, separate dessert table, salad table...it was awesome to sit and linger over. highly recommended. Can't wait for my next stay here in fall (already booked!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the staff, their helpfulness and eagerness to accomodate your wishes”
Reviews.Author: snowBoardBunny
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on a Sunday afternoon and the staff were all so very polite, helpful and accomodating. The foyer is spacious and stately. The room was also large, but the window is small. The best things about the hotel are definitely: 1) LOCATION. LOCATION. LOCATION! You can walk to the subway, the Eaton Centre, the streetcar stops, the Tim Horton's or the Starbucks. From an access point of view, it is very convenient. 2) The very friendly staff who went out of there to meet your requests. For instance, my tv remote was working intermittantly. I had to leave the tv on one morning because I couldn't shut it off or change the channels. I called in to have it fixed and when I returned from my morning coffee run, I had a new remote and everything worked as it should. 3) I love the complimentary water bottle and newspaper that they provide daily. The two things I didn't like about the room were: 1) the tv sits in a stand with cabinets opening out and they stay out like flaps or wings, they don't roll back into the cabinet. So this means, you can only watch tv from your bed, as watching from any other angle is impossible due to the cabinet flaps 2) the bathroom is oddly shaped in that the toilet is far from the sink and the toilet paper holder on the far wall. Overall, there are so many more good things about the hotel and staff that I would have no hesitations about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation in returning!”
Reviews.Author: Lochindorb
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Toronto from Niagara Falls at 10:15AM and walked to the hotel which we found conveniently situated for almost everything - 200 yards form the subway station and 20 mins to the shore. Amazingly, the room was ready - a real bonus. Room 905 was very large and delightful with an eastern view - not the best, but quite decent. Everything in order and very comfortable with bags of character. The hotel was in tip-top condition, elegant and gracious. For us the hallmark was the graciousness and politeness of the staff. Whatever the situation was, there was always politeness and this left a good feeling. The concierge/front door reflected this and nothing was too much trouble. These common graces make the difference and create a home-from-home. We took a car to the airport (booked by the hotel) and this was a fixed rate charge of CAD 60.00 which we paid by credit card. No comment on food as the room rate didn't include breakfast. Finally, we found the best rate by booking via the hotel website - CAD 123.00 was great value for money for one night. We would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Horrible Bar”
Reviews.Author: BetterWithWine
Reviews.Content: The King Edward is our very favourite hotel i downtown Toronto. We love the building, it's location, the rooms and the staff. We usually go out for dinner when we are downtown, but last time we were there we were rushed since we were heading to a concert, so we decided to eat in the Consort Bar to save some time. We grabbed a seat and ordered our food and some wine. For the next 15 minutes we sat waiting for our wine. The food came, but still no wine....we saw 3 servers all searching for it but nobody bothered to apolagize for the wait. Since we were already eatting we decided to get their attention and order a different bottle. Again they all started searching. The server finaly came back and apolagized saying that they were out of that bottle also. So we tried to order a class of one of their house wines....guess what, they were out of that also!! We just decided to share a quick glass of the cheapest stuff they had so that we could just have a quick drink and get out of there. The server did offer us free dessert after our show, which was nice, but this really shouldn't have happened in the first place. It's unfortunate that the level of professionalism in the bar doesn't match that of front desk. We will always return to the king eddy, but not again to the consort bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: danicaaa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the King Eddy twice in the last couple of months. I used Priceline.com to book the room, both times it came to just about $100. The staff were amazing, not snotty at all considering they can see where you book from. (Sometimes I get attitude from staff when they see I used a site like priceline or hotwire.) Both times I got a room with two beds. The second time i really lucked out as the room was massive and had two separate rooms for the toilet and the shower. This was perfect as I stayed with 3 other girls and the two powder rooms were a godsend. The beds at the King Eddy are one of the most comfortable of all hotel beds I have ever slept in. The only downside was that our phone started blaring at 5 AM for a wake up call that we didn't order - that sucked, royally. (Pun intended.)

Reviews.Title: “False fire alarms both nights!”
Reviews.Author: tarheelbaby1
Reviews.Content: I just traveled to this hotel on business. We reserved a block of rooms and used the property's conference and dining facilities. While the business event went well, the hotel stay was abysmal. Rooms were outdated and DARK! No in-room Wi-Fi available and very expensive wired connection. No Wi-Fi in conference rooms either. Worst of all, it was impossible to sleep. Both nights, we had a false fire alarm around 4 a.m., which required guests to evacuate in their pajamas. Miserable! While I was understanding the first night, the second night (in a row!) was inexcusable to me. In 14 years of business travel, I have experienced only one false fire alarm -- to have two in two nights was just unacceptable to me. Overall, not a good experience for $300 USD per night. I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Treatment, Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: CJMcHappy
Reviews.Content: From the second you arrive at the famed King Eddy, you know you've come to a special place - right downtown, old world charm and elegance. The valet and check-in process calms you from a long drive, and your room is spacious and very, very comfortable. The Martini Bar is a great place to unwind and the neighborhood is replete with bars and restaurants for every taste.

Reviews.Title: “My two sons and I loved it and plan to stay there whenever we in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ajanietainn
Reviews.Content: From the second we walked into the hotel, we noticed the very friendly approach from the staff. Check-in was a breeze and the entrance was very grand. We had a suite which was even more comfortable than home. We had a problem with the air-con at about 1am and they sent someone up to sort it out strait-away. The breakfast was great, just enough for the day. There is also a fully equipped gym which we used for two of the days, we did not have time though. We were booked in for five days and I would recommend it to anyone traveling especially with children. The restaurant staff were always friendly and accommodating to my children. Great stuff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hellmuti
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this hotel for some years now and it feels like coming home. Everybody is so friendly and professional. It is always a pleasure to see Stefano and his team in the bar, one of the great bars in the world I know. The rooms are very large and comfortable. I spend a lot of time in hotels, mostly Four Seasons... so I am used to very good service and this hotel has it.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, knowledgeabale staff & close to subway”
Reviews.Author: Rudyitis
Reviews.Content: Outstanding customer service! I travel constantly for work and have never experienced such thorough service with a great attitude. Vanessa and Larry in the Concierge dept were extremely helpful. They shared all the popular and local restaurants/hot spots with detailed directions in finding them. My first time in Toronto, and I was getting around like my hometown thanks to them. They were glad to help with kindness and genuine enthusiasm. I was assisted by the manager (Marisol) with my hotel reservations (little challenge related to my employer). She was quick, efficient, and had a great attitude. It was obvious that she's an experienced problem solver. The nearest subway station is less than half a block away. So, NO car rental and NO taxis needed! This was incredibly convenient for me. I've traveled nationally and internationally. I've dealt with many frustrations. I can honestly say this is the first time I experience hotel staff that is thoroughly knowledgeable AND happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel right in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: TouringBuffalo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this place for few nights just to get away from home. This is a great hotel with a lot of character and history to it. Located right in the heart of downtown Toronto. Most centrally located attractions are walkable distance from this hotel. Walks away from the subway entrance as well. The room was well appointed. The staff, including concierge, was very friendly and courteous. Someone was always their to answer your questions or get a cab for you. All rooms may not offer the best view of the city as you may be looking into another building as its in downtown. I felt this was more of a business hotel rather than a romantic getaway place because of its location and the crowd. However, the perception is subjective so different people feel differently. Overall, the hotel is clean, well kept, centrally located, luxurious, and lives up to its reputation of being one of the top ranked hotel in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Toronto Location”
Reviews.Author: JakeSG
Reviews.Content: I travel all the time. I've stayed at this hotel many times. Out of all the hotel's in Toronto, I feel that The King Eddy offers a special touch. Plus, the hotel is in a great area that's convenient to pretty much all of what Toronto has to offer. While all the front desk staff are nice, Yungmi is truly something special. Yungmi always makes you feel like an old friend rather than just simply a guest! She always greets you with the warmest welcoming smile, something that the hotel industry is lacking in nowadays! To be completely honest, if Yungmi wasn't working here, I'd probably stay at another hotel. My only real complaint about this hotel is the bellmen/valet service. Out of all the many times that I've stayed at this hotel, the bellmen are inattentive. My current stay, the bellmen have never even offered to help me with my bags, nor have approached me at my car. I have to get out of my car, walk up the steps, and hand the bellmen my car keys for valet. While they can quite clearly see me, they don't even move a step ( literally). Yesterday morning, when I needed my car, the bellman wasn't even insight. The front desk had to call all over the place to find him. After about 10 mins, the manager went looking for him. All in all, nice hotel, and if you stay, check to see if Yungmi is working and say hi!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment - We waited so long to finally stay here”
Reviews.Author: Los_Hobos
Reviews.Content: Upon checking-in late on a Wednesday night, we were greeted by very friendly hotel staff. Then we were assigned to Room 910, which by anyone's standards was terribly rundown. The room was dimly lit, the carpets were filthy and tattered along the baseboards. The overall appearance of the room was that of an upgraded flop house. Again, the front desk staff were friendly and helpful when we went back to complain. They willingly moved us, but I have to wonder why this room is still being given out in it's current state. Thankfully we were reassigned to room 1553. While this was a cleaner looking room, there was no escaping the obvious fact that the room and the Hotel overall, is outdated, tired and badly in need of a multi-million dollar renovation. What a shame! We used to hear so much about the King Eddy. I only regret that we did not get a chance to stay here during it's Glory Days!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be but good service”
Reviews.Author: London93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the King Edward as part of a wedding. The hotel is showing its age with lackluster furnishings, fittings and amenities. Our first room did not have properly working aircon (and the windows don't open) so we were moved to another room. This room was much smaller than the first so we asked to be moved again and were upgraded to a junior suite without asking and given club level access. After this 3rd room we were finally settled. The hotel does show it's age with very dated bathrooms and furnishings and no wifi or free internet access unless you are club level. Even the communal computers in the lobby ask for a credit card which I find low class. Also, we had to complain on our last night due to a raging party that was happening on our floor. Security promptly took care of it but we had to step over 3 sleeping people outside that room in the hallway when we left for an early flight. WOW. Couldn't believe that one. Toronto has many other great hotels in this price range so next time I'd stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “We love the King Eddy”
Reviews.Author: choptliva
Reviews.Content: This is a classic hotel. If you like the hip feel of a W, you'll hate this place. But if you like old-world charm coupled with modern conveniences, you can't beat the King Eddie. Location is right downtown, though not connected to the underground PATH system (have to walk a block, NDB except when raining or snowing). Valet parking convenient and quick. Very impressive lobby. If you are SPG Platinum, they treat PLTs VERY WELL. I have never failed to get upgraded to a suite here. Lounge access which includes breakfast, drinks during the day, afternoon snack, etc. For some reason, they often have exceptionally good rates. I've often booked rooms well south of $200 a night. For a hotel of this caliber in the downtown core, it's a steal. Beware they don't have many rooms with 2 beds. So if you are traveling with a kid, you will need to make sure you get 2 beds (and the two-bedded rooms are usually just their Deluxe rooms -- lowest level and smallest). I THINK they have one suite with two beds. But they can add in a cot if necessary -- not in Deluxe rooms, I shouldn't think, since they are only about 350 sq ft (to be generous). Rooms all have safes, flat screen TV, internet, etc. But no coffee/tea maker. Beds are very comfy. Hotel is very quiet. When we travel with one of our kids, we usually go to the Royal York and get one of their bigger rooms. But when it's Mrs and me, the King Eddie is our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Tired Out Dated Hotel Experience - no in room wifi!!”
Reviews.Author: Xalec
Reviews.Content: Great location for the financial district is the only reason to stay here. Other than this it is a huge disappointment especially fo a Le Meridien in a major world city. Rooms are old fashioned and shabby which I guess explains why there is no in room wifi! Something I thought any major hotel has to offer nowadays to even be considered. There is wifi in the lobby though that they charge a crazy amount for and then it delivers dial-up speed - awful! I will not be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: anonymous873
Reviews.Content: Live just outside of Toronto so decided to stay after going to an event. Good location. Got a great rate. The rooms are dated but clean. Service was friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Bruch - wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Rachelbp
Reviews.Content: The Location of the hotel is fantastic. Very close to everything downtown. Hotel staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and memorable. The Sunday bruch was the best I've ever had, absolutely fantastic. Our room was large and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is so helpful and kind-makes this hotel a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: tutorpro
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel. Very clean...lobby and rooms were very clean. Front desk staff were so helpful with directions, suggestions and all around great customer service. Chris the doorman could not have been any more helpful in every way- he made this vacation the best with directions, suggestions to where to visit with the family and places to eat. He had the best suggestions and so kind and sincere. he will be missed. Mark the front desk manager was super special and very helpful. He treated us like royality and made our family vacation very special for first timers in Toronto. We sat in the lobby late at night to work on our laptops, enjoying the beauty of the lobby and the friendliness of the staff. We will be back and will tell our family and friends about this beauty. The room was so beautiful and so large..comfortable beds !!!! Apples at the front desk every day !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, established hotel.”
Reviews.Author: melegg
Reviews.Content: The co. I work for had a conference at the hotel. The rooms were nice and big, but mine was an odd shaped - long and narrow. The desk that had the broadband cable - no WiFi in room and broadband is expensive - was in a niche behind the TV so you could not watch TV and work. Lighting in room is very low, only 4-5 lamps in main rooms. Energy efficient bulbs in bathroom took a while to warm up. Overall, a nice hotel with a grand feel. Food was good.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST CLASS HOTEL! EXCELLENT VALUE! WORTH EVERY PENNY!”
Reviews.Author: abellem
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that this hotel is not overly expensive. For what they offer, it is quite affordable. In fact, I feel that I got more than my money's worth. I live in Toronto, but stayed here on the night before my wedding day and used it as a place for my bridesmaids and me to get ready in before the wedding. I also stayed for a second night (my wedding night.) My husband (fiance at the time) and I got two separate rooms and we checked in at 11 at night. Check-in was a breeze as the concierge staff were very competent and professional. They were considerate about the fact that it was the night before our wedding and wanted us to get to our comfortable rooms as soon as possible. My husband requested a full-length mirror to be placed in my suite, and within five minutes of our entering our room, a staff member arrived with the full-length mirror. Wonderful and quick service! My own suite was very clean, spacious and aesthetically pleasing. This was my second time staying at this hotel and the reason why I chose it for my wedding photos is because of the charming decor. The bed was also incredibly comfortable. I was extremely tired all day from running around doing last-minute wedding errands but as soon as I crawled under the covers after a nice hot shower in the well-equipped bathroom, I felt immediately relaxed. The room was also fully stocked with luxurious toiletries. My husband and I returned to my suite after our wedding reception. The next morning I realized that the cover bag for my wedding dress had been lost due to shuffling around and switching rooms. I called the front desk and asked if they had seen a large garment cover bag and they called me back thirty minutes later to inform me that they could not locate my cover bag, but that they would send someone up to give me a replacement bag that I can carry my wedding dress in. I really appreciated that. Had this been a lower-class hotel, the staff would probably not given a care about my lost garment bag. This is one classy establishment! I also have to mention that the housekeeping staff are so kind and friendly! I ended up having a conversation with one of the cleaning ladies and she gave me some kind advice on my new marriage :) I really had a wonderful experience at this hotel and would not hesitate to return for another stay. In fact, I can't wait to have an excuse to stay here again, I live just 45 minutes away, but I would book a night at this hotel just for some luxury and comfort. Highly recommended!!! I have to add that this hotel is two-minutes walking distance from a subway station in Toronto. It is also a 15-minute walking distance from the busiest part of Toronto (tourist attraction - Eaton Centre and Dundas Square. The hotel is surrounded by many classy and delicious restaurants. It's lobby is so very beautiful (ideal for photo-taking.) Oh, and they give you plush bathrobes and comfy slippers in your room. Wish I could go on and on about how great this hotel is :) My fave!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but expensive for breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Elle004
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Le Meridien King Edward. The staff was friendly, our room was clean, the bed was very comfortable, valet parking was appreciated and prompt, and the hotel itself is a gem in the middle of a busy city. Our only comment would be that breakfast was quite expensive. For a business person with an expense account, $60+ for breakfast might not be an issue, but for a retired couple, it's quite extreme. If we were to stay again, we would search out a location for a more reasonably priced breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great service, needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: djkim123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in March 2011. The hotel was located right in the financial district of Toronto. The overall service was great! The room was nice but dated. I had to ask for brighter light bulb as the fixtures were old and the room was not bright. The sinks, shower and a few other things needed updating. The room service was great. The gym was open 24 hrs a day and was a good setup for travelers. Nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea not to be missed - truly outstanding, best in Toronto !!”
Reviews.Author: Marcebeck
Reviews.Content: I attended Afternoon Tea with a large group of people, including many children. The entire experience was...glorious ! The Hotel staff and Manager went significantly above and beyond our expectations to make our Tea truly enjoyable and highly delicious. There was a great selection of teas, and the buttery scones with cream and strawberry jam were AMAZING ! The gourmet selection of sandwiches and pastries were outstanding, along with the "Happy Birthday" message written in Belgian Chocolate on the top tier of our three-tiered tray. A truly delicious, tradition upheld in all its glory ! The ambiance and location were stunning - beautiful and very elegant. Highly recommended !!

Reviews.Title: “Booked for 5 nights - left after 1”
Reviews.Author: TheGlade
Reviews.Content: Tired room - hermetically sealed windows - so no air or the constant noise of the AC - $30 for WiFi - I have a laptop, iPhone and an Android - so $90 - to its credit nice lounge bar and lobby - moved the The Drake in the morning - I got a very cheap rate so in a sense it was value for money, and demand a Free WiFi key

Reviews.Title: “only if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: dundastraveler
Reviews.Content: It is nice, but not worth the rack rate. If you can get a deal for about a hundred a night, it won't disappoint. The rooms are reasonbly large but not terribly well decorated. They could do with an upgrade, as could the bathrooms, which are just poorly designed. the lobby is lovely. The location is pretty close to everything. Don't get ripped off by the valet parking. Just find a public lot nearby and park yourself, because at check out time, you could spend a large part of your stay waiting for your car.

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful property, but...”
Reviews.Author: NimsM
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful old building, so when I had to attend an event here, I thought I'd indulge and stay for a couple of nights. My expectations were high, but I came away vaguely disappointed. It wasn't one single big thing, more a collection of little ones, including: 1) I booked at a so called once-a-year sale, with a 24-hour deadline. But rates were $10 cheaper after. A Starwood employee told me in an online chat that the group has sales on many properties and since my booking was non-refundable, she couldn't do anything about it. Sighh... 2) The room didn't have tea/coffee making facilities (a very basic facility, IMHO). I had to go to the front desk to ask for a kettle. I was initially told (wrongly) I would be charged for tea/cofee. Sure, the hotel offers vouchers for free coffee/tea at one of its F&B outlet until midnight. But what do I do when I need a hot cuppa at 3am? 3) Local calls are very expensive. 4) The staff were mostly great, and the servers at Victoria's were awesome. But I have a message for some of the people at front desk - if it's not urgent, please don't interrupt your colleagues who are dealing with guests. That's just basic courtesy. So, would I stay here again, or recommend to others? I think so, but with a caveat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, fabulous building.”
Reviews.Author: Swisswifey
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband at the King Eddy as his office is close by. The building is old and sumptuously decorated. There was a small army of doormen to help with our small amount of luggage and the concierge desk were very helpful and assisted me to plan my solo sightseeing whilst hubby worked. Vanessa was particularly helpful and could not have been more enthusiastic about Toronto. We were upgraded to a 'club room' because of our Starwood status and were in an great room but unfortunately no view at all - except a brick wall...and the back of some buildings.... this did mean there was no noise however .... The Club lounge provided a great breakfast buffet to start the day. My only criticism is that there wasn't wireless internet in the hotel. Just the lobby and lounge. I just brought an ipad and it doesn't work with the in-room internet cable. Come on Starwood get your hotels connected wirelessly.....

Reviews.Title: “Curate's egg - good in parts”
Reviews.Author: DominicB
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for 36 hours gentle business with a colleague and we decided to splash out on the King Edward (at $270 plus tax!). It is elegant and lovely, and I can see why reviewers on a leisure break would have loved it. It was clean and well run, with lovely, cosey beds and all conducive to relaxation. However, my room was dire to work in... There is no wifi in the rooms, and simply to offer a cable connection is not good enough in an expensive hotel, in this day of smartphones, iPads, etc. And there was only one electric socket available, which required crawling under the desk on my hands and knees to plug in my laptop. It should be possible to combine its rather historical charm with some features of the modern world - especially at such a price.

Reviews.Title: “Rests on it's laurels, needs it's service to reflect prices!”
Reviews.Author: BorderRambler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights as part of a wedding party last summer and were disappointed with a number of things during our stay. The overall attitude seems to be that 'King Eddie's' reputation is what you pay for (a lot), rather than it's service. The general problem with the place is just how expensive everything is. OK, you accept the higher rate, but you get NOTHING for that rate. Internet is very expensive, room service is crippling, food in the restaurants extortionate. You should be grateful for being in this hotel and pay what this privilege costs in all areas! The hotel itself is alright, very grand in appearance and the rooms are spacious. But at the same time it's very old and tired, needing a revamp. Our A/C would be on full some days, off the next, regardless of what you do with the dial! Bathrooms tired and basic. Parking was too high, we parked round the block in a public garage for the whole stay for less than one night rate here. Staff were not overly helpful, didn't like to be bothered. On a final note, what really annoyed me most were the bar staff at the $**,000 wedding reception we attended. Miserable, surly and full of attitude; like being served drinks by those who didn't make the cut into Tony Soprano's gang! It seemed serving a drink was the most offensive act to be asked of them, despite that being what they were hired for. To cap it off they started creating rules at 10pm (bar was paid for until midnight), stopped serving altogether at 11pm and at midnight were a dot on the horizon. We'd paid a fortune to come over from England for this wedding and at 10pm felt like naughty students trying to drink beyond closing time in some dive bar. Such Gestapo drink service was ironic as hell considering the entire hotel reeked of weed the whole stay, wafting out of every room all day long while the Caribbean Madis Gras was on... In short don't bother - the lobby doesn't make the price worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a let down.”
Reviews.Author: Altehpwn
Reviews.Content: The lobby is breath-taking. The staff are very friendly and helpful, always greeting you with a smile. My husband and I were excited to stay in a luxurious hotel like the King Eddy. We were upgraded to the club floor at no extra cost. You could imagine our surprise when we entered the room and it smelled a little damp and musty. The cushion on the arm chair was sunken in. The wall paper was curling up in spots and the paint was bubbling and peeling on the ceiling of the bathroom. It may seem picky to mention these things but one would think that a luxury hotel starting at $230 per night would be on top of these issues. There wasn't even free internet access in the lobby or coffee in the room. I have stayed in much cheaper hotels which were much fresher and cleaner, with internet access in the lobby and in room coffee at no extra charge. There was no peeling paint or wallpaper and no issues with finicky plumbing either. This hotel was a bit of a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Menage et Trois at The King Eddy!”
Reviews.Author: girl6_ca
Reviews.Content: We had a devine time at The King Eddy! It was me, my sister, and my mom! We always admired The Magnificent King Eddy and were always well aware of its heritage and charm in the heart of Toronto - and we always wanted to stay there one day - so we did! It was absolutely magic! From the moment we pulled up to the valet parking to entering the Grand Foyer, it was posh all the way! We stayed in this magnificent extra large suite which had soaring ceilings and our very own extra large foyer! As I flicked the lights on to view our living room area, there was a sparkling chandelier way up on the extra high ceiling illuminating our giant parlor which was full of windows dressed with the most luxurious drapery. Comfy sofa and chairs and lovely furniture created a lovely vinette perfect for relaxing and sipping on a bottle of Mumm's Champagne! The adjoining bedroom was huge. It housed a great big King size bed with scruptious crisp white bedding and we also had another ajoining second room with 2 queen beds that were just as gorgeous. Each room was massive, and the furniture was lovely. Our bathrooms were devine and the master even had a bidet! There was complimentary happy hour drinks and hors d'oeuvres in the club lounge which we enjoyed and a complimentary breakfast as well. The King Edward Hotel was outstanding! It was everything I expected it to be! The atmoshphere and charm was amazing which enhanced the very best part - the time I had with my sister and my mom! A+++++

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Exceptional Service.”
Reviews.Author: sandy1959
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I were at the King Eddy on Feb 24, checking out to fly home on the 25th. On our way to the airport, we received a text message that all flights were cancelled. We had the limo go back to the King Eddy and was immediately directed by the doorman, Chris, to the Concierge desk. Vanessa, the young lady on the desk, immediately too charge; was warm, friendly and patient. She made a stressful event pain free. The first thing she did was call the front desk and immediately book us rooms so we had a place to sleep, ensuring that we received the same corporate discount rate. Then she asked if she could call Air Canada on our behalf to arrange flights home for us. That young lady spent a good 20 to 25 minutes on the phone exploring our options and then ensured we had a flight booked home at the earliest opportunity!! From then on from the doorman, Chris, to the gentleman on the concierge desk the next morning, all of the front desk staff went out of their way to be helpful. Even a minor comment to the manager that the clock and phone in my room wasn't working was dealt with in 5 minutes. I have liked staying at this hotel. Now, I would say this is my preferred hotel to stay at in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “King Edward is a prince of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: peterandchris
Reviews.Content: So glad we stayed at this fine hotel. Location was perfect for us as we could stroll to St. Lawrence Market for a peameal bacon breakfast sandwich or to Eaton Center for shopping.. The staff were very accommodating and the lobby is a gem. Found none of the few negatives others had mentioned...scratched up elevators or dirty old carpeting. Our room was pleasant and the bed was great. The one complaint I have is for the $13.99 fee for internet. They offered a great package for The Maharaja Exhibit at AGO. We were so glad we stayed at King Eddy. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: canuckBurlington
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful.Everything went exactly as planned. The car was dropped off and parked and ready when I was to leave which was hard doing.Chris at the door knew exactly where to go for music and a meal annd both were excellent.The staff at check in couldn't be nicer. The room was wonderful and very clean and equiped with whatever was needed. Alarm clock even had an Ipod stand for just sitting around relaxing.The bed was very comfortable and I intend to make it my place to stay each and everytime in Toronto. Thank you King Edward.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: BabsAlmonte_Canada
Reviews.Content: Our stay couldn't have been more perfect! The room was beautiful and pristine, the bed very comfortable,the maid folded our PJs! All that I found wanting in the room was that I wished their had been a little coffeemaker, however, room service was prompt and very courteous. The staff were excellent from the doorman right thru the concierge desk, front desk and the front manager Mark was awesome! When he heard that we were there to celebrate my daughters 13th B'day, he treated us to an amazing breakfast in the gourmet resturant where our waiter Stephan was a joy to deal with. The valet parking was fast and very courteous. I've stayed in many nice hotels over the years but this was, by far, my best experience ever!!! Thank you King Eddy!!!

Reviews.Title: “It could have been a five star experience”
Reviews.Author: WatchDogTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. We got a good deal on Expedia and then got a free upgrade upon arrival from the friendly reception staff so we were definitely pleased with the value for money. The hotel itself is beautiful. The food in the restaurant and room service is nothing special. The blow that knocked two stars clean off this review was during a practice fire alarm one morning.
