We'd been told that it would go off and that it was just a test and that we didn't need to do anything or worry about it, so we didn't. As we were lying in bed naked, waiting for the fire alarm to stop going off, a man burst into our supposedly double locked room with no warning, other than the rattle of the lock. I expected him to apologise profusely at his mistake and then quickly walk out. He didn't. He calmly walked into the middle of the room, without even acknowledging that we were there, or apologising for walking in on two people in bed naked; looked up at the ceiling (where the alarm was) for a few seconds and then turned and walked back out as if nothing had happened. Personally, I think he should be fired for that sort of misconduct. Even if it didn't violate just about every rule in that hotel staff are supposed to follow, it was extremely rude. The worst part was that he had an oddly smug look on his face like he was enjoying what he was doing. That's five star service for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: WhendoileaveMilton
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself had a great time from the moment we step up to the check in area. They upgraded our room as it was our Anniversary week-end. We were able to get cocktails and a breakfast on a special floor with a pass key. The High Tea was wonderful as well, the choices of tea are great and taste delicious, and the food was great as well. We also took a taxi to dinner which was the best idea instead of driving because then you can enjoy your evening and drink as much as you like and not worry about driving. The bed was dreamy we fell asleep right away the duvet was so warm and cozy and the shower was so nice and hot which made a difference. We would recommend you stay at the Le Meridien King Edward you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: duenorth2112
Reviews.Content: We hadnt stayed here before and thought it would be a nice change from our normal hotel. I'm glad cause we will book here again.. great place staff was very friendly.. no problems with the room. It was also the first time we sued valet parking and we LOVED it.. ill pay the extra bucks to not have to deal with Toronto parking!!! No ice machines on the floor but they will send a bucket up, no problem. A Tim Horton's is right across the street for your morning coffee fix. There were also two free coffee tickets in the room for the downstairs restaurant.. But ya gotta have a Timmies in the morning. A Japanese restaurant is right across the street as well. We are going back in March and will rebook for sure! We were on the 16th floor and it was probably the quietest night we had ever had in a downtown hotel! The mattress was super comfy.. wanted to bring it home!!

Reviews.Title: “Delivered on all responisbilities”
Reviews.Author: extremepitaman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night and had a great time. The bed was soft, the rooms are big enough to be comfortable, a nice ipod dock, and we also got upgraded which was nice. There was a free breakfast included which was another added bonus. Nice ambiance in the lobby and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The King Eddy was always, and remains, a very special place.”
Reviews.Author: Hornlihutte
Reviews.Content: We just returned from two back-to-back two-night weekend stays at the King Eddy after an absence of two years. The journey from the front door, to the front desk, to our deluxe suite, was matter of minutes in spite of arriving early. For both stays we got the same specific deluxe suite we had requested when we made our on-line reservations. The suite was spacious and quiet and we had Club Floor Access, a definite plus. All the staff we met, beginning and ending with the doorman, Chris, were friendly and helpful. The Consort Bar is one of the most elegant and relaxing watering holes we have encountered in any hotel, anywhere. According to my wife, they make a really fine straight-up martini, and I can speak enthusiastically about the on-tap Tankhouse ale from the local Mill Street Microbrewery. The food served in the bar has really improved since our last visits although not up to Saturdayâ€™s standard on either Sunday evening. Like many, we regret the passing of the Victoria Cafe and the resulting changes to the Lobby that this loss precipitated. But, on balance, the King Eddy was always, and remains, a very special place. To those who do not know Toronto, I suggest that it is difficult to imagine a better location. The King Street Subway is steps away and from there you can easily get to such locations as the Art Gallery of Ontario, the Royal Ontario Museum, and the Bloor Street high-end shopping venues. You can walk to the St. Lawrence Market, the Eaton Centre, and the Opera House (Four Seasons Centre), and Union Station in 10 minutes. You can also access the underground walkways (The PATH) from the King Street Subway Station in case of inclement weather. By the way, donâ€™t waste time trying to get a good map of the PATH. There is no such thing. You just have to walk it and learn it.

Reviews.Title: “A for effort, B for performance.”
Reviews.Author: aero_world
Reviews.Content: The service is excellent - among one of the best I have ever encountered. The room was large and spacious even if parts of it were worn and outdated. The plumbing was an issue - with very finicky hot and cold water temperature settings. It was disappointing the rooms don't come with a coffeemaker. The hotel is located pretty close to the financial district which is very good but not as good as the Sheraton because you have to walk outside before you can get to the underground PATH system which connects most of downtown Toronto (very important during the cold winters). Overall, this hotel is pretty good but it definitely isn't as luxurious or high-class as it tries to be. The parts which are renovated look stunning. But it's the parts that were glossed over in the renovations and the little amenities unavailable (like coffee) which betray this hotel's "trying hard but just can't seem to get there" dilemma. Until these minor issues are fixed, you can probably get better value for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service”
Reviews.Author: hrmac
Reviews.Content: I travel to Toronto frequently and it has been years since I stayed at the King Eddie. I was pleasantly surprized, This is a great location and the hotel accomodations were great, The staff and service was excellent. I want to thank Larry at the concierge desk who helped me with some required Blackberry service on day 1. I need to give special recognition to Stefano from the bar/dining lounge. This guy really makes you feel comfortable at the hotel, very helpful about the surrounding area and great recommendations. Over my 4 days the guy just makes you feel welcome every day. Room was clean and quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Location for sure!”
Reviews.Author: blonde_in_michigan65
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for Toronto...u step out your door to everything. Across the street is a japanese restaurant, a burger place and tim hortons, starbucks and all kinds of convience stores. Eaton center is 3 blocks away..a huge shopping mall. We booked through priceline name your own price..put in a 4 star and got the room for 100.00 a night. We then upgraded for 70.00 more a night to a suite, which was not up to my standard, Room was smelly and carpet was stained, beat up furniture. My husband said you have to remember you are not in the United States. We then received a phone call from the front to ask if we liked our room, when i said i didn't, she immediately sent new keys to another suite which was fabulous . It was a larger suite with views of king street and everything in the room was very nice. Beds where very comfy. The staff where great, Chris was very helpful. We had a great time in Toronto eating at 360 on the cn tower and shopping at the high end stores on Bloor st. It turned out be a prefect location thats for sure, if had stayed in the suite i "upgraded" to i would of been disappointed but it all turned out in the end. The food in the bar was ok and we wanted to eat at the main restraint but it was closed when we got there thursday night..For the price we booked this hotel for it was worth it, if you want real high end the intercontinental is where to stay but need to be willing to pay the price.

Reviews.Title: “The best service in Canada that we experienced”
Reviews.Author: aquadancer1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the King Eddy after having a skiing vacation in Banff. The difference in service was noticeable from the moment that we stopped on the street to unload the suitcases. We were given two choices for parking. We chose the cheaper one option, the Metro Parking around the corner. The check-in attendant offered us the evening cocktails even though we were several hours late. Wow! Does this ever happen in Canada! Not on our travels! We also enjoyed the Royal Club Breakfast in the morning. Great coffee! and Oatmeal! The bed was very luxurious and the bathroom so spacious for two to use in a hurry in the morning. This was a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a night out on the town!”
Reviews.Author: foxy90
Reviews.Content: Booked a wonderful rate through Travel Zoo ! Room is alittle dated, however it was very clean, king bed was comfortable. The staff is excellent, especially Chris the Door man. We were mentioning we were going to the St. Lawrence in the morning and he said that they had a fridge for our items, if need be. 40.00 Valet parking enabled you to stay until 4pm the next day. The Martini lounge was great also in the Le Meridien King Edward. We found the REX bar on Queen with live Jazz. One of the few live Jazz bars left in town. Great location. Close to the St. Lawerence Market too.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: kurri71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Meridien King Edward for two nights for a 1st anniversary getaway in Toronto. Check in was fast. Room was dated, no closet, no place to hang coats. Bathroom was tiny, door had to be closed to access the sink. Bathtub backed up when shower was run and the ceiling was coming apart. It took 10 minutes of running the water to get any hot water in the shower or sink. Definitely needs updating. Room wasn't cleaned during the second day and towels had to be requested when we arrived back for the night. Service was ok otherwise (Check in/out, towel request, concierge). Liked the title says, disappointed, expected more from this historic hotel. We are planning to go back to Toronto soon but won't be staying at Le Meridien King Edward.

Reviews.Title: “NYE 2011”
Reviews.Author: vanessm
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for New Years Eve through Priceline and got a reasonable deal for the King Edward hotel. The hotel seemed very busy due to the occasion, but the service was prompt, including check-in and out. We are local and were only using the room as a place to sleep for the night, but I wished I could have slept in that bed for just one more night. Duvet and mattress were heavenly. Overall, the room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was clean as well. The room did not look dated or run down. Definitely recommend this hotel. Hope to go back soon to enjoy their famous high tea!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience, (second December holiday period visit)”
Reviews.Author: bredren51tor
Reviews.Content: Thanks again for a very nice experience. We were upgraded to a larger unit right away, very comfortable room, great location, friendly staff. Enjoyed having the lounge room for a snack and to relax in, the ipod dock in the room, the newspapers being available. top notch, would return again...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, located in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: GoLeafsGo0907
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The King Eddie in located on King St, which is where a lot of restaurants and bars are also located. The Rogers Centre, Air Canada Centre, CN Tower and other attractions are easily walkable from here. Used starwood points and this was a great stay. Staff was very helpful, rooms were impeccable, bed was very luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “What a great night”
Reviews.Author: harveyre
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to the King Edward for his christmas present. The staff were friendly and the hotel itself was stunning, especially the lobby, complete with incredible Christmas tree! The room was clean and spacious, with lots of services and amenities. A late checkout was no problem and room service was eay to use, though very expensive! There was a fire alarm test at around 10am which was marginally annoying, but other than that, We both had a great stay and would definitely go back to the King Edward!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service; Excellent food”
Reviews.Author: WayneinCollingwood
Reviews.Content: Was upgraded to a small suite (I am a Starwood Platinum member). Room was spotless. The linens on the bed were immaculate. Room service food is tasty and more than substantial. The clubhouse I ordered could have easily been enough for 2 people. The only quibble I have concerns the huge duvet on the bed. Perhaps a lighter alternative (like a blanket) could be available. It was a little too warm for a comfortable sleep. I have stayed at this property many times and it's always welcome to return - it's my home when I'm in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: TomandLizzie
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was superb. Large clean rooms, comfortable beds and a beautiful lobby (what a Christmas tree!). The location was excellent for everything we were doing. What stood out above all was the amazing customer service at the front desk and the concierge. We had a car rental crisis and Vanessa and Shawn were there every step of the way to try to resolve- they were truly awesome! Thanks for the help!! The price was right as well since we took advantage of a promotional offer. Would highly recommend this hotel. There is also a real neat Irish Pub PJ O'Briens right across the street. Great food and service. Thanks for a wonderful stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “They made me feel at home on thanksgiving holiday”
Reviews.Author: MiamiAlejandra
Reviews.Content: I had a business during holidays in Toronto, I was by myself and since I first got to the hotel I felt like if they knew me. They treated me as a frequent guest; specially Julius at the front desk and Stefanno the bar tender were so attentive that made me feel I was no so far from home during those holidays. A repeat I would say next time I visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: marklaur
Reviews.Content: I purchased this stay through a discount website and got a really good deal. Upon arrival we discovered they had no record of our reservation. I had the e-confirmation with me and the desk staff made several calls to the booking agent to retrieve the record of my room. They were very friendly and helpful and upgraded our room after all this trouble. This hotel is a beautiful antique! We had a huge room with a king bed. I am sure the ceilings were at least 12 feet high with lovely crown molding. Although the room was a bit tired and ready for some updates it was still very comfortable and inviting. It had big, tall windows with heavy traditional draperies overlooking King St. The bathroom was super big but had a small dated tub/shower combo. We took the VIA into the city and easily walked the short distance from Union Station to the hotel. The location of the King Edward is definetly a plus. It started to rain after we checked in so we bought day passes for the subway ($10 each) and went shopping. The subway entrance is only steps from the hotel and is very easy to navigate. We had a drink in the hotel bar before heading out to the theatre. Very nice but a bit pricey - $27 for a beer and a glass of wine!

Reviews.Title: “Great stays!”
Reviews.Author: Dukman
Reviews.Content: Over the past three months I have stayed with your hotel on several occasions. Your hotel did a great job in accommodating me on my first trip after the hotel we booked with treated us poorly to say the least. My partners and I are also grateful to your doorman Chris for all your help filling our nights off. As well my wife would like to thank Chris for finding tickets to see her "Hapless Leafs". We would definitely recommend your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: themattbova
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. When we arrived at check in our room was not ready. To make up for it, the staff offered us a $40 comp to the very nice bar/restaurant located in the lobby. The bar was called Consort and I recommend it even if you don't get to drink for free. The room itself was large and comfortable and the location is great as well. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: skatinggrandma
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the King Edward many times when visiting Toronto. It's within walking distance of Eaton Center and the St. Lawrence Market. The hotel is a few steps away from the subway. The doormen are great with luggage and hailing cabs. The concierge desk will help with tickets and tourist information. The lobby is lovely with a desk staff that is helpful. Rooms are very nicely decorated. Only downside is the parking is $40 US - but it is a big city and getting rid of your car is the best idea. It is a grand old hotel kept in fine condition.

Reviews.Title: “always a great experience in the heart of toronto”
Reviews.Author: emorel
Reviews.Content: A grand 'old lady" in the heart of the city with great staff at a great location.Park down the street a the Green P and walk back to the hotel.Completely refurbished with lots of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at the King Eddie”
Reviews.Author: Sandtravel2
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here for his birthday. The hotel is amazing and so convenient to the Toronto downtown. If you like history, this hotel is steeped in it - and yet is not run-down like many "historic" hotels. The building is well maintained, with a crisp, clean feel. We drank at the Irish pub across the street and had dinner at the Italian restaurant around the corner. Everything was so convenient. The room was spacious and very clean. The view was not so impressive, but this was not an issue for us. The staff was very friendly and the service was exceptional. Even the valet guy was friendly and carried out a "real" conversation with us as we waited on our car. Our room had a king sized bed which was very comfortable. We ate breakfast in the restaurant the next morning and got 5-star service. All in all a great experience and we will certainly stay here again when we visit the down town. I highly recommend it to any of my TA friends.

Reviews.Title: “If you are planning a trip to Toronto this is definitely the hotel to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: JamieDenise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were recent guests at Le Meridien King Edward Hotel. We travel extensively; however we had not previously stayed at the Le Meridien King Edward Hotel prior to this date. Upon arrival to the hotel, the individual who served us was extremely pleasant and welcoming; it was a definite positive first-time experience at the hotel (first impressions are often lasting impressions!) and this type of service continued throughout our entire stay. I would describe the hotel as magnificent from the time you walk in through the front doors to the time you leave. The rooms are large, but cozy and offer a lot of character that you donâ€™t often see in most hotels. If you are looking for an incredible over-night stay experience this is the hotel to stay at!! I would describe this hotel as one of the best hotels (overall) in the Toronto area, and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Sevice and Location”
Reviews.Author: adotkdot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the King Eddy primarily due to the location. We live downtown but wanted to get something special for a wedding that was being held nearby. We decided on the King Eddy due to a Starwood promo. First off - the promo makes it an amazing deal. The hotel is beautiful. Common areas , the lobby and the dining areas are very elegant. It is a bit of an older style but it wears well and does not look tired. Check in was quick - even though I did not show my Gold status card (my wife checked in), the service was quick and polite. We checked into the hotel in the middle of the afternoon on a Friday. One interesting thing - I really liked the elevators - they have a bank of 6 and they are extremely fast. I was surprised at the quality/ Although they are a bit small they are quick. The room was quite large (we were on the 10th floor in an a royal club room). Bathroom was huge. The bed was awesome and we both had a great sleep. One thing though, the room does need renovation and could benefit from refurbishing. The thing that impressed me the most was the service. All the staff were helpful and very polite. One of the staff - Marisol (front desk supervisor) was excellent. She helped to arrange several last minute requests and was extremely responsive. I would recommend the King Eddy for anyone staying in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a 'modern room'”
Reviews.Author: LondonGirl24
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel with work twice recently and both times was given room 762 (the second time I asked for it). It's recently been renovated and is really lovely - light and airy with lovely comfortable bed and huge bathroom (well after a stay in NYC it seemed enormous). The staff are friendly and courteous and the bar is friendly for solo travellers. I'm a youngish female business traveller and I felt very at ease here. There's free wi-fi in the lobby but internet is pretty pricey if you use it in the room. I'm not sure of the rate so can't comment on whether it's good value.

Reviews.Title: “I love staying at the King Eddie!”
Reviews.Author: Jalenkos
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business in October. I was down for a training conference which was just a couple blocks from the King Eddie. Check-in process was quick and had me up to the room in no time. As a platinum member they upgraded the room to the Executive Suite, 669. This room is huge and quite nice! It has a separate living room and bedroom. Living room has a large tv, couch, few chairs and a coffee table. It also has wonderful wrap around windows with a beautiful view of downtown. The bedroom was also huge (about the size of a regular room at the King Eddie. The bed was unbelievably comfortable, slept like a log! The washroom was also quite large and even had a beday. Just be sure to check that you close the drapes on the window before you get out of the shower as there is a condo complex across the street that you may give a show to someone looking in :-) Also as a platinum member I had access to the club lounge which is just a delight! In the evenings (530-730) they have free snacks (chips, nuts, sandwiches, dips) as well as wine, beer and non-alcoholic beverages. In the mornings they have pastries, fruit, baked goods, cereal and oatmeal. It was nice not having to worry about breakfast in the mornings. Great location, great value for the money when you consider all of the amenities. I will definately be staying at the King Eddie again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: AlexandriaGirl123
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is not terrible, it does need a serious renovation. The last time it was remodeled was in the 1980s and it shows.This hotel at the current condition should not get more than three stars and some rooms are at a two star level. The furniture, drapes, and wallpaper all need to be replaced and the bathrooms completely remodeled. The first room we checked into, was in need of a serious face lift. The couch was covered in stains and the air went in the bathroom was black from all the dust that was never removed by the maids. We asked for another room and the front desk upgraded us for free to a club room. The front desk staff did not seem surprised by our complaint so I am guessing we were not the first to comment about that couch. The new room was better but like the previous room, needs to be remodeled. Furniture and draperies are old and the bathroom is outdated. The ceiling in the shower had scrathes in both rooms. The hotel's location is good. You can walk to just about anywhere and we did. Toronto is a pleasant city to walk around and we spent three days enjoying the sites by foot. There is a metro stop a block away if you prefer to take the metro. Our rate did not include breakfast so I don't know what kind of food the hotel serves. There is a great bakery a block away (turn left when leaving the hotel and walk down King St) for breakfast serving great pastries or gourmet sandwiches for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Tonguetwister
Reviews.Content: We wanted a place downtown so we could walk to all the sites. This was a great choice. We got a great price on Easy Click Travel. Even with the $40 parking fee, the price was still great for the location. Quieter part of downtown so slept well. Since it's a 4 star hotel, it was a bit awkward with the baby, otherwise fine. I'd recommend the hotel but probably not to young families.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mypointofview2010
Reviews.Content: Great, quiet hotel - a bit tired with its age but still lovely with great service. And NO BED BUGS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent from A to Z”
Reviews.Author: leame
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at King Eddie. Everything was perfect : reception, the room, the service. We had supper at Victoria Restaurant: upscale food and service. At departure time, the BNS Marathon was blocking all streets. Impossible to get a cab to Union Station. Sean (doorman) took us to the station by subway with our luggage. Absolutely fantastic... King Edward is ''the'' place where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “King Eddie is simply Royal”
Reviews.Author: scotty071
Reviews.Content: Le Meridien King Edward is simply royal. The abiance and the service is impeccable. The downtown location is within walking distance of major Toronto attractions. I will recommend this hotel for all guests needing a bit of sophistication. One better, select a club room for a few dollars more. The perks will worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Sullita
Reviews.Content: Our room was 1)prepaid and 2)booked 3 weeks in advance. It was to be a Deluxe Suite with a King Size bed. Upon arrival a very unpleasant staff person informed us our room was not available and offered to put us in a room with a double bed. After a few back and forths with this "rude" person.. she finally found us a room with a king size bed. The room was an accessibility room with less than stellar decor. What if a dissabled or ill person required that room? The breakfast the next morning was also less than impressive. Overall disappointing and we will NOT stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Little things kept this from being an excellent”
Reviews.Author: KristinaR007
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Front desk staff helpful. Room service prompt (but pricey). Was upgraded to a suite because of Starwood points and room was quite nice. Housekeeping was quick to bring a new iron. Here's why this wasn't an excellent: 1. Window in bathroom had only sheer curtain, which meant that room on the other side of the "U" could see in when the light was on. (Tried showering in the dark lately? Not easy.) 2. In room Internet access was wired only. Really? In 2010? If you're going to make us use the wire, please make sure you give us a long one. 3. Hotel bill was not complete. Didn't realize when I checked out and had to call back the next day. Oh, and when you call for a new bill, you have to leave a voicemail. Fingers crossed that I get called back before I start my next trip. 4. In order to print a boarding pass, you had to either (a) give the concierge or front desk your password so you could login to the airline system; or (b) use the business center at $1 per minute and $1 per page. The $6 it cost to check in online and print the pass wasn't much, but many other hotels (including Le Meridiens) have dedicated, free terminals for printing boarding passes. These are all "little things", but they are what kept this from being an excellent, IMHO.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: hrsuperstar
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for a wedding and stayed at the King Edward. The staff were very helpful. I was using a combination of points and points/cash for the trip. They were really good with the little things like when I needed ice and getting a car for the airport. The King Edward is my Toronto hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its finest in downtown Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: Amberbranny
Reviews.Content: As recommended by the couple getting married, I was pleasantly surprised by the ambiance of the Le Merdien King Edward offered with its beautiful lobby, large spacious rooms and friendly staff to accomodate my stay. I was also pleasantly impressed with the upgrade! Definitely would recommend this hotel as it is also very central to downtown Toronto and right next to the market.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will be returning”
Reviews.Author: Ken154982
Reviews.Content: The King Edward is in a perfect location downtown, the valet service was friendly from the start, especially with busy afternoon traffic, until we left, the room was spacious, and the bed was unbelievably comfortable. Excellent time there, and will return when we visit Toronto again and again, it will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and great luxury at a great price”
Reviews.Author: BusT-guy119
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many of the major chains while on business in Toronto but none surpasses the King Eddie. The location is perfect for someone doing business in the area. There are many restaurants and pubs within walking distance. The property itself is well maintained and the staff is friendly and accommodating. If I had one complaint it would be about the gym. The workout facility is quite lacking and needs a severe upgrade. If you are a SPG member and need to be in Toronto, the King Edward is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Obvious and only choice when staying in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Dr_RKB
Reviews.Content: Travelling to Toronto 4-5 times a year (normally on business), I cannot recommend this Hotel enough. Certainly a cut above the rest, everything about the Hotel exudes charm and elegance. On entry, having been greeted by the friendly doorman, you step into a very impressive lobby. If you have time, make sure you book yourself in for afternoon tea â€“ the environment will lend itself to your enjoyment. Check-in will be smooth and friendly, allowing you to get to your room quickly. I particularly like the simple fact that I always sleep well in this Hotel, enjoy the powerful shower and the old-world charm of my room. The Hotel is ideally placed for local restaurants and bars, a half-block away from Yonge Street. The Harbour is a short 15 minute stroll away. All of this sounds wonderful I know. In my mind, the true yardstick of this Hotel is how they deal with queries or problems. We all know that little, niggling, things can come up when travelling â€“ the measure of the King Eddyâ€™s staff is not how they deal with you as a customer when things are going well but rather how they deal with you when things are not exactly to your liking. If I wasnâ€™t happy with their service, I wouldnâ€™t keep staying here. This remains my one and only choice for my Toronto stays â€“ Iâ€™ve recommended many friends to stay here without hesitation. So, if you're fed up with the "cookie cutter" design of other hotel chains (with ever-increasing amounts of glass-and-chrome everywhere), treat yourself to some elegance.

Reviews.Title: “cleanliness and aircon syetem need urgent attendance”
Reviews.Author: headteacher203
Reviews.Content: we were allocated a room where the aircon system was so noisy. The engineers attended twice and could not repair it. They supposingly turned it off and we were provided with 2 fans for the night. However the aircon was not actually turned off but put on 35 degrees. We were sweating and did not sleep whole night.. The old shower cap by previous guest was left on the tap, very dirty and oily. Something in the bed made us so itchy whole night. Moving the bedside cabinet and the bed to see what made us itchy, we were shocked to find the amount of dust there. Eventually we were moved to another room but the cleanliness was no better. Dirty towels were left in the bath but the aircon system was at least working this time. I have stayed in many 4 to 5 star hotels all over the world. Definitely the worst hotel and does not deserve the star rating given. we could not even have tea there as we had not booked. Incredible that hotel guest cannot have tea in the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, friendly hotel...yet luxurious”
Reviews.Author: adventuretraveler4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the club level and the room was nice & spacious....the most amazing aspect was the friendly, helpful staff. They could be used as a model training program they were so great. We stored our bikes and kept taking them in & out of a storage room...with no problem and happy faces on the staff who would get them for us. The bed was very comfortable and the club level gives a very good breakfast. Only negative is the parking cost...$40.00 plus tax per day.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable... Not in a nice way.”
Reviews.Author: ilga
Reviews.Content: Recently I booked a room for my mother-in-law after finding a reasonable rate online for a Toronto hotel. A request was made to find a room close to the elevator as there are mobility issues. What my mother-in-law received was unbelievable. Stay away from room 210! As per the confirmation, the room promised "350 Sq Ft, Traditional Decor with Dark Cherry Wood Furniture and Marble Surround Bathrooms". What was received was a Murphy bed, two glass serving carts, two chairs and an L-shaped computer working area (looked like two slats of wood put together). The room was huge. Actually, I think the room doubled as a conference/meeting room. After a three hour trip to Toronto and absolutely exhausted from the heat, my mother-in-law did not want to complain at the front desk and be moved to another room due to her mobility issues. Word of advice to all future travellers; do not accept anything less than what was promised to you when you made the reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms. Let down for a Meridien”
Reviews.Author: kazuo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the hotel for two nights. Although the room was an acceptable size, the carpet, furnishings, and bathroom were tired and in desperate need for updating. Both my partner and I were disappointed in the quality of this hotel because of our generally high expectations for a Meridien hotel. We used some Starwood points to stay at this hotel and felt it a waste. The upside of the hotel is that it is very clean and located in the center of downtown. From a value standpoint, you could probably find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comedy of errors”
Reviews.Author: trvlgbebe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at King Eddie for SIL wedding. Was a comedy of errors upon checking in....which was very slow. Room was ok in size but we had a leak in bathroom, dirty water was everywhere. TV didn't work. Maintenance was called and they temporary fixed the leak and left a mess in the bathroom, that housecleaning was supposed to clean but never came. The TV was fixed temporarily. We were offered a room change, we were already settled into the room travelling with 2 young children plus we were told the issue was resolved. The leak in bathroom came back and the TV wasn't fixed. Changed rooms the following day, but found cockroach in bathroom! Caught insect in glass for HK to dispose. HK and Front desk did not follow-up on that incident. Gave HK laundry (women's clothing) and they didn't return for 2 days because they lost the laundry! Inquired about my clothes and was given someone else's laundry (men's underwear!) that wasn't claimed since May 2010! Finally got my laundry back and it wasn't clean! My DS had vomitted on me 2 days ago, reason why I sent for cleaning. AND was still charged for the laundry even though it went missing and wasn't clean! FD reversed charges at check-out, when I complained about it. With our room change, we left our kid's towels in bathroom and HK didn't return them. Inquired about the missing towels and no one could find them. AND the initial room's mini-bar was emptied for kid's milk and drinks. With the room change, HK bagged all of our mini-bar contents and left on the counter. Obviously HK and FD don't communicate to one another. Overall, our stay/experience with Le Meridien was unsatisfactory. Location was good, central for what we needed. The rooms were "nostalgic"...the carpet needed to be replaced, dirty and burn marks. Only 1 FD manager was helpful (Marisol?), the others were arrogant and rude. Considering how much per night this property costs and luckily we got a group rate for the wedding, we've received better service at Fairmont, Hilton, and Marriott properties! This stay confirmed why we haven't stayed at a Starwood property since 2003! Would have rathered stayed at the Royal York instead.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: katherine038
Reviews.Content: I was there a good few years ago and can't remember it brillantly but I do remember the beds being huge and very comfy as well as the rooms being beautifully decorated. The lobby and restuarant were too lovely and the foyer was beautiful, but tthe hotel is not a hotel for loads of facilities, more about location and being good service and beautiful. I thought it was a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, low service hotel”
Reviews.Author: snapsean
Reviews.Content: Bad: Dingy rooms; dirty Bathroom ceiling very dirty No coffee maker in room! Room service breakfast expensive Good: Location is great Good sized rooms; have stayed in suite and regular room. Regular room is large. Beautiful building; history

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelThat
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Le Meridien King Edward. As a Starwood Gold Member I was given a quasi upgrade from a single queen to a double queen. The room was very large and clean but everything felt somewhat dated. As other travelers have noted, it's definitely not a contemporary hotel. While the ambiance was interesting, it definitely lacked "charm" and instead just felt somewhat old. The staff were friendly, helpful, and the bed was comfortable. The location was perfect. It was in the heart of everything that was happening in the city. There were plenty of restaurants in the area. Everything was within walking distance. Skip the big money valet, and score some underground parking (entrance on the side street behind the building) for $6/night 6am-8am. Pros: - Location, location, location! - Large clean room - Helpful/ friendly staff - Quiet Room Cons: - Lack of any real Starwood Upgrade - Expensive parking - Dated... everything - No view (unless an alley is appealing) I was leaning towards 3-start, but I'll give it a 4 based solely on the location.

Reviews.Title: “an old classic with great staff”
Reviews.Author: charliek032
Reviews.Content: The 'king eddie' as it's known is not new to me as I have been a guest a number of times in the past. It keeps it's old, almost colonial, charm, the team is very attentive and friendly. The only constructive point is that it needs some investment.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel anywhere”
Reviews.Author: 35805Traveller
Reviews.Content: wonderful architecture, luxurious large rooms and suites, and the best staff of any hotel I have ever stayed in. We travel extensively internationally.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, classic property”
Reviews.Author: rowingman
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, great location, white table cloth breakfast, Starwood points. Whats not to like? Comfortable bed, nice bar (The Consort Bar? Interesting name.....) Staff were great, and I appreciate the value of this hotel. Fitness center was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: danicaaa
Reviews.Content: One of my friends booked our room through Priceline and got us an amazing deal for the room. We stayed in a two-king bed suite with separate living room. The location is fantastic, in the heart of downtown Toronto, and the staff was great. A little too great, maybe. We asked the man who brought up extra towels to take a quick picture of us and - well, he got a little too into taking the "perfect" picture. We had a laugh about it afterwards. The room decor is very old-english style, but still quite gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business - Wouldn't be good for Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: NYC86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business one night in mid May. The hotel is right on King Street in the central business district close to all the major offices and underground stations. The room was large and the internet worked perfectly. Heard it had a gym but I didn't use it. The bed was very comfortable and the blackout curtains were great but the entire night I could hear the ppl in the room above me. It sounded like they were bowling which was annoying but not the hotel's fault. Had breakfast at Victoria's in the lobby. Kind of pricey for breakfast but still good. Overall, nothing fantastic or mind-blowing but very good for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for and this one is worth it!”
Reviews.Author: KaMPEdison
Reviews.Content: The hotel has extremely friendly staff - from the curbside porter, to the receptionist, to the staff on the Club Level. It is one block away from the King St subway station so it's very convenient. Avoid valet parking at $40 per night. Instead drive up 3 blocks to Victoria St and park at the garage for $22 per night. Try to get onto the Club Level - the Royal Club offers complimenary breakfast daily, along with evening appetizers and cocktails (wine and beer). Tea and coffee are offered 24/7, along with free computer and internet access. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, cant wait to return”
Reviews.Author: upstaters9
Reviews.Content: i never write reviews, EVER, but i feel i must tell you about a recent stay i had in toronto a few months back.. Me and my family traveled to the King Edward hotel from uptstate N.Y. after being stuck in traffic for 3 hours with a sick kid, hyper dog and heavy heavy rain it was a great pleasure to arrive at the King Eddy.. So pleased that the staff were uber friendly. The doorman that greated us was the gem of the whole hotel. I dont remember his name but he had a really awesome handlebar moustache. We relied on the doormans knowledge of the city for most things we did. They know there stuff so dont be afraid to ask them. Parking downtown is not cheap but if you plan on taking your car out of the lot at all it is a much better deal to get the valet parking the hotel offers. It is $40 but you really save in the long run is you use the car. Very close to great dinning and loads of shopping, my husband and son went to a hockey game and was located close to the arena.. The hotel is dog friendly and is located a half a block away from a off the leash dog park. Once again, cant wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: TinkDundas_On
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for a weekend and enjoyed it very much. We were given a very large room on the 9th floor.The only thing I would say against it , is the food is very expensive but good . I would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Top end hotel”
Reviews.Author: the_man11111
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay at the King Eddie while in Toronto for the ballet. The hotel is conveniently located within steps of the King station subway (how we arrived). We had a deluxe suite with King bed. The staff were incredible, most notably in the King Club Lounge where we were served breakfast, even though breakfast had ended an hour before had. This is a very expensive hotel, but thankfully, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Charming older hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leeroy51
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week-end stay at Le Meridien King Edward Hotel. We had booked a package that included a king deluxe room and tickets to the King Tut exhibit at he Ontario Art Gallery. When we got to our room late Friday evening, we found that the safe did not work and as we have a laptop we called for service. Someone from security came within five minutes and tried to fix it but were unable to so they radioed for someone else to come who also came right away and he had it fixed within two minutes. The next morning, I realized that there was no hair dryer in the room so we mentioned it to the concvierge as we were leaving for the day and sure enough, there was one in the room when we got back. My point--great, quick service. The room was oversize as stated and the bathroom was normal hotel size. Everything was very clean and worked well. The hotel itself is older but very charming and the bar was quiet and very relaxing. As previously mentioned, the VIP tickets for the King Tut exhibit (VERY GOOD) were included in our package and that also included a free shuttle bus to the exhibit and back to the hotel and also the VIP part meant you could bypass the gigantic lineups (at least an hour or more) for general admission. This was a great package as at a tremendous price and we thoroughly enjoyed our week-end at this hotel and would definitely return again to this centrally located hotel. Just wish someone could have controlled the horrible rainy, windy week-end weather! P.S. We went to Far Niente restaurant on Friday night and Biff's Bistro on Front St. on Sat. night. Both were great!! and also Sunset Grill for breakfast Sunday morning (very good and quick). Valet parking is pricey but there is underground parking around the corner for much less and it is the same parking lot that the hotel uses.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thillia3
Reviews.Content: It was a great site to see our hotel, the amenities were spectacular. It was easy access to the airport and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nuttyelvis
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fabulous Birthday trip on the awesome King Tut tour with my hubby, Mom and Aunt. My hubby and I had a separate room from my Mom and my Aunt. I must say, I had the best sleep ever on the most comfortable bed and to my surprise, my Aunt even mentioned the very same comment! The staff were extremely friendly, the food was the absolutely scrumptious and we all actually enjoyed the ambiance of the hotel taking into consideration that is was built in the early 1900's. Being history buffs that we all are, it was an absolute thrill to experience a stay in a hotel that has so much history. We were very glad that there is still many victorian details left in tact even though they have done many renovations. Rooms and hotel was clean and price was just right! There is nothing negative that any of the four of us could say! We all LOVED IT! and rate this hotel very high...we have all travelled extensively throughout the world! and this has been one of our most enjoyable hotel stays!!!! Would do it all again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has the best darn martinis in Toronto!!!”
Reviews.Author: martiniguy_10
Reviews.Content: I am a regular guest at "The King Eddie". I stay about 20 nights a year. I am drawn back to the hotel to stay in the ultimate of comfort. I am also drawn back time after time for Stephan's Martini's! He makes Toronto's ultimate Martini - could even be the best in the world! Even better, they are served in The Consort Bar by the always lovely Valentina - a Goddess! The whole bar staff are so service oriented and professional - and lots of FUN! The Front desk staff are the most professional, kind & accomodating. This is the only hotel to stay in Toronto. Truly. Please give the Bar staff a big HUG for me when you see them!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the King Tut deal at the famous King Eddie Le Meridien in downtown Toronto for a romantic get-away.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller5670
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful birthday long weekend for my spouse at the King Eddie Le Meridien hotel in downtown Toronto. She loved the Novelle Maria Spa, we greatly enoyed the Sunday brunch at Victoria's, and the highlight was the free VIP tickets including transportation to the King Tut exhibit at the AGO. What a fabulous deal - 2 nights and King Tut all for $250. All the staff were helpful (thanks Oscar and Sophia). We were upgraded to a gigantic suite and had access to the Royal Club Lounge. Restaurants and shopping were excellent in the area, and we dropped by the new Distillery District to buy chocolate at the new SOMA chocolatemaker - delish. As very frequent travellers, we've seen much of the world, but have always found the King Eddie to be a wonderful get-away closer to home for short weekend trips. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beware. Toronto's highend nightmare of a hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: timintoronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. We live in Toronto so a little getaway from the kids for two nights and celebrate our anniversary! Starting from the door man that couldn't bother with helping us to a terrible suite that was cold. I never though this hotel could be this poor. Elevators not working to staff quitting within earshot. Clothes missing when we returned at night so no pjs to sleep in...maid phoned our room 8am to enquire. Management of this hotel couldn't care less with our problems. Forgot to mention our bottle of wine we left in the afternoon disappeared along with our pjs. We returned at a little after midnight and having no wine was no fun since it was our 5th anniversary. Called front desk and they offered to send a comp. new bottle. Only took an hour and a bit to come. I know there were other problems such as the gm of the hotel not calling us after our stay. I travel four months a year in total around the world and who would think my worst experience ever in a hotel would happen in my own backyard. I should have written this sooner but oh well here it is. I still feel like venting about this one! There are much better high end hotels in this city. Stay away from this all around disaster. Sure not one would ever expect of "Toronto's King Eddy".

Reviews.Title: “Quality service, excellent location, but furnishings old-school”
Reviews.Author: garfodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed an evening at Le Meridien King Edward, right in the midst of the Toronto International Film Festival. The King Eddy hotel has been a fixture in the Toronto landscape for decades, and it's good to see that Starwood has continued to maintain the quality service and rooms. From the moment you enter the ornate, elegant lobby, you really are transported to a distant realm, away from the modern hustle and bustle of Toronto. And that's the main piece of advice about this hotel. This is an "old-school" hotel, with hanging chandeliers, Victorian-era sofas and chairs, and valets in tuxedos. If you're looking for a modern, clean feel in a Toronto hotel, you're better off in a Westin or Hilton or 1 King West. In particular, the furnishings in the room, while clean and professional, did feel like something from a Jane Austen novel. If you're just looking for a place to sleep, this could be bothersome. That said, with the exception of a flaky television, the room was fully functional and comfortable. The bathroom was large and spacious, with good clean facilities. The view from my room was nothing great -- the hotel is surrounded by skyscrapers. I did not have a car. This may be the largest weakness at this hotel, as downtown parking is at a very high premium. You are close to subway and streetcars everywhere, and taxi rides are relatively inexpensive, so a vehicle is not totally necessary. Being right off King Street, you are in the heart of downtown, and in the midst of the Financial District. The King Street Entertainment area is just a few blocks to the West, and Eaton Centre and Yonge-Dundas square is a few blocks north. Don't wander too far East -- while it is better than in previous years, you should keep your wits about you if you head East of Church St. Everywhere else is perfectly safe. I really liked this hotel, as it really did transport me to a different time in the past. But you've got to be in that type of mood. I would nonetheless strongly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Upgrades”
Reviews.Author: zooone9243
Reviews.Content: Wanted to add my thumbs up, this hotel is great especially for SPG platinum members they upgrade you to their Execute Suite if it's available. Plus free phone calls and club access. Excellent hotel, would recommend it over the Westin Harbour Castle. Greate service.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & historic, with just enough luxury”
Reviews.Author: videohb
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 3-night stay in Toronto because my wife and I were attending a conference at the Metro Convention Centre. We initially booked a basic room at the conference rate... I then received an email from Le Meridien with an offer to "upgrade to a Deluxe Suite including access to our Club Lounge"...and for an additional $50 per night, I took the upgrade. It turns out the upgrade to the Deluxe Suite on the Club level was totally worth it! It happened that our anniversary was that same week as the conference, so I felt I should do what I could to make our stay a bit more luxurious and comfortable. When we arrived we found a plate of complimentary chocolate covered strawberries in our room (we were offered champagne as well -- but declined since we don't drink alcohol.) Main reasons the upgrade to the Club Level was worth it: - The added luxury of having personal robes, turn down service, large bathroom and closets. - The bottles of water! My wife is always buying bottled water when we travel but we didn't have to purchase a single one this trip! they provided two free bottles every night in our room, in addition, we could always grab extra water from the workout room as well as the Club Lounge - FREE INTERNET with the upgrade! with hotels charging so much per day for internet, this made the upgrade worth almost by itself - All-hours access to the workout room, even in the middle of the night - The free continental breakfast in the mornings in the Club Lounge: pastries, breads, fruit, lox & bagels, tasty oatmeal, several kinds of juices - The Free light meal in the Club Lounge served every day in the late afternoon: dips and veggies, hummus & bread, crackers & cheese, bruschetta, juices, tea & coffee - Access to the Club Lounge in general: a great place to chill, I had a meeting with a colleague and just took him up with me to the Club Lounge during the afternoon meal, we snacked, drank our drinks, sat in nice chairs - Access to the business center located in the Club Lounge The cool thing about the King Edward also is that its quite a historic hotel... its neat to be in such a glamorous place and imagine what it must've been like back in the day.. One (slight) issue I had with the place was its location... Don't get me wrong, its in a great place in Toronto -- but kind of a long walk to the Convention Centre or CN Tower, if you plan on going there. CON: Parking was expensive, daily rate.

Reviews.Title: “What the ...?!"”
Reviews.Author: Calgaryprisoner
Reviews.Content: Noisy! Oh my God, the cooling fans are like nuclear reactors, and the thermostats use *mercury drops* like from the 1940s. This hotel is ancient and clapped out. And they're trying to pretend it's modern. It isn't. It was slightly better about three years ago when they did some kind of renovation ...and then they just kind of gave up or something. Nothing in this place works any more. And the bar food is scary...overcooked, slow and out of date. This review is a heartbreaker. I used to love this place and now it's just a ghost of what it was. Come on guys... guests *notice* this kind of decay. Something has gone very very wrong on your end. PS: crazy expensive internet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gscougar
Reviews.Content: We stayed using SPG points and were not disappointed. The room was Jr. Club level and included complimentary Club beverages and snack in the evening, continental breakfast and internet. The room was of a nice size and we were impressed. The shower water pressure did seem a little off initially but it was a result of the shower head being placed on a low pressure setting. Did not notice any hot water issues in our two night stay. Location was very good and we opted to find our own parking nearby and from what I read, we saved some money on this part. The parking lot was 1/2 block away. We recommend if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “STAYED IN BETTER HOTELS IN TORONTO”
Reviews.Author: ELAINE068
Reviews.Content: Our stay unfortunately coincided with 'Wuffstock' the dog festival and we shared lifts and public rooms with barking slavering dogs it was incredible. If you are planning to visit Toronto check which hotels do NOT allow dogs and you will be safe. The hotel also wanted to charge us a ridiculous amount of money to have beverage facilities in our room. By the time we arrived at this hotel we had travelled all across Canada and this was the only hotel which wanted to levy a charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal with Priceline. Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: wondermind
Reviews.Content: Priceline is my new best friend! This was my first time using priceline to bid for lodging. My bid of $80 a night was accepted (looks like it could have been lower around $65 according to other reviews). After this experience, I learned one trick for bidding. To make sure you get the lowest price that would be accepted, make sure to go to tripadvisor, do a search for the city you want to stay in and the word "priceline" in your search. You'll get a bunch of reviews with people telling you what they bid. Using those numbers, you'll get an idea what would be accepted by Priceline. Anyway, back to the hotel, like any first timers, I was worried after reading the reviews for this hotel. But I got my fingers crossed hoping things will work out well and they did. For eighty dollars a night, we can't really complain. And there wasn't much to complain about except for 2 things: 1) we had to wait an hour before our room was ready, and that was only we nagged the front desk. We arrived for check-in at 3:30. They kept telling us the room would be ready in 20 minutes. After the third time, my husband got upset and that was when they really called up housekeeping and got them to start cleaning the room. 2) None of the doormen were very friendly. No "hello", no "welcome".. but whatever.. I didn't really care. The room itself was big with high ceiling. It was clean. The bathroom was good size. It's just like any other hotel for its normal price range. It's right in the middle of downtown Torronto, one block to a Catholic Church, 2-3 blocks a farmer's market (St. Laurence Market--which I didn't really care for). 6 blocks to Eaton shopping center. We never ran out of hot water in our bathroom nor did we think the water pressure was low like other reviewers had said. I had a bath full of hot water to soak in every night. But I think we were lucky because we met another young couple in the elevator and they mentioned their hot water ran out. We also received a notice saying that they would have some one to come and fix the hot water/electrical problems in the building. I don't understand why people were complaining about the cost of meals, valet parking, internet connection, and of the minibar drinks. It's a hotel! Any of such thing is expensive! What did they expect?! And from my experience at staying at 4-star hotels, I had always been charged for internet connection, so I'm pretty use to the charge.. No complaints from me here. I also learned that $40 valet parking is actually comparable to any downtown parking. Because we went to Chicago the next week and the hotel we stayed at hat valet parking for $51, self parking was $36. That puts things into perspective, doesn't it. Overall, this hotel is just like any other hotel we stayed at in terms of services and prices. And for the price we paid, we'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nickle & Dimed ... not impressed”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkie90210
Reviews.Content: Upon check in at 4:30 pm (standard check in is 3:00 pm) we waited 30 min because our room was "not ready". My reservation was club level Jr. Suite, we ended up in an executive room ... not on club level. The I had to remind them that club level included amenities (breakfast, Hors d'Å“uvres & drinks, etc.) frustrating check in process. Be prepared to be nickel & dimed (no ice makers on indivudual floors so when we asked for a bucket of ice we were told 1 is complimentary and if we ordered a second bucket we would be charged $3... so tacky) Internet is available at a fee... at this level they should just throw it in... I mean c'mon people... if the Hilton Garden Inn & Courtyard Marriott can throw it in... so can a hotel that boasts a $300 a night stay... Room was dirty, carpets in hallways & room are old, dirty, torn, etc. Bed was really uncomfortable, seemed hard, flat, not a good combination when you are looking for a good night sleep. Overall not a pleasant experience. For the record the standard in Toronto is quite low... compared to cities like Miami, NY, Chicago, etc. I have stayed in every single 4 star hotel in the East & West sides of Dwntwn Toronto and I am not impressed to say the least. Hilton Dwntwn provides the best accomadations but lacks in service...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special...”
Reviews.Author: netgeek
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline and I echo the previous poster's comments regarding staff attitude towards priceline customers. Why does this hotel even bother to offer rooms through the site if they are going to be so hostile? A guest is a guest... it shouldn't matter how they booked the room. Arrived at 4:30, greeted by an unfriendly front desk clerk who told us that the room wouldn't be ready until 5pm (I think check-in time was 3pm). After waiting 30 minutes I went back up to the front desk and this time a friendlier staff person checked us in. The room was finally ready. We got to the room which was very basic and small. There were stains on the carpet and the furniture was worn a bit. There are much nicer hotels in Toronto this this one. The rooms and front desk staff need an upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: MusicManOntario
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had stayed one night at the King Edward, hoping it would be an enjoyable stay in a historic hotel, however it turned out we were quite disappointed. Firstly, the hotel lobby is majestic, but thatâ€™s were it ended. We had stayed in a â€˜Deluxe Kingâ€™ Room. A couple of the issues we ran into. 1. No Ice Machines. We had to call room service for our â€˜freeâ€™ bucket and were informed that future buckets would cost $4.00 2. Our Bed was squeaky and not very comfortable 3. The Bathroom Door was also very squeaky 4. The Shower had mold growing in the grout 5. The was no Stationary 6. Very little for Furnishings, no real sitting area Based on this experience, we will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Ptype
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Meridien for a weekend, booked through Priceline. We parked a block east in the Vinci parking garage which was $5-$6 on weekends as we didnâ€™t want to pay $40 for hotel parking. When we got to the main entrance we overheard 2 bellboys arguing with one another. The lobby was pretty nice, but thatâ€™s probably one of the only good things about this hotel. We arrived at the front desk at around 2:30pm and we were aware that check-in was 3pm. But the front desk clerk informed us that the room wouldnâ€™t be ready for another 45 minutes to an hour, which is past the official check-in time. We didnâ€™t feel like waiting around that long so we checked in our bags with the concierge and went shopping. Several hours later we decided to go back and check into our room. I dunno if itâ€™s because we booked through Priceline or if all the rooms are like that, but it was really small with high ceilings. There wasnâ€™t much of a view other than the other side of the building and trash through a narrow window. The TV wasnâ€™t angled with the bed but I guess itâ€™s to be expected when the room is so small and there isnâ€™t much room to play with.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: globalgourmet
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal for four nights here. I travel a lot and I must say this hotel has one of the most service-oriented staffs I have ever encountered. With just one or two "ordinary" exceptions, everyone I dealt with was exceptionally warm, gracious and anxious to do whatever they could to make my stay more comfortable and pleasant. This started with my e-mail on room preferences before my arrival and continued right through to the concierge who helped me print out my boarding pass as I departed. This is a distinguished grande dame, over 100 years old, that has been well taken care of. Some folks have written here of small rooms. Mine was huge, My only issue was that I like to keep the temperature very cool when I sleep and the a/c couldn't cool the room down below about 25 degrees Celsius, that's 77 degrees Fahrenheit, which is probably not bad for most folks. And it was pretty warm in Toronto last week. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Pepysp
Reviews.Content: Very elegant hotel with great rooms, excellent service and stylish decor/surroundings. So far this is the smartest downtown hotel I have stayed in and far better than the Fairmont. In a great location too and highly recommended. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “4th of july retreat”
Reviews.Author: mrspickens2
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip to Canada and he booked the room for on $70 per night. With that being said, I was not expecting the world. The doormen at the hotel were very helpful. The hotel has parking, but it costs $40 per night (with unlimited in and out) with vallet. The doorman was very honest and told us to park in the parking deck around the corner for about $15 (no in and out) per day. The hotel lobby is very clean and staff welcomed us with a smile. Although priceline offered us a queen sized suite, they upgraded us for free to a king. We stayed in room 1411 and it was also very clean and roomy. The bed was a little squeaky but not loud at all. The pressure for the toilet was very low and the tub had a slow drain. We asked for someone to fix it while we were out, but I doubt they did. We dont sweat the small stuff! Dont touch the phone next to the toilet only because....its a phone next to a toilet....ewww... We loved this hotel becuase it is centrally located. If you do the city tours, the stop is right across the street. PLEASE GO TO THE BEER BISTRO!!!! its so good and relaxing. they have live music saturday nights. Also the hotel is a walking distance to the mall and the lake. We would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “2 - 3 star at best!”
Reviews.Author: gparker195
Reviews.Content: I wont' complain too much since I didn't pay much (priceline), but this hotel is weak and shouldn't have a 4 star rating. 2 -3 star at best! I expect better from Starwood! I'm writing my review as a average patron. Maybe I have to be decedent of King Edward to see the nice rooms! Also, they charge for Ice.. 1st one complimentary, all after $3.00. Internet in room for $13.95... Seriously!! Free internet in boring lobby! That says enough!

Reviews.Title: “3-star hotel with a 5-star wrapper. Don't pay much!”
Reviews.Author: Andre S
Reviews.Content: They sell this hotel for around $60 on Priceline, and once you stay you'll know why. Royalty may stay here, and they may have palatial suites for hundreds a night, but the normal suites are tired, old, and nothing to write home about. Location-wise, it's a block from a subway stop, right on a streetcar line, and a short walk to anywhere downtown. We were disappointed because it's billed as a 5-star hotel. It felt like a 3-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellers88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Le Meridian King Edward in Toronto for my 40th birthday. It is an elegant and Luxurious hotal in a central location and perfect for the train station which is a 10 mins walk. The suite we stayed in was absolutely beautiful, very spacious and clean and the service was very good. I would highly reccommend, plus we booked this through hotel.com and got a fantastic rate for the deluxe suite. The only snag was we had to wait longer than usual for our room, check in time was 3pm but we had to ask 3 times after 3pm if our room was ready. I would still give 5 out of 5 for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The comforts of home in the heart ot Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Noka_9
Reviews.Content: I stay at Le Meridien King Edward in Toronto 8 - 10 times a year because the old world charm and impeccable service make me feel at home in the heart of Toronto. As a Starwood Platinum member I am eligible for the same benefits in all Starwood hotels and I find the King Edward staff and facilities top all the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Charm”
Reviews.Author: PatNJamie
Reviews.Content: I was traveling in Toronto on business and decided to extend my stay. My wife flew up from the states to join me so we could celebrate our wedding anniversary. We searched for a hotel in downtown Toronto that would be both convenient and not the "cookie-cutter" hotel one so often sees- The King Edward exceeded our expectations. This is truly a wonderful hotel with all the charm and elegance one would expect; the lobby is stunning. So many hotels claim to have a fitness center that consists of only 1 treadmill; not the King Edward. The fitness center is first class with everything one would need to get a workout including free weights, machines, treadmills, etc. The location is convenient to restaurants and theaters with easily accessible public transportation including a streetcar and subway system.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful old hotel”
Reviews.Author: vl-trip
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in King Edwards. It's a beautiful old hotel very centrally located close to many attractions and easily accessible by public transport. Although it is an old hotel my room was in a fairly good condition and it was very spacious with lots of storage. Definitely a good value for $107/night. Most of hotel's staff were very attentive and professional with a single exception of a young lady working at the reception. She seemed to be annoyed with my request and wasn't helpful at all. Among the few drawbacks I should mention the absence of WiFi in hotel rooms. WiFi was supposed to be freely accessible in the lobby, restaurant and other public areas, but it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: iveyguy
Reviews.Content: Let me preface my review, by stating my experience will be coloured by the events in question: I stayed at the hotel for my fifth anniversary and got engaged that evening. I called in advance and spoke with both the manager and the concierge to let them know about the special evening I had planned. The manager had us upgraded to a suit, that was simply superb. The concierge made a reservation for us at George, which is just down the street. If you are looking for a magnificent meal, I highly recommend this restaurant. The service we received at the King Eddie was exquisite. We were so impressed, that we returned for Valentines Day. The dinner at Victoria's was outstanding. The brunch the next morning, might very well be the finest, anywhere. We loved our [two] stays at the hotel so much, that we are having our wedding there next January, in the grand ballroom on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Sandyj83
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for a last minute getaway to Toronto. We booked on priceline and got a great deal ($51 US per night)! We were only there for a night. The location of the hotel is pretty okay. It's within walking distance of the shopping district but I think there are better hotels which are closer to everything. The room is pretty big but I wouldn't call this hotel a "4-star". The only thing that got on my last nerves was the walls are so thin we could hear people talking so clearly and loud. I was woken up several times throughout the night from people walking down the hall and this one girl kept talking on her cell phone in the hallway so we heard her long conversation loud and clear. It was very annoying. Other than that complaint, the staff was really nice and helpful, the lobby is nice, and the location is not bad. I wouldn't stay here again just b/c there are so many other places to stay, but for the price I paid, it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our secret rendezvous”
Reviews.Author: somebodyssecretbaby
Reviews.Content: Very classy hotel. Quiet and clean and just the perfect setting and location for a couple in complete love....

Reviews.Title: “Very classy and elegant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LovetoStayatHotels
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline - name your own price. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. 1st thing that I feel makes this such a great hotel to stay at in Toronto is the location. It's right downtown, close walking distance to everything. We walked to Rogers Centre for a blue jays game and it took about 15 minutes tops. 2nd thing is this hotel is very elegant. As soon as you walk through the front door, you are blown away by how beautiful it is inside the lobby. It really is a grand lobby... Some reviews have mentioned that they felt they weren't treated well because they booked through Priceline.. I was expecting to receive the same treatment.. but we weren't treated like second class customers. The front staff were very nice.. and we were given a nice Deluxe King Non-Smoking room.. The room was very large.. Room #623... maybe a little too large... and very clean! Bed was so nice and comfy... Very nice marble bathroom... What I really liked about the bedroom was that when we were in there, we felt like we were transported to another time period.. It wasn't the typical cookie cutter hotel rooms. The bedroom was very elegant.. A few things that could have made it better.. the walls are kind of thin.. you can easily hear everything that goes on in the hallways.. also the sheets were not tucked in really well on the mattress so after sleeping, the sheets were falling off the bed and exposing the mattress. The TV is in an awkward position.. Kind of hard to watch TV while lying on the bed. Also.... if you don't want to pay 40$ for valet parking at the hotel.. just park one block east on King Street East at City Park. It's opened 24 hours and the price is much cheaper than valet parking. I will definitely come to this hotel again and use Priceline.. :)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Staff, Horrible Treatment, Lied to, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jeffer1no
Reviews.Content: My wife decided to take me to Toronto for my birthday. Having been to Toronto numerous times before, I have stayed in several hotels in the city including the Fairmont, Intercontinental, Grand, Sheraton, etc. As are most people at this time, we were trying to save a buck by booking a 4-star hotel via Priceline. We were very happy to find that our offer of $51/night was accepted. We then looked up and saw it was the King Edward Royal Meridien. Knowing the Starwood reputation we were looking forward to a nice hotel with the history and luxury appointed with this hotel. Upon arrival the staff treated us as if we were not even human beings. I was carrying a couple bags and struggled to get them up the stairs as the bellman in the front looked at me...was it because I hadn't shaved in a day so I was a little scruffy? Was it because I was in my comfortable clothing not my shirt and tie? Or was it just because they didn't care. In any case, we arrived at noon and asked if there was any way that we could check in early (before 3pm) to which they said "no rooms are ready for you". I even said it was my birthday and they shrugged it off as if I said I was wearing a black shirt. We came back after heading over to the market at roughly 2:40pm to which we were told...nope no rooms ready yet. Ironically though they magically were able to check in people at 3pm. Why not just tell the truth, we don't want you in the room at any time before 3pm (obviously in a more professional manner) rather than lie to your face...well rather lie to the screen as they wouldn't even look you us the face. The front desk staff was just as unaccommodating as the bellman at the front door. Honestly, I seriously have had better treatment and more enjoyable experiences when stopping on a road trip in the middle of the night at a Comfort Inn out in the middle of nowhere. At least there they were pleasant, accommodating, helpful and seemed to care. The only thing going for this hotel is the rooms are very large and the one to which we stayed had a nice view. Additionally, it is in a nice location in the city. Next was the harassment by the security guard. My wife and I went out for a nice night on the town and came back and were looking at some of the nice things in the lobby when we were stopped by a security guard. Now we each had 1 drink, were not loud, not crazy but he got in front of us between the elevators and where we were standing and asked for my ID, then when I asked "what?" he said I need your room card to be sure you belong here. Mind you, the 4 young kids walking in the hotel with candy, ice cream dripping, etc were not asked for a thing! When I called to the front desk and asked if the security always harassed their guests, they acted like they didn't know what I was talking about. I explained the situation and he said, well on the weekends after 1:30am we check anyone/everyone in the hotel...so if you want to go outside of your room in the evening be prepared to feel like you are a hardened criminal and are going to be profiled and harassed no matter how nice you are dressed (yes I had a sports coat on!). All that said, I honestly would have to tell anyone who is thinking of paying full price to not even think about staying here. I honestly will be contacting the general manager of the hotel, Starwood corporate and AAA to advise that they consider reviewing their rating of the hotel as a 4-star as it truly affords itself maybe 2-stars.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for.”
Reviews.Author: RiverCherwell
