Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Priceline and got a very good rate of US$51/night plus taxes. Like what the earlier review said, this hotel is very elegant. Room is clean. Location is good. However, this hotel is extremely prejudicial against Priceline users. I was intentionally put in the worst room, without any view at all (see photo, those white things all over the window are not snow, but pigeon droppings). Unless you book through conventional channels or you are a starwood preferred guest, otherwise, you will feel like a second class customer during your stay. You just get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good service and value”
Reviews.Author: Academic47
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel I stay at on a regular basis and I have never had less than a first rate experience. The staff are consistently friendly and willing to help, so I never feel I am a bother to them, as sometimes happens. I would compare the service levels to those in Asia, which tend to be noticeably higher than in N. America. Although I have frequent stay status with the Starwood chain, which often gives additional privileges, even before I did have such status I was always very well treated. The hotel itself is an older one but refurbished, so the rooms have a "grand" feeling to them. And for a luxury downtown hotel the rates are mostly very reasonable, except when they are close to being full. The location is also ideal, being very close to both the financial and entertainment districts, and it is only steps away from a subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and 'classic" hotel”
Reviews.Author: cpyoon
Reviews.Content: We decided to go on a quick get-a-way and found a good deal on Princeline. You want in and you feel the grandeur and classical elegance of the hotel. If you're looking for a modern hotel, this is not it. However, if you want a classic feel, this was good. Keep that in mind when you go into the bed room. It's an old building but I think it's maintained itself well. Bathroom definitely looked older but was still clean. You can tell the room itself was old but it was quite spacious, bigger than I expected - area for the bed, seating area with couch and tv, and then a desk area for work. The room isn't as elegant as the lobby though. One thing we realized, no ice bucket so if you're thinking of bringing champagne, ask for a bucket at the desk or bring wine instead. We only stayed one night but the service was pretty good when we checked in and when we had questions. Quite friendly and joked with us as well. The resturant Victoria's was quite good as well. We were pleased with the dinner and the service. Valet parking was included even though it said online we had to pay so that was good. I'd recommend going there. Overall, we were quite satisfied with our stay there and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Edmonton5
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness is important to us and we found the Meridian to be top notch. The room was beautiful and the bathroom spacious. We could not have picked a better hotel in Toronto. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Excellent location. We stayed in Toronto many times but this was the first time at this hotel and we will be back again and agin

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Every Time”
Reviews.Author: deanoh
Reviews.Content: Within the last five years I have stayed at the King Edward over twenty times and I have yet to be disappointed. It's elegant history is not only displayed through the style and decor but also through the well trained and extremely helpful staff. The staff is friendly and caring and go beyond their call of duty. On a recent trip in March I was suffering from a cold. A waitress in the Concert Bar named Ivana recommended to me oil of oregano to ease my symptoms. The next day I was surprised to see that she had brought the oil of oregano for me and refused to accept payment for it. The kindness shown by her exemplifies the friendliness of the staff and the great manner in which they are trained. It is always a pleasure to stay at the King Edward Hotel and I could not imagine staying anywhere else on my frequent trips to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “The King Edward Hotel - Your stately home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Geologist35
Reviews.Content: The acme of Colonial elegance in the heart of Downtown Toronto. An historical island of peace and quietude amidst the sea of this bustling city. The "King Eddie" still, after so many years, offers 5 star accommodation for the business traveller. Centrally situated, it is close to the business hub and to many of Toronto's tourist attractions. When you enter the grand foyer of the hotel, the warmth of the welcome you receive is unsurpassed anywhere in the world. I have been in most of the world's capitals and have yet to encounter another business traveler's hotel to equal the King Edward. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are fabulous! You never have to ask the concierge "Can you recommend a good restaurant?" Go to the "King Eddie" nd you will know what it is like to be treated like royalty!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff & location !”
Reviews.Author: MichaelTraveller99
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Toronto and have made the King Edward my home-away-from-home. The staff is is indeed fantastic in everything they do and are always willing to help out - being greeted by name is always nice when you are on the road. And besides, a hotel with a great pedigree and fantastic location is an added bonus. The actual hotel rooms reflect a bygone era, but are tastefully clean and up to date with the latest technology (large TVs, great internet connectivity, etc.). I have no hesitations recommending this hotel for a visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “King Eddy Let Down”
Reviews.Author: LondonMilo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a show/dinner/hotel package with the King Eddy being the hotel. Never having been there and having heard nothing but rave reviews, I was extremely let down. The room was very clean and that is the best thing I can say. There was a chair at the desk but the other chair was a chair Goodwill would refuse. There were no housecoats as advertised, the amenities meagre at best, the hand lotion actually caused an allergic reaction to my eyes and the chlorine in the sheets and towels was reassuring but the scent overwhelming.The front desk was helpful but I found the rest of the staff surly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for groups”
Reviews.Author: Workingforsomesun
Reviews.Content: We booked the whole hotels to host a a conference Everythings was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: Snittster
Reviews.Content: After many hours of researching and asking for referrals from friends we decided on the King Eddie for a long weekend getaway for our anniversary. We were not disappointed. The hotel was beautiful and our room was just wonderful. We opted for a junior suite after getting a great rate (under $200) on hotels.com. Our rate included the club level amenities: continental breakfast - which was very nice and offered lots of options, and complimentary beer and wine and appetizers every evening. The club level lounge was comfortable and relaxing and never very busy. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by the front desk. Our room was spacious and well appointed (see pix). There was free bottled water and plenty towels and hangers. There was soon a knock on our door, we were pleasantly surprised to be the recipients of a lovely fruit and chocolate basket with a personalized card from the manager asking us to call him directly if we needed anything. For the duration of our stay (4 nights) our room was quiet and extremely comfortable. I can honestly say we had no complaints. The hotel is in an ideal location easy to get everywhere via cab or Metro. Yes, there is a $40 charge for valet parking, but we've experienced this with EVERY premium hotel in every location and this is to be expected. And yes they charge $3 for a bucket of ice, after the first complementary one, but we did not find this irritating since we could put our items in the mini bar frig for cooling with no problem. The only drawback for some folks may be the lack of "a view". But who sits in their hotel room looking out the window? Not us. We would highly recommend a stay at the King Eddie!!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: RochesterBob
Reviews.Content: We responded to Hotwire's deal of $60 for a Saturday night for a four-star and were very pleased with what we got. Reading the other reviews steered us away from spending a lot more for hotel extras. (1) Park in the indoor lot two blocks east for $6 Saturday + $5 Sunday vs. $40 for hotel valet parking; (2) Get your moring coffee diagonolly across the street at Tim Horton's (3) only FIRST bucket of ice is free, so bring your own if you want more. (4) ask for FREE newspaper at the front desk (5) if you stay here, you are just around the corner from St Lawrence market (closed Sun & Mon). Don't miss it (6) there's a great Irish pub just behind the hotel We found ALL the hotel staff to be exceptional. There was no indication that we were treated any differently getting a discount room. The room was HUGE, clean, and well decorated. We did not use the hotel restaurant (have our favorite bisto (Le Select) for dinner and spent the money there that we saved at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very traditional hotel -- large rooms but getting dated”
Reviews.Author: jjkathome
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights in December for work. SPG platinum -- so was upgraded to a suite. The room was large and pretty well equipped. A large LCD tv in the living room, but a tiny CRT tv in the bedroom. The room was looking a little dated, but was clean and reasonably comfortable. The hotel had an executive lounge which was almost empty every time I was there. And it was open most of the time. They have a computer with a printer for use of the guests at no charge. The rooms are styled in a traditional sense, but the furniture looks a little old. Some people may prefer the traditional look. My tastes are more contemporary. Only had breakfast at the hotel restaurant. It is a very busy place for breakfast and I think it is a place for the power brokers as I saw the former prime minister having breakfast by himself at the hotel on two mornings. I thought it was pretty funny. Overall, the hotel is a decent old style hotel. Did not have any real issue with service. But not my preferable style of hotel. While I was at the hotel for business, I did get a very decent rate for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: rpt319
Reviews.Content: I managed to get this through Priceline for $55/night. That is a steal for this hotel. The rooms are spacious and very clean. I only had two complaints about this hotel, one the internet is not free its $13.95/day and its the only hotel that I ever ran out of hot water in the shower. There were a few other small things that bugged me about it, but I realized I probably got their worst room for the price, so I let it go. The location is great. Its roughly half a block from King Subway station, so getting to and from the airport is quite convenient. Its a short walk to both the Air Canada Centre and Rogers Centre, so its located great for sports. Its also a short walk to the Eaton Centre and the Queen West shopping district. It is almost the ideal location for anyone sticking around the downtown core. One little tip, if you are staying on the weekend, either dress up or prepare to be looked at funny. Apparently, this hotel caters to wedding receptions, so there will be lots of people dressed in tuxedos and fancy gowns outside smoking. If you are heading to a ballgame or whatever in a ball cap, t-shirt and jeans, you will get some funny looks from the wedding guests. I felt quite underdressed staying there when I'd leave to head to the ballgame.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: traveller876
Reviews.Content: The following is a note that e-mailed to the Gereral Manager of the King Edward in Toronto. "Good Morning, I would like to thank the staff at the King Edward on a very enjoyable stay at the hotel on Mar. 6-7, 2009. Though my wife and I only had a short stay at the hotel, we were very impressed with the front desk, concierge and valet staff. Their attention to detail was amazing--they all seemed to speak to us on a first name basis even though our contact was minimal. On Saturday when it started to rain, we were offered an umbrella for the day. Their concern for our general well being during our stay was genuine. Bravo to you and your staff"

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: greg11306
Reviews.Content: Jean, I wanted to send you a quick email to thank you and your staff for the wonderful hospitality that my wife and I experienced during our stay on March 7th. Everything from the from the time we arranged our reservation with Pearl to the time we regrettably had to leave was perfect. Thank you again and I hope to see you during my next travels to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Tired King Eddie”
Reviews.Author: lhs1
Reviews.Content: Good location and great bones. But oh in such need of attention. Rooms vary from small to rather large.. No hot water in my first room, second room (although nice design) had ripped curtains, dirty carpet, old grout and fixtures in the bath/shower.Want internet? $13.95 CAD a night for your room or you can try the lobby. On the plus side - the bed linens , the food. and the staff. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice touches but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: JamboAl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 2 nights on business and was the only Starwood property I hadn't tried in Toronto. For the most part, the stay was enjoyable except for very minor nuisances. I paid $39 for an upgrade to their Royal Club rooms which were rather nice although I could see if you weren't into the flowery motive, the decor would drive you nuts after awhile. The staff I dealt with were extremely friendly and professional. The location is excellent and the subway is very close if you have to go elsewhere; the gym was above average as well for a hotel of its size. Only beefs were: 1) TV reception was poor even with the nice flat screen, 2) no ice machines, 3) free internet in lobby only (which is standard for most mid- to up-scale hotels). I would stay here again rather than the Sheraton Centre if only for the more intimate setting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: cky1
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through a website for a very good price. I thought they hotel was a great value. The staff were great and the hotel was centrally located. I travel a lot and i thought it was the best value I've ever had. I plan to return. I give this hotel very high marks.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you get a GREAT rate.”
Reviews.Author: ashsem
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location. Steps from the subway, St. Lawrence Market, and lots of great restaurants. Reasonable parking nearby. The hotel charges for EVERYTHING including 1.20 per minute for the business center, 1.50 for local calls, 1.50 to access a calling card, and 3.00 for a bucket of ice. There are no ice machines. I am from the US and need ice. Paying 3.00 plus a 3.00 service charge for frozen water is not okay. They also charge for in-room newspaper delivery, but you have to be aware of that and opt out, otherwise the charge is automatic--another 1.50. The rooms are nice, very high ceilings, nice bathrooms but no lights in the shower, so sometimes a bit tricky. In general, this hotel (when you get a rate for under 100.00 US) is fine--the location is worth the extra charges for everything. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “No hotel issues at all”
Reviews.Author: Mechman11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ended up getting this hotel for $80US through priceline, but someone else I know got it for $72. Both prices are great for staying in the Downtown Toronto. We basically used the hotel as a sleeping place. The location is great, just steps away from the subway. The staff was courteous. We did not eat at the hotel so I can offer no advice there. The hotel seemed to have more of a businessman aura about it, but that's OK. Room was a little small, and had no view, but what do you expect for that rate!! Bed was fine room was clean. I'd have no problem recommending this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation in order - no 'luxury' left in the room of a grand hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Echobridge
Reviews.Content: Very Disappointing. The King Eddy is a landmark in Toronto - I know, I live here. (I booked the hotel as a last minute 'treat' to not worry about driving while attending a party. ) The room is just not worth the money - 200$ was the discounted price provided to me. The room, furnishings and bed linens were tired and depressing. The sheets (although clean) felt like papertowel they were so starched out and I assume overused. Staff were excellent, the lobby is grand and location is great for those attending a show.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: 5ideways
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were due to stay here for 4 nights as part of my 40th Birthday trip to Canada, we only stayed for 3 and left for Niagara on the Lake early. If we hadn't of booked it with Starwood Hotel points, making it very cheap, we probably would have left earlier. The hotel Lobby and bar were quite nice, unfortunately the Room was not, the furnishings and carpet were shabby, the bathroom was old and the whole room needed a complete refit, or at least a really good clean! The location is ok, but unless you can get an outstanding rate I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not even shabby chic”
Reviews.Author: imsg
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this hotel. Was expecting a well preserved character hotel. Corners were cut everywhere: no conditioner in room, one small bottle of drinking water-- exactly half of what is customary at hotels around the world; cold, dingy bathroom with green fungus-like growth around the taps and gaps in the badly 'mended' ceiling. No robes in the bedroom, lots of cold marble floor with tiny bathroom mat = cold feet! Carpet grubby, dull and lifting away from the floor like the loose skin of a puppy. Someone is cutting costs on everything and instead of feeling luxurious and indulgent it feels cheap and mean. The staff however, were clearly trying to please. I've stayed in hotels around the world, this rates with some of the dingiest three star hotels in industrial China -- not the architecture, that's still there, but the upkeep. When you have a dignified old dowager like this, she needs to be repaired constantly, lovingly and with taste and style that at least approximates her grand origins -- not mismatched tiles and irregularities that were tacky and current NOT old and charming.

Reviews.Title: “King Eddy”
Reviews.Author: km35
Reviews.Content: Great spot to tour what without doubt was and is one of the best ever family holidays. Staff were helpful and polite, the barman was fantastic. Hotel looks very grand in the pictures but not so grnad in reality. Rooms are average at best and not reflective of my previous le meridien experiences. All that being said such is it's close proximity to everything we would return

Reviews.Title: “Truly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ThreeGirlsTravel
Reviews.Content: Book a trip to Toronto and stay at the King Edward without hesitation. The room was large, clean, and opulent. The service, from the front desk staff to the doorman to the hotel operator to the porter to the waitstaff, was outstanding. The location perfectly suited our needs. Wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: mrsboomer64
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay, comfy big beds, smoking rooms available on the 9th floor with a nice view of the water. Minutes from the ACC! A coffeemaker in the room would have been nice, though. The elevators have been updated I am happy to say! The staff were very pleasant and accommodating, quick to valet and check in/out. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great stay”
Reviews.Author: nemomath
Reviews.Content: Very noisy hotel, and definately not worth the money. Did not have a good room at all, and heard doors slammy all night long. On top of it all, I got the worst view - of the fire escape and got to hear constructions starting at 6am. Small rooms too, not even enough room to setup my luggage. (one bag) Would not stay here again, unless I was forced to for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Everything”
Reviews.Author: actuary11235
Reviews.Content: I just came back from an actuarial conference there. I've been to older hotels and understand the difference between that and a newer Hilton for example. However, I was downgraded with no change in price and no attempt was made to appease me after several complaints about the size of the bed, poor internet connection, etc. Additionally, the hotel makes up their own exchange rate for all charges including hotel room so that if you pay in US dollars you pay 15% more than if you pay in Canadian dollars. Breakfast ended up being $51 for 2 eggs, pancakes, coffee, and juice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Old Hotel - In Good Location”
Reviews.Author: cherylhinton
Reviews.Content: I went to Toronto on a work trip and booked the room at the King Eddie through Hotels.com. The hotel was very grand at the entrance and there were people having high tea in the foyer. I arrived around 2pm and was told that my room was not ready. So I asked why (its European Standard to check in at 2pm) and they said check in was at 3pm - at the time I had been on a long flight and was not that impressed that I had to wait - was there no other rooms in the whole hotel for me??? Anyway I waited the hour and went back - luckily to another receptionist. I asked about my room and again it was not ready as the people before had not checked out. I think I must have looked weary and surprisingly I was given a room that was ready - the miracle! I did my best not to grumble about the woman before that obviously could have given me a room but did not want to. So that was it, I had a key and a room on the 14th floor. The room was lovely and large. I had a great view of the CN Tower. After the check in episodel I was just pleased to be in. I found the rooms very comfortable, great bed and nice and quiet. The room was kept nicely by the cleaners and I was very happy overall. I travel quite a bit with work and this is the first place I really slept in well. The hotel is in a great location, close to walk pretty much everywhere. I can recommend the Beer Bistro across the road as a close place to eat, but within 5 or so minutes there are plenty of places to go out and eat rather than in the hotel (which I didn't eat anything in at all) I would defiantly recommend the CN Tower for dinner and the distillery district. If I go back to Toronto (and I do want to) I would stay again at the King Eddie. The grand hotel still has appeal!

Reviews.Title: “Alright hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Raycat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights on a conference. Booked this hotel as there was a third-off discount on Expedia, otherwise wouldn't usually stay in such an expensive place! It was a nice hotel overall. The lobby is very smart and impressive and front desk staff were very friendly on check in. Felt a bit scruffy having just got off a plane wearing t-shirt, jeans and trainers! Room and bathroom were spacious and very clean, as you would hope. I had 1 bed, which was enormous for 1 person! Also a couple of chairs, desk, large flat screen tv and the bathroom was lovely. The hotel is in an old fashioned style though, which some people might not like. My friend and I were given rooms without a view (only looking across to the other side of the hotel) to begin with but my air con stopped working and, as you couldn't open the window and it was pretty humid, you really needed the AC. I called reception to tell them about the problem and they sent a maintenance guy. When he eventually turned up, after first going to the wrong room and me having to call them back, he just looked at it for 2 mins and said it'll be fine if I just wait a bit for it to cool down. I knew it wouldn't work but it was getting late and I just wanted to sleep so left it till the next day. I told them at reception in the morning that it was actually broken and could they sort something out for me. When I came back in the afternoon they said they'd move me to another room. This 2nd room had a view, only over some buildings, but it was ok (and had working AC!). Here the hair dryer made some screeching noise that sounded really dodgy so I just used the one in my friend's room instead. Couldn't be bothered to complain again! Breakfast was a bit expensive for us (even on expenses -my boss gets grumpy having to pay for anything!) so we walked a couple of minutes and found a cafe. The hotel is fairly close to a good selection of restaurants and the main shopping area. We only used the subway once and just walked to everything else as it was a good location.

Reviews.Title: “No value here!”
Reviews.Author: sceezicks
Reviews.Content: As a starwood member I try to patronize the hotels in the starwood group. I have had great experienc with Westin, Sheraton, W and Aloft properties. Thought I'd give Le Meridian a try. Stayed at King Edward in Sept 08. Good location yes. Rooms large but need updating. No services at all, everything at additional cost. Expensive rate for so little. This is a no frills property at a mega frill price. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and opulence in the middle of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: bryntrips
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful, the concierge is friendly and helpful, and our room was huge and luxurious. And all right in the middle of Toronto, just minutes from gorgeous architecture and fabulous restaurants. We parked down King St in the municipal lot below the Dominion market, where parking is only CAN$5 between 5pm and 5am. We picked up our car around 9:30am and the total parking cost was CAN$15. The only downside to the hotel is that because it is so old, some modern conveniences you might enjoy at a newer hotel are not present, and there are some design oddities that seem to be the result of retrofitting. For example: the elevators are off in a strange little hallway, and each time we took the elevators we waited at least a few minutes. Second, our room was a strange shape, and lacked a closet. Also, the carpet in the room was loose, causing a ripple across the room. The flat-screen TV had a poor picture and was a long way from the bed, with no good seating options in between, which made for a poor viewing experience. We booked a room at the King Edward through Priceline for our honeymoon a week ahead of time for a rate of US$100.

Reviews.Title: “Been here millions of times for funcitons and concerts!”
Reviews.Author: newyorklover123
Reviews.Content: Great place! Been to loads of functions in the ballroom and old cafe victoria! Don't like the new Restaurant, much preferred the cafe Vic but the rooms are spacious and new. We had a suite for just one night! Ok location, close to Eaton Centre and Hummingbird too! Biff's is good for dinner and just around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation Stay at the King Eddy”
Reviews.Author: SchmitstrS43
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights during our Toronto vacation. We secured our reservations via Priceline, and having read other reviews of the hotel, were a bit concerned about 1) the fact that it appeared to be a very classy hotel and we were on a limited budget, and 2) the fact that it appeared to be a high-end, "old school," financial district kind of hotel...and we were a couple visiting the city on vacation. That said, we were extremely pleased with the hotel and its service. We were checked in quickly by a fantastic King Edward employee named Julius. We were in no way treated like "Priceline guests"- the hotel staff was welcoming and accommodating throughout our stay. Our room was on the 14th floor, and overlooked the East side of Toronto. It was quiet, the hallways were bright and well kept, and the room accommodations were lovely: nice bedding, a large lounge chair, clean and bright bathroom, bathrobe, etc. The hotel elevators were not working well during our stay, but hotel staff did their best to call them as they were needed and to aid in the repair process in a timely way. To save money, we avoided the in-house restaurants and ate breakfast at Tim Horton's, which is less than a block away. There is also a small restaurant across the street called the "Melting Pot" that serves a bacon/eggs/toast breakfast for less than $4. We parked about 3 blocks East from the hotel on King St. (sorry- can't remember the cross road!) at an underground parking center, and saved a good deal of money leaving our car there during our stay. The hotel location is excellent. The hotel is in easy walking distance to the Harbourfront, and the city is easy to navigate from King St. or Younge St. The financial district is very inviting, with many restaurants and activities nearby. We weren't sure about what to expect upon winning this hotel on Priceline, but it ended up being a fantastic experience at the hotel- with a lot of character! Many thanks for a great stay to the King Eddy and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss!”
Reviews.Author: travelthree
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Canada and first visit to the city of Toronto and the Le Meridien helped make it a fabulous trip. My companion and I were lucky to book a great deal through expedia earlier in the year (Only negative was being put beside a lift again!). The rooms were a good size and very comfortable. The bathroom was fab too with a hairdryer that had a fair bit of puff - always a gripe with me in the past. The breakfast menu had huge range of choices and everything we ordered was scrumptious e.g french toast/pancakes with maple syrup & bacon. Service was superb and it was rather nice to admire the artwork as you ate! We ate dinner in the bar a couple of times which was also rather good for food and service. Other nights we visited Cyrano's Grill and the Irish Embassy Bar nearby. I would definitely recommend taking advantage of the facilities of the spa to pamper after hard day shopping or to celebrate a special day. Just outside the hotel is one of the pick up points for the shop dine tour bus (yellow) which was quite handy. St Lawrence Market, St James Church, hockey hall of fame and the Eaton centre are all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what get”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Badge43
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. First impressions were very impressive. A warm welcome and ornate reception area. However, our bedroom was not as specatcular. Very basic in my view - only one bathrobe; insufficient towels; no tea/coffee making facilities. Air conditioning was very noisy. We paid for the use of the executive club so had breakfast and afternoon drinks, which was a good experience. The hotel staff were overall friendly and helpful. I would say that this was an acceptable standard for a city hotel but this was very expensive and would have expected more care and attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Never again ...”
Reviews.Author: LittleGulliver
Reviews.Content: Had my company's conference there and I have to say that it was most regretful. The most important facility did not work i.e. the internet/network connection. The breakfast and tea served were frugal and we had to asked for more food/variety. Never heard from the person who promised to 'WOW' us when she did the initial selling to us. The billings was a mess and till now, it's still not sorted out. You get the drift ...

Reviews.Title: “OK for atmosphere, service great”
Reviews.Author: tpb100
Reviews.Content: They checked me in super-early (8am) and upgraded me despite this being my first stay. Am torn about this property because the atmosphere is fairly upscale and old fashioned, which I love, and the service is great, but ... The gigantic room they gave me placed the TV 15 ft away from the bed, and the TV couldn't be seen from the couch because of the armoire doors. Also, they provided absolutely no food (in room coffee or anything else), except for a pint bottle of mineral water in the bathroom. As I was dead tired I ordered room service breakfast $30+CDN. Everything was very ordinary, the croissant and muffin at room temp, and overall not worth the money. Dinner in the hotel restaurant was very old English in style, with a very heavy brown sauce for the steak, in which it had been obviously sitting for hours (my res was at 8pm.) They did get the wedding party next door to lower the racket, and even asked about it next am. The location is good, quiet, room rate isn't terribly high, and the service is great, so overall it's good. I expected more from such a classy (looks and service) establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, but $30 valet?!?!”
Reviews.Author: aquamoon
Reviews.Content: I'm a SPG member, so I got a room upgrade. The room was very big, but sparsely furnished. The bed's extremely comfy, although all in Starwood family, it's even better than the Heavenly Bed from Westin. Location is fantastic, walking distance to St. Lawrence's Market, subway station, PATH, all kinds of places. Beer Bistro right across the street is marvelous for dining and beer tasting - 3 draught flights for $6, try as many as you want! However, valet is $30, which is way overpriced, I think. Just continue on King Street past the hotel, at the corner of Church and King, you'd find a nice outdoor parking. Continue onwards to Jarvais and King, turn right, and on the left side of the street you'd find an indoor parking. I think I read $6 per day or something similar. In any case, cheaper parking can be had elsewhere....would like to spend money on valet on more beer flights....

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed in Canada”
Reviews.Author: rbiggin
Reviews.Content: Of course you don't choose a hotel for the bed - but this is one of the most comfortable beds I have had in a hotel. I really did not want to get out of it in the mornings. We stayed here for three nights and found the service to be first rate. The Consierge was very helpful and pleasant and the hotel was in a good position for the attractions of Toronto. The City explorer bus stops right outside of the hotel. Because I was suffering with a heavy cold, we did have room service on all three nights of our stay. The food was served 'hot' and was of good quality. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again, when next in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “OK - location good”
Reviews.Author: BWOverseas
Reviews.Content: Good location for business and well kept. Bit expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Average Accomms at the Eddy”
Reviews.Author: GSP711
Reviews.Content: Yup, great lobby and public areas, nice bar downstairs. However, only an average (small) guest room in an industry where the competitors are getting better and better all the time and offer more comfort, amenities and value than I encountered on this stay. Ongoing problems with heating system. Lack of in-room coffee-making facility a particular irritation. Pay-for Wi-Fi. Adequate but not rushing to return. Maybe ask to view allocated room when checking in?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: hikingmaniac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in April 2008 to watch our beloved red sox get creamed by the blue jays. Here is our report: We were greeted by the door man who arranged to have our car parked, where it was left until we left. Check in went well and our room was very spacious and comfortable. The large queen bed sagged a little in the middle. Everything else was close to perfect. The service was super, and the concierge was very helpful and informative. We paid $80.00 per night on priceline and that has to be one of the all time values I have encountered. Had we had to pay twice as much, we would have still been very satisfied with the overall value and experience. This is an old time high quality hotel which may be just a bit past its prime, but which places a premium on service, without being stuffy about it.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - rate it 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: DavidAndPed
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Meridient Kind Edward over Easter holiday for 3 days. We got a deluxe room. The room was nice and clean but TV set was miles away from the bed. There was no tea or coffee in the room. It was -6 outside so we could do with some hot drink. The location was really handy, about 10 minutes walking distance to Hockey Hall of Fame and Viarail. The room was quiet and we slept really well. We think overall we would rate the hotel 3 stars for the quality of the room and its amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and over priced”
Reviews.Author: 2can
Reviews.Content: I selected the King Edward hotel as it was close to my business location. After a quick search online I found the hotel web site and decided to make a booking, The Starwood site required me to pay up front for the three nights with no cancellation option. This seemed rather inflexible but I went ahead and booked. Due to a change of plan I required an additional night. On calling the hotel this was arranged and I was offered a lower rate for the extra night. On enquiring if I could have this rate for all nights I was told no, the online booking could not be modified. This seems very restrictive and I would not use the Starwood site again to book. On arriving at the hotel I was impressed by the grandiose lobby and warm welcome at reception. This quickly diminished as I walked along the drab corridor to a room that could only be considered 'average' - certainly not in line with the rate I was charged. Dining in the restaurant for breakfast was expensive but very high quality although with no buffet you may tire of then menu after a few days. Overall I was disappointed considering the price. There are better hotels at much lower rates and I would not stay in the King Edward in future.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: yorom
Reviews.Content: The service is quite good if not for a valet that was rude and offensive. I was in a suite and it looked ridiculous!!!!!! I often stay at Le Meridien hotels worldwide but this property did not impress me.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: marrgr
Reviews.Content: As frequent visitiors to Toronto over the past fifteen years and having stayed at a number of properties during that time we can readily describe the King Edward as being "The Best of Toronto". It's location is in the heart of the city close to so many things of interest - shopping, theatres, and Toronto's great subway system. What stands out at the King Eddy is the sense of quality that greets you as you enter its wonderful lobby followed by what we have found to be a five star staff who treat you as guests and more importantly as friends. There is an ambience of quality about your stay at this hotel which is a wonderful blend of its long and historical past, while meeting the needs of the today's traveller.The rooms are spacious, the corridors on each of the bedroom floors are wide and welcoming, not hallways of doors. The dining facilities and the food itself stand out. Sunday Brunch in its historical dining room is an unbelievable array of eating pleasures and the setting makes one feel special. This hotel, because of its staff and their guest attitude truly make the facility a home away from home - a standout in a world-class city...A&B, Elora ON

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sweettooth84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were given a weekend at the King Edward in Toronto by my father-in-law. The package included dinner each night and breakfast each morning, so we became very familiar with their restaurant staff. I can't think of a single negative thing about our stay. The room was large and clean, the bed fantastically comfortable, and every single staff member was courteous and professional. There was an error on the final list of charges, and while I was prepared for the inevitable challenge of getting it corrected, I was instead very pleasantly surprised by a front desk clerk who apologized and processed the correction immediately. No having to talk to the Manager or any other nonsense. The food in their Victoria restaurant was flawlessly prepared and served, and the servers were without exception extremely polite and attentive (without ever being overbearing). If I could afford it, I would make a weekend at the King Edward a semi-annual event. I love Toronto, and this was the perfect way to enjoy a weekend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best Toronto hotel bar none”
Reviews.Author: KingEddyFan_8
Reviews.Content: The King Eddy is the most wonderful, comfortable, well located hotel in Toronto. The staff treat you like royalty at every turn, and the accommodations are beyond luxurious. The service combined with the beautifully appointed rooms (the duvets are three feet thick!) and proximity to absolutely everything makes the King Eddy my only choice in the city. I have stayed there at least 5 times in the last two years and have not had a single "less than perfect" moment. HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: tanddEssex
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop when we spent three weeks in Canada for a big wedding anniversary. We visited Toronto, Niagara, Vancouver, Jasper, Field, Lake Louise and then Calgary. The Meridien is an extremely nice hotel. Cleanliness, spaciousness, luxury and excellent service are all very important to us and we couldn't fault this hotel at all. We only stayed the one night but the check in and out went without a hitch, bags were delivered to our room, service in the bar and at the desk was prompt and friendly. Very nice. Definitely 5 star. We would recommend very highly. And the location is nice and central too. We spent the Saturday afternoon, evening and Sunday in Toronto. Unfortunately the restaurant at the top of the CN tower is very busy and so when we went along in the afternoon on Saturday the earliest table we could get was at 10pm, so we had a long time to kill in the evening along the waterfront. It's very nice, with beautiful views and the odd band or musical entertainer. Mostly though it's just nice for a slow walk watching the boats. The Tower is great, and the restaurant is very nice. Don't dress too casually though. The photo opportunity when you go into the restaurant is rather poor - they just paste your photo onto a background picture of the restaurant so I'd save my money and ask someone to take an actual photo inside. Food was excellent - one of the nicest steaks my husband said, and my fish was superb. Main course with a little wine was CAD$130. We spent the whole of Sunday walking around Toronto. Gloriously hot day with a dog fair to start, then a visit to the first Post Office, off to China Town then up to the University, Royal Ontario Museum and a little shopping. For those not familiar with Canada it's a little odd because the shops are mostly underground - but once you've found that out it's pretty convenient because the shopping malls just stretch along under the main roads. We walked all day, but that was quite tough in the heat and if we went back we'd probably use the bus more. We left on Via Rail to Niagara, and Toronto Rail Station is quite an impressive sight.

Reviews.Title: “OK for Families”
Reviews.Author: throopbournemouth
Reviews.Content: I was nervous booking the stay following some of the reviews- staying at the hotel with my 2 grandchildren. Should not have been nervous Everyone was so welcoming- and the rooms- very large- we had a room with 2 queen beds- quite large enough- just needed to ask for extra towels and they came immediately. Eveyone fussed over the children- makes them have fun- no pool... but plenty of help from the concierge... recommend this great, grand hotel- needs a bit of refreshing but loved the weekend

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Stay 2007”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_in_Britain
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite in the King Edward over the Christmas period. Hotel did not seem that busy during our stay and this was reflected by only one person on the front desk. The suite itself was fine and very clean although the decor was a bit dated. The level of service is what let the hotel down. Numerous small issues during our stay including only receiving a newspaper on odd occassions and after complaining to the front desk and the hotel asking which paper we wanted then receiving the wrong one for the rest of the stay. Trying to call the hotel from outside can be an issue - on one occassion it took the hotel nearly ten minutes to answer the phone and then they transferred it to voicemail when the conceiage didn't answer. Other minor issues including running out of large size towels and for the turndown service forgetting that there werre two people staying in the room. Valet parking was efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the King Eddie!”
Reviews.Author: mrswhale
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (now husband) and I stayed at the King Eddie in April of 2004 (yes, I'm a little late in writing this review) and we had a wonderful time. We were impressed the second we walked into the hotel. The lobby is breath-taking. We were each carrying backpacks and wearing jeans and hoodies, after a day of touring, and we felt very underdressed and out of place almost, and I was sure that the staff would treat us as such. That wasn't the case. There was a bit of a delay at check-in and our room wasn't ready (however, we were early). We weren't in any hurry so we sat in the lobby and people-watched while we waited for our room. After just a few minutes, we were told our room was ready. It was a very nice room, very large!! The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. To this day, over three years later, I have never slept as well as I did that night. We ordered room service for dinner, and even after the table was wheeled in, we felt we still had ample room. The robe was cozy, and I wore it pretty much the entire weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Some problems”
Reviews.Author: irishgal171
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel through priceline. When we walked into the lobby, there was only one person working at the desk...and she didn't even acknowledge us, even after we stood there for 5 minutes. Just then, husband and wife walked in and were greeted immediately and led to the counter to check in ahead of us. The man who greeted them looked at us for a minute and asked what he could do for us. He seemed surprised when we said we were going to check in. The first question we were asked was whether or not we had booked our hotel on priceline. When we got to our room, it was at the very end of the hallway on the second floor. The room was very small and had only one bed, although we had requested two. The bathroom was tiny, with absolutely no room to put anything. When you closed the bathroom door, it narrowly missed hitting the sink...it was that small. I can't help but think we were treated a little differently and received a smaller room because we booked on priceline? On a positive note, the hotel is in a great area. The valet staff and door staff were extremely polite and helpful. I have stayed at many hotels in Toronto and for what this hotel charges, I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: tigger01
Reviews.Content: 1) Hidden charges $75 Cdn per day up front did not say this when booked on-line ... 2) Ordered a King Bed with Separate sitting area... they gave me a Queen-bed ... very small room. 3)There was a mix up with my bill and the front counter staff did not seem to know what they were doing. I travel quite frequently and can honestly say this is one of the worst hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great bedding, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jason Koulouras
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at the King Edward recently. Myself and my family (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed there for one night - we had a 2 double bed room which was about 360 square feet and had a nice long bathroom with room for more than one person. The beds were very comfortable with very nice linen and a great duvet. There were foot couches at the end of each bed in light dusty blue (nice colour) and two decent sitting chairs whose colour (dark dark green) left much to be desired. There were two closets in the room that were both decent sized for a hotel stay, a flat screen TV, a work desk, two full bath robes and three windows - one had a partial view of Lake Ontario, the other two out over a parking lot, and some minor streets. The hotel has an amazing lobby with lots of detail and great staff - right from the valet to check-in to cleaning staff and restaurant, the staff were friendly, helpful, had the right amount of grace and were empowered to deal with requests. The public hotel spaces were in good shape - fitness area small (older hotel) but clean and good equipment present. The public washrooms were clean, inviting and well designed with privacy in mind. The bathroom was long - had the commode then the shower/tub combination than the vanity area - great lighting, the vanity area was a touch on the small side and had one sink. The towels could have been a little thicker and less scratchy. The area is quite nice - lots of good to excellent restaurants, street car line out front, one block walk to the subway and close to the waterfront and right near the Toronto downtown skyscraper scene. The room was in good shape and clean - there were some nicks and dents here and there - nothing significant. The aforementioned green sitting chairs had seen better days though and the foot couches had been banged up in the legs a bit. The bathroom floors, walls, appliances and vanity were all clean - the ceiling looked like a bit of a jerrymandering and could use some finishing work. We were on a package that included valet parking, late check-out and breakfast for two of us. The hotel does not have a pool nor any specific kid-friendly areas in the same way that a Sheraton or large Westin would have but we were quite happy with the property and loved the easy walk out the lobby to the streetcar line. One note for the wise - the hotel restaurants are quite on the expensive side of things and whilst they are good quality you are in the middle of some of the best restaurants in Canada and should get out and take advantage of the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Stavroff
Reviews.Content: This was truly one of the worst experiences of my extensive hotel staying life.Let me preface this by stating this was to be a fun filled night with my mother for a little "girls weekend" and was to be relaxing. Our room was not available upon arrival so we had a 2 hour wait in the dining area. this was, I thought, fortunate as we had not yet eaten lunch. Our first mistake was sitting down at a table. it took one of 5 staff members 30 minutes to acknowledfge my mother and I and then another 25 minutes to produce my ceasar salad. after our 75 minute lunch we were wisked away upstairs to a room that was less than appealing and not what I had requested at all.(a king bed instead of two queens was my first tip off) after another 1/2 hour and a ream of appologies I was finally given a room that had I initially requested. The TV didn't work. We were not able to view it from either bed d. Ice apparently is at a premium in The King Ed. They will bring you one bucket gratis but all subsequent buckets shall come with a surcharge. After going to a show we returned to a raucaus affair that was a wedding after party on our floor it continued into the night only subsiding after the hotel security made their 3rd warning at 3am. My bill was botched at check out and to this day, a month later it still has not been rectified. My mother has actually been billed for the initial room that had the king bed in it. in closing, if you're staying in Downtown Toronto find a Comfort Inn or a Travel Lodge or a Quality Suites....at least you'll get a room you're comfortable in and all the ice you require. If you choose to stay at the King Eddy then good luck Shelley S

Reviews.Title: “King Edward Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ed_nixon
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Great service and attention to detail, a cut above the rest. An added bonus was bumping into the Phil Collins!!! who was staying here whilst on tour. Great hotel, great city, looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old world style”
Reviews.Author: Grisgrisca
Reviews.Content: This famous landmark Toronto hotel was completely restored a few years ago to retain its turn of the 20th century opulance and style. The lobbey is impressive and the rooms large with huge marble bathrooms. Although we were told all double rooms with 2 single beds were booked on arrival the clerk happily up-graded us to a huge room with twin Queen beds and no less than 2 walk-in closets and a huge marble bathroom ..and all despite getting a very low rate for a standard room The parking is expensive but on a weekend it is free nearby on the street so we found parking half a block away from the hotel. The King Edward is very central and a 15 minute walk to the CN Tower as well as the waterfront ferries to the island, with the excellent and clean Toronto subway entrance right outside the door. The staff were pleasant and very helpful and the doorman great.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler Beware”
Reviews.Author: fun4games
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with friends and my two daughters. I booked a room for two queen beds (and received confirmation). When I arrived they would only offer me a room with one King. Had it just been my family, I would have gone to a different hotel. I slept on a cot they provided. The management showed little concern. They told me they do not guarantee rooms booked over the internet! The hotel is not that nice. The lobby is they only part of the hotel that is nice. The place is old and the rooms need maintenance. It really put a damper on my experience in Toronto. I would never use this hotel again. Beware, if you book here, you may not get what you asked for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience @ The King Edward”
Reviews.Author: MICH16
Reviews.Content: I stayed last weekend- grand old style hotel, clean tidy and great serviceâ€¦large rooms Fantastic lobby and the consort bar on the ground floor was great Best of allâ€¦the stars stay there!!!!! The whole of the LA Galaxy Football Team was in the for the weekend- what a buzz and I managed to get David beckhamâ€™s autographâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for Becks, good enough for me!”
Reviews.Author: Katya_NY
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Priceline for this hotel- great neighborhood, HUGE room for a city, too! We ran into David Beckham and the LA Galaxy not once, but twice during our stay (!). As Priceline consumers, we would never expect to stay in a place like that- but it was just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “A bad 1960's Trip”
Reviews.Author: Barry Lynch
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the Potemkin village grandeur of its lobby. Behind the facade is a dowdy provincial hotel circa 1960 with gloomy rooms, grim furnishings and an ambiance of terminal decline. The management seems curiously parsimonious, unable to spring for more than a single bar of soap which has to be transported from basin to bath to basin like a slippery egg. There is no in-room coffee/tea equipment, which these days is usually found in even the most modest motel. The staff were less that engagingly eccentric with a maid bashing on our room door to search for a fugitive mop, and hopelessly befuddled bar staff. At these prices there are better places to stay in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Romance Package”
Reviews.Author: AcademicTravels
Reviews.Content: I booked a one-night romance package on-line, and I found it to be a great deal. It included free valet parking, champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries, room service breakfast, and late check out. The room was oversized at 400 square feet, and slightly under furnished -- until the breakfast table was wheeled in, and then suddenly the room was about the right size. (ps, the breakfast was wonderful) Overall, an enjoyable stay and great escape from reality.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in Good Area”
Reviews.Author: boatingman_ny
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend here for Gay Pricde. The Front Desk staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel itself is an older building, and while the room was large and comfortable, it was showing sings of wear. The carpet was bunched in the middle, and the furnishing were a bit worn, but the bed was comfortable. I booked this room on hotwire, and got a good price, but don't think I would stay here at the full price, as there are other hotels nearby that are much more modern and more conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: ninjagenie
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay on a Saturday night in June through Priceline for $100. Yes, I still had to pay tax ($22) and valet parking ($28) but it was still worth it. The majority of hotels I've stayed in Toronto (and any other major city) have high parking fees anyways, so it's just another cost of driving to your destination. Our room was quite large, and had two bathrooms. One with a sink and a toilet, the other with a sink and a shower. The bed was great, and yes the tv was small, but we weren't in the room enough to really care. There was a movie being filmed a block away, and we were a 15 minute walk from the Blue Jays game, 5 minutes from the Hockey Hall of Fame, and surrounded by great restaurants. BeerBistro was right around the corner, and there's a great sushi place across the street. The elevators were pretty slow, and small compared to newer hotels, but it's an old building, what can you do. If you're going to Toronto and want to stay for a night or two at a great price, and plan on spending the majority of your time shopping, eating, and enjoying the city, snap up a room here on Priceline if you can get it. If you want to lay in bed all day and watch tv while drinking coffee, this isn't the place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “A Pig in Lipstick”
Reviews.Author: norsktraveller
Reviews.Content: Because I travel a lot, I often enjoy the older, more eccentric hotels when given a choice, even when they cost a bit more, but this place was a real let-down. A faded dowager, run down and way past its prime - despite the pretentiousness of the lobby; it could be fun if dirt cheap and friendy. But worst is that the staff have that curiously entitled (yet completely unempowered) attitude usually reserved for government employees. They wouldn't last a week in even a mediocre chain that valued customer service. The journey back and forth to the lobby, necessary to access the internet (apparently even the wired version only works in certain rooms), required negotiating a labrynth of stairs (both up and down.) Good thing it was a low floor, as the elevators are extremely slow. Only when checking out a few days early (to find a hotel with internet access), did staff show any concern and finally moved me to a room with internet access, and less dreary than the previous to boot! But the clincher was the seeing the charges on my bill at checkout, not only for the non-working internet, but also for the phone calls to the hotel's support line trying to get it fixed (and after two conversations with alleged managers.) They did reverse these at checkout when I spoke to yet another disinterested staffer. As I said to him, it's not that you expect a grand hotel to be perfect, but you expect them to care when they screw up. These folks don't, so spend your money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of money for a so so used to be good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MVagusta
Reviews.Content: This was an expensive stay for a not fully renovated hotel. At the height, it was probably an excellent hotel but it's now worn and a bit run down. The staff was friendly enough, but definitely not up to the standard for the almost $400 that we paid for the night. Come to think of it...we probably got ripped off. Good location though.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Morainelake
Reviews.Content: We returned home yesterday from staying in the Meridien King Edward and found the hotel superb. We ( being a friend & I )had a short stay in Toronto mainly for sightseeing and shopping. We found the staff very helpful and friendly,they could not do enough for us. The location was great, our room was super, with everything we could possibly need - apart from one thing , no tea/coffee making facilities, luckily we brought our own, however on our departure I did ask why this was not provided, they said it was the hotel's policy as tea & coffee is available in the reception area in the morning free of charge,but so many people had complained they were now thinking about changing. We would definately stay there again as we enjoyed so much.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!”
Reviews.Author: petition2God
Reviews.Content: It was the most over-priced and over-rated hotel ever! It was run-down, thin walled and simply ugly. Customer service was terrible! I do not understand how this hotel is a four star one. I had an awful experience with Le Meridien in London but thought one in Canada would be better. Was I wrong! This hotel is unacceptable for its price. Stay away from this place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cdinlondon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at the King Edward. This was another Priceline gem. Greeted warmly and quickly by wonderful front desk staff member Shoiban (sorry if I misspelt) I asked about an upgrade (I was willing to pay) and she had a warm smile on her face and said "my favourite room is available, I think you'll like it". Having read some of the reviews here I was a little worried about the state of the rooms, being old or tired (my wife and I are more into modern hotels in general, but obviously with Priceline beggars can't be choosers) Well the room we received (for not a penny more than the $85 a night we paid) was great. Room 237 was a modern masterpiece. 42 Inch Plasma TV on the wall, Bose surround sound stereo, heavenly bed/bedding. Great Minibar. Robes, and slippers provided, and great bathroom amenities. The bathroom itself was wonderful, awesome rainfall shower head. On the downside, being on the 2nd floor there was some minor street noise, mainly from Ambulances from nearby Hospital. The location of the hotel was perfect for us, we took the train in, and it is less than 10 minutes from Union Station. We walked everywhere from here, Eaton Centre, CN Tower, Harbourfront all less than 20 minutes (Eaton Centre only about 5 minutes or so) Subway stop about 250 yards away if you need to go further. Didn't really do much at the hotel, although the spa looked nice, and the prices were actually fairly reasonable. We didn't park, but valet was $25 a night. The lobby is stunning, and the fitness centre is pretty good. There is no pool, which would really put this property at the top of our list. All in all, we were very happy, especially given the price we paid (their website was almost 3 times as much) We are going back to Toronto again at beginning of July, keeping our fingers crossed we can Priceline this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall”
Reviews.Author: Kozm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my wife on April 14-15th. Nice bed, clean room, and the location is fine. The wait for an elevator was quite long and annoying. The size of in-room TVs is ridiculously small. No swimming pool indoors. I rated this hotel average, because in my eyes the listed deficiencies do not make it even above average, despite all the pompousness and doormen's waist sizes (which are impressive, by the way).

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulela
Reviews.Content: Thought I'd treat myself to a luxary hotel during a business trip to Toronto and booked the King Edward. Boy, let me tell you this is really just a pig with lipstick. For starters, this hotel is located in a relatively rundown part of the downtown business core. As soon as the business offices empty out arounf 5:30PM, King Street East is not only quiet it's not inviting, and somewhat unsafe for visitors who are unfamiliar with the neighbourhood. Next, the hotel itself shows it's age. The historic internior has been polished up, but there's only so much polishing you can do to make an old place look somewhat newer, cleaner and more inviting. You can walk 2 blocks West to catch the King station subway. There's always a taxi waiting around to the corner to service hotel guests, and you can catch the King Street streetcar 1/2 a block away from the hotel's entrance. There's a handful of good restaurants 1 block South on Wellington and several more if you venture 2 blocks South on Church. But overall, I wasn't impressed with the amenities in-room, the interior decor of the hotel nor my large room with somewhat dated and dirty furniture. I would rate this hotel a 3.5* overall, not a 4* in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, and Right by the Subway!”
Reviews.Author: JRWoods1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was great! The beds were extremely comfortable, and the room was spotlessly clean. One nice feature was the seperate (and beautiful marble) toilet/sink and bath/shower/sink, which was great for multiple people. You also get a closet! The room itself was huge, and had a nice sitting area and desk. Some of the furniture (esp. the couch) was a little dingy, but was still clean and comfortable. They will probably upgrade soon. The TV in the room is only a 19", which, when it's 20+ feet from your bed, is very small. Most people shouldn't care, but if you have kids, or absolutely have to watch from bed, it may get on your nerves. No pool -- this hotel would be pretty boring for kids. The hotel does not have any vending machines, and the well-stocked mini-bar is ridiculously overpriced ($10 mini bottles). However, it's a great place to put a few drinks of your own if you remove the Perrier and other non-spoilables. Overall, I would stay there again any time! Don't place too much emphasis on the bad reviews, especially if you don't pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “The King Eddy: A Classic Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: glowbal
Reviews.Content: The King Eddy is a large classic style hotel located east of Yonge Street in the old part of Toronto's financial district. It is very close to the major office complexes and a short block away from the Subway station. The building's architecture and imposing placement on the street hearkens back to the old days of grand hotels. Fortunately the hotel has maintained its glory with good maintenance and renovations over the years. The lobby is large and inviting with a stated elegence and style. Service was exceptional and very professional. The doorman was helpful and courteous. The hotel staff was great. The room itself was spacious, clean, modern but classic, and the bed was firm, clean and luxurious. The only minor downside to the hotel is that it does not have a pool though the gym facilities are adequate otherwise. If you want a classic and first class place to stay and feel pampered then the King Eddy is a great choice. It is great for business people and nice for those that want a little rest and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Not for 20 something couples, thats for sure.”
Reviews.Author: JustinH
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, however perhaps its not intended for the 20 something couple. I got the room for 65 a night on priceline. Check in was very very fast, we checked in very late, around 10pm. This hotel is very old and charming. Its really not my style. There is no pool, and no on site public hot tub, or sauna. No pool? You've got to be kidding? No business room with computers. This hotel seems to be catering towards older couples. The gym is free, which is a nice touch where the trend is for health clubs to charge an extra fee to use the hotel gym. The hotel is spotless, but dated. Valet parking is 28 dollars. I chose to park in the municipal lot a few blocks away on queen street, and paid 11 dollars per night. Its about a ten minute walk to the lot, not a problem at all. We were assigned a room on the seventh floor. It was a very large room, 12 foot ceilings. Everything was very clean, but well worn. The couch had wear marks, the bed was worn out. It seems like this hotel is always trying to up sell you. There is a mini bar with very expensive liquors and sodas in there (4.50 for a cranberry juice, 10 dollars for a shot of liquor in a mini bottle). Even 6.95 for a condom in a discreet package. One nice touch was an embroidered robe in the closet. With a note above it saying in fancy words basically "don't steal our robes".. How tacky. I like a coffee maker in the room, I did not get one. They are luring you to go downstairs to their expensive restaurant. The hotel breakfast did not look great. We opted for tim hortons across the street. Great coffee, and breakfast sandwiches on the cheap. The hotel is within walking distance or a short cab ride to many destinations within the city. The doorman was an excellent help, giving us instructions, and offering his help when ever he saw us. Nice hotel, but I'm glad I only paid 65 a night for it on priceline, as the list rate is absurd for what your getting (and not getting). We stayed at the sheraton centre before, and liked it much better, and it was even cheaper. I hope I don't get this one again on priceline, its a nice place, but its just boring to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Waited for 2 Hours to Get our rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tambukakang
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 3 pm but was told the rooms are being cleaned. At 5 p.m. I went up to ask why the delay, front desk said they were experiencing a difficult night and our rooms were not ready yet after two hours, although they were checking in people directly, no waiting. Finally when we talked to a staff member (may be a manager) the rooms were given to us. I was there scouting for my 2008 function but was very disappointed the way the front desk treated us. Was planning to ask for RFP for my function in June 2008, but changed my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Larry the Concierge was invaluable”
Reviews.Author: Trishabelle
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the "King Eddie" for 4 nights in November. We travelled with Canadian Affair. Our room was fantastic - enormous, clean and delightful. The only downside was that it did not have tea/coffee making facilies, nor was there an ice machine, apparantly due to sabotage somewhere in the hotel chain. However when we mentioned it to Larry the Concierge he arranged for a kettle etc. and a bucket of ice to be brought up to our room. He also gave us lots of useful advice about where and where not to go, and how best to get there - we really felt as though he went the extra mile for us. We were aware that breakfast at the hotel was expensive so we popped across the road every morning to Tim Hortons which suited us fine. However we did indulge in the hotel's highly recommended home-made beefburger which was every bit as good as Larry said. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, very conveniently situated and we wouldn't hesitate in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “A Royal Experience at the King Eddie”
Reviews.Author: pirate-elle
Reviews.Content: We booked our anniversary at the King Edward - a package through their website that included Valet Parking, Late Checkout and Brunch. We could not have been more pleased. I'm a Starwood Preferred Guest, so usually find the service great at Starwood properties, but this was exceptional. Valet Parking was terrific, we checked in quite late and had been upgraded to a full suite, which was huge - 2 baths, full living and dining room. Woke up the next day and went to the Antiques Market at St Lawrence Market then back in time for brunch. Brunch was phenomenal - probably the best we've ever had, and we do a lot of great brunches!! Palatial room, harpist, great selection. My husband commented that each dish was of a calibre that you'd be happy with that alone. Even the fresh squeezed orange juice tasted better than normal. I had balked a bit at the room rate, but when the $30 valet parking, plus a $100 brunch for two, and the late checkout (we did some shopping and came back to the hotel hours later still in time for checkout) was factored in, this rate really was a steal! If you want a regal room, and a weekend getaway where you really feel pampered, I highly recommend this grand hotel!

Reviews.Title: “King Edward Slipping”
Reviews.Author: TouringLawyer
Reviews.Content: We spent Labor Day at the King Edward fand were disapointed by the level of service which had deteriorated from our 8 previous stays. Check-in was hampered by the staffer's inability to speak English. The room was fine--the elevators need a refresh as do the hallways. The hotel gift shop has moved downmarket from previous stays perhaps reflecting the hotels postion in the luxury market. On Sunday we we missed breakfast and went o the dining room were we were told by a surly hostess that unless we wanted the full brunch, we should go to the Consort Lobby Bar. We did so only to be informed that they didn't serve breakfast either, so we went off campus. Saturday evening, we went to the concierge desk to book a limo to the airport but no one was there. We then went to the front desk where, after much paperwork, we were told one would be arranged. Fortunately, I checked Sunday morning to confirm the limo. It hadn't been ordered and their was no record of our reservation. The King Edward is still a lovely property and close to the theaters, but the axis of shopping has moved uptown. With Starwood's recent acquistion of Meridien, perhaps the hotel will regain its former glory. I'd give it a miss for a year before I'd try it again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: Jabeka
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the King Edward for three nights while visiting my son in Toronto. I absolutely loved this hotel--it has lots of character, is in a good location for traveling around the city in a car and had excellent service. I normally book through PriceLine and frequently get the Sheraton Town Centre, which is very nice, but the King Edward was a delightful surprise. The front desk was professional, helpful and I was not put off by the fact that I booked through PriceLine (which happens now and again.) The valet service was friendly and made an effort to accomodate my needs (ie: leaving my car out front and returning 30 minutes later) and pre-ordered breakfast room service was to the minute on time. I must say, after receiving this booking on PriceLine, then reading some of the negative TA reviews, I was a tad worried, but my stay was wonderful. I think it's helpful to keep in mind that while not all stays in a hotel will be perfect, not all stays in a hotel will be a disaster either. I would highly suggest the King Edward for a change of pace from the typical big city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, even with little children”
Reviews.Author: 2plus2-9
Reviews.Content: I booked a last minute "Friday get-a-way" as a treat for my family. I have a just-turned 5 year old girl and a two year old son. My daughter and I took the train into Toronto and the subway up to the Eaton Centre so she could visit the Disney store. Then we walked over to the King Edward Hotel and checked in. The staff were all fantastic as I admit to being a little uneasy about their acceptance of young children. I should not have given it a second thought as everyone was fantastic. We had a 2 queen bed room and it was HUGE! When they brought in the crib for my son it didn't even make a dent...and it was a real, full sized crib, not cot sized or a pack n'play like in many hotels. When my husband arrived with our son he told me the valet was so nice and so was the door man. I had ordered room service and it arrived very quickly and they set up the table to accomodate the kids! Both kids loved the deep window sills were they could watch the streetcars and the people below (but we didn't hear any street noise). I can honestly say that the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. I can't over emphasize the space in the room as the kids had room to play on the floor (nice clean carpet) and run around. Yes it is an old hotel but that is part of its charm. I was worried that my daughter would miss having a pool but she is asking to go back this weekend! On Saturday we walked over the the St.Lawrence Market and again the doorman was ready with directions and a friendly word and a laugh at the antics of a two year old boy seeing automatic revolving doors. What a grand experience at a grand hotel. We all loved it!

Reviews.Title: “King Eddie is a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: beloro
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews before our mini vacation and I was a little apprehensive about staying at the King Edward. They were definitely unfounded. We pulled up to the front of the hotel and my door was immediately opened by the doorman. When I said that we were checking in I was asked if we needed help with our luggage. Check in was fast and the desk clerk was very friendly. Our room was ready even though it was only 1:00 pm. We were taken to a Club Level junior suite and we were very surprised at how large the room was. We were fortunate to have a corner room so it gave it a very airy feeling. The room was absolutely immaculate. I made a point of checking every "nook and cranny" after reading some of the reviews. I did call down to housekeeping and requested another robe as there was only one in the room. The amenities in the bathroom were very nice and we found that there was plenty for both of us. The only "complaint" that I would have (if I had to have one) is that the television is not very big. Not a big deal for us though since we were not planning on watching much TV anyway. I do admit that the air conditioning was not perfect. That being said, when the AC would have been installed in the hotel it would have been and "add on" so therefore it was done in the best way possible. Not a big deal. Housekeeping was fantastic. She saw us bring in a bag of ice for our cooler and immediately said that she could get ice for us. Not only did we not have to pay the $3 she made sure that our cooler stayed full. Very impressed. We definately gave her a little extra. After we unpacked, we went down to speak with the concierge in regards to restaurants for dinner. Brandon recommended the hotel dining room as well as Barberians. Barberians had been recommended to me by various people on the Toronto forum. We decided to stay in the hotel for dinner on Friday night and we were very glad that we did. The food was excellent as was the service. I loved the soup that I had for a starter and mentioned to them that I would really like to have the recipe. The head chef was not in but I was given his e-mail address in order to request the recipe. I will be doing that today.
