I asked if it would be at all possible to take a couple of servings home with me on Monday and they were more than happy to arrange it. All that I really cared about was the basic soup as there were a number of "finishing touches" that was done to it before serving. When we were checking out I was told that the soup was in the fridge waiting for me and did I still want it. Absolutely! I was very surprised to see that I was given enough for 4 servings, all of the extras to go with it as well as being told that there was no charge! Guess what we had for dinner last night?! :D We did not have breakfast while we were there. Since we were on the Club Level we were able to have a light meal in the Club Lounge. It was perfect for us before we went out for the day. We found that all of the staff was very friendly and helpful. There are areas of the hotel that are looking a little dated but we felt that it just added more charm to an old beautiful hotel. It was a nice change from a sterile "box" feeling that so many of the newer hotels have. We will definitely go back to the King Edward. We loved the location as it is within walking distance of many attractions. Just walking down Yonge Street Saturday night was interesting to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cavendish Beach
Reviews.Content: I booked Le Meridien King Edward based on a promotional special from Starwood Properties. I had read the negative reviews, however, after experiencing the professional and client oriented focus, I must have stayed at a diifferent destination!!!! From the warm welcome from OSCAR , Guest Service Manager to the accommodating Bell staff (who obviousty take pride in this fine establishment and their jobs), excellent housekeeping, and staff in the lounge , I have never felt so "at home"!! The bed and linens are simply luxurious and the room was huge!! Room Service was fast, staff are thoughtful, and quality of the food was very good. Location is key ,as one is steps from the Subway and the glorious St Lawrence Market is a 5 minute walk. It is important to acknowledge an establishment that is going above and beyond when it pertains to client service . It is also great to encounter such a sincere staff.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, ignore the negative comments”
Reviews.Author: Jilll
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stopped at this hotel, en route to visiting our daughter who lives in Montreal. After reading the reviews recently I was somewhat sceptical at staying at this hotel wondering what had happened. We are regular visitors to Le Meridien hotels, and never had cause to complain yet, as we didn"t yet again. The staff were pleasant and courtieous, asked if we needed help with our luggage when we arrived, received a free upgrade to a Queen Size room, this being on th 8th floor and was very spacious. I do agree that there may be need for a slight upgrade on some carpets on the landings and the lift areas could do with a little upgrade, but this hotel is very old, very grand, and I found myseld comparing this to the Meridien Hotels in Dubai, which I shouldn"t, as those hotels are out of this world. The breakfast in the King Edward is excellent, was cooked freshly for you and the service was excellent too, there isn"t a lot of hotels where breakfast is served from 7am to 2.30pm. We booked this hotel via Canadian Affair when I booked my flights, and I thought that I received an excellent deal for 90 pounds per room per night, we stopped 3 nights and Saturday and Sunday nights were even cheaper. There are no problems at all at this hotel, the rooms, the bathroom and all the public areas were spotless clean. The staff are pleasant, the hotel is in an excellent position in Toronto and within walking distance of all shops, attractions and restaurants. When leaving the hotel we asked reception for a taxi to take us to the airport at 10.15am. the taxi was there before us, complete with luggage in the boot and ready to go at 10.00am. Overall we have no complaints about this hotel and will most certainly return next time we visit Canada.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: execnova
Reviews.Content: I am fairly critical (read my review of the Lowell Hotel, New York) and I have to say that I had a very pleasant stay at the King Edward. My room was not particularly large and the comforter was somewhat worn, but housekeeping promptly provided a duvet cover and it added charm to the room - furniture was fine and the carpeting and wallpaper were recently redone. Very quiet location on the seventh floor. Room service was exceptionally fast and the concierge was very efficient. Staff was formal but pleasant (in keeping with the atmosphere of the hotel). This hotel is not the St. Regis or Dorchester, but you will be very pleased with your visit - remember, this is an older hotel and may need some minor refreshing (i.e. elevator doors and hallways to rooms).

Reviews.Title: “These reviews are wrong”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All these negative reviews post a very horrible picture of this hotel. First of all it is a 4-Diamond hotel, not a 5-star, star rating is for restaurants, hotels are reviewed by diamonds. The facility is beautiful, despite the fact that there is no pool, staff are friendly, and willing to assist however they can. I would definitely recommend this to travellers. Sunday brunch is absolutely delectable, rooms are decorated in charming edwardian style, and the staff international and friendly. I would absolutely stay there again, and bring clients to stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, badly overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: Coolcanuck2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is badly resting on its laurels and is in desperate need of new rooms, new staff and new rates. Right now, I have to concur with all the negative reviews - the room each of my collegues got (4 different rooms) were was tiny, and in desperate need of being redone - the wallpaper was peeling, the furtniture old, mismatched and battered; the world's tiniest TV in a huge armoir, dingy, stained carpeting, same situation in the bathrooms, etc. The food in the restaurant was bad enough to cause myself and my colleagues out in search of breakfast somewhere else - something I've never felt the need to do before. The staff were horrific too - it took us 1.5 hours to have breakfast - 45 minutes was in waiting to get served and take our food order, in a half filled room.... One of my colleagues was so annoyed at the wait for some (cold) croissants, and the impossibility of getting a waiter, that he eventually simply followed the waiters into the kitchen and cornered them there. He found them standing together chit-chatting. Same situation in the hotel bar/lounge - 20 minutes after being seated, no service. There seemed to be a single waitress for the entire, large room. We tried to go up to the bar, but there was only one bartender, who we could not get the attention of. We gave up and left. When we mentioned the problems to the front desk at checkout, a rather desperate, glazed look came over the checkout person - they really didn't want to hear about this, and I have little faith that the problems got reported, let alone dealt with. If the hotel had dirt-cheap rates, some of these problems may not be all that surprising. However, given the expense of the hotel, and the competition in Toronto, they're inexcusable. Given the many great hotels in Toronto (which I'm originally from), everyone can do far better at almost any other hotel, and in many cases for less money. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Crushing Disappointment - Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow. Just . . . Wow. How can a hotel with this sort of reputation be so very utterly miserably terrible? I write this review from the perspective of having spent our Wedding night here - we live in Toronto, and had always wanted to stay at the "King Eddie" - it's got such a storied reputation and air of glamour. We booked a room months in advance online, and followed up several times with calls to ensure the room was indeed ready and that yes, this was our wedding night etc etc. and we would be made to feel welcome - they couldn't wait to host us, blah blah blah. Arriving by cab was the first sign things weren't going to go well when the doorman didn't even offer to help myself or my wife,( still in wedding dress!)out of the car. He just . . .stood there. It was wierd. Check in staff was indifferent and obviously wanted to be anywhere rather than working the front desk @ 10:30 PM. We were given our room keys and sent on our way. Not even an eyebrow raised or an acknowledgement that this was indeed a special night for us. We weren't looking for anything special, but we were the only ones in the lobby in wedding attire . . . I guess they just get a lot of weddings, so are pretty indifferent overall. As for the first room (thats right, they mixed up rooms) - we were shown a tiny room overlooking a back street, but, get this - 2 twin beds! On our wedding night. Luckily we'd kept our booking receipt, which clearly stated a king bed. A call downstairs resulting in 15 minutes later a security guard showing up and leading us to another room. No apology, just a curt acknowledgement of an error. The new room, while large, must surely have been slated for a renovation in the next week - tired, faded dusky rose furniture, chipped and cracked armoire, mismatching desk chair - At this point I felt we were surely getting punished for something we'd done in a previous life. It got worse: One would assume with a King bed that there would be amenities for 2. Nope. No dice. There was only one set of towels, one robe, one glass, heck, there was only one bar of soap! The bathroom was cold and extremely dimly-lit, and the ceiling over the shower was actully rotted in places and you could see exposed framework in behind! Extraordinary. One other item of note: If you are planning to arrive late (provided you're even unlucky enough to still be staying here) and you get peckish, by all means make every effort to look for something to eat or drink AWAY from the hotel. Go searching! A pot of tea (4 cups) and 4 peek frean cookies cost us a whopping 29.00! Tea and coffee service wasnt even included! Overall, this hotel seemed to do its very best in consistently disappointing us with its indifference, overpriced room service, messing up with our rooms, and sub-par amenities within the room. If you are looking to stay in downtown Toronto, please please please consider NOT staying at the King Edward. You've been warned! (As an aside, my parents stayed at The Suites at 1 King West just down the street, paid half the price we did, were provided complementary drinks on arrival, full valet service, had in room coffee and tea service, fresh flowers, a full kitchenette with washer/dryer, AND FINALLY a complementary drive to our wedding that afternoon in the hotel's restored 1960 Cadillac! )

Reviews.Title: “Staff let the Hotel down”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Royal Meridien King Edward last October for 6 nights. Having seen the pictures on the internet it looked lovely, and upon arrival I was very impressed until I met the front desk clerk. He was very rude and spoke down to us as if we were not good enough to stay there. Apart from that the Hotel was ok, the bar was very nice within the Hotel but again most of the service staff were rude. I would not recommed this Hotel, which is a shame as it is the staff that let the Hotel down.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: IceGlide
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the King Edward on April 22. We arrived back to our room after a wonderful dinner and show at 1 am. After we got there doors began to slam and several people were yelling in the hallway. It felt very much like our dorm room days! We called the front desk, which was pointless because people continued to yell and run around in the hall. At 2 am they offered to change our room. By this time we were so exhausted we didnâ€™t feel like packing up and moving. Needless to say, the King Edward was not what we expected! I do not recommend this hotel and I will not go back. If you do goâ€¦bring earplugs just in case.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL IN TORONTO”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I work for hotels all my life as it is my passion. King Edward will have to be the worst I've stayed at. They have no staff to deliver service and the staff they evidently don't like working there. They are all miserable and you can see it on their faces!!! I attended a meeting. I arrived at 8:20 (meeting starts at 8:30), the room was not set up. The door man was just reading a paper/magazine when I arrived, didn't even make an eye contact with me. Front Desk Agent was rude and while checking me in, talking to a colleague. Was not paying attention to me at all. Room was disgusting. Large but not cozy. Bed are very uncomfortable. Managers talk down on their front line staff in front of Guests. Food is okay - Restaurant Servers are too snobbish. I don't recommend staying in this hotel and it's better to just stay at the Fairmont Royal York - they take their business seriously. King Eddie is a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Don,t waste your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don,t waste your money on this hotel.Its a 1 star dressed up like a 5 star. Stayed there Friday night. No bell hop offered to take our luggage. We had a Deluxe room. Very small bathroom.The hotel advertizes a fine selection of cigars,but they don,t tell you they have no place you can smoke one. Even though the floor we stayed on was half empty, they put us in an ajoining room . The other room didn,t check in until 12pm. So for the next half hour all we heard was the click,click of their door. Had a bath around 10 pm.NO hot water. The next morning went down for breakfast, $ 60.00 for bacon and eggs ,for 2 . Even though the hotel was not busy, it took 30 min. to get my car from valet parking ( and $35.00 later ). Sent the hotel 2 e-mails, to date still no reply.There is alot of cheaper hotels downtown that will treat you alot better then this hotel treated us.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are a great size!!”
Reviews.Author: frigor
Reviews.Content: I nervously booked the hotel for a valentines day gift to my boyfriend. We have both never spent much money on hotels and have never thought of it as important. After booking the hotel I was expecting the greatest thing ever. I got everything!! The service of the front desk was amazing! Concierge knew exactly what I was looking for (maybe because it was Valentines day weekend) but still! The rooms were impecable. Clean and large! The bed insanely comfortable, probably the best sleep I've had in a while. I would suggest this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly horrible! Don't book here!”
Reviews.Author: Kmoore
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from Toronto. He visits regularly for business and usually stays at the Fairmont Royal York. I've never been to Toronto myself, so he thought he'd "treat" me to Toronto's "famed" King Eddie. Upon arrival I was thrilled with the beauty of the lobby. We arrived around 2:15pm and were told we could not get into the room for at least another 45 minutes, or so. The concierge was not eager to assist in directing us to the "place to check our bags" while we wait to check in. He was without emotion and seemed very bored by us. The room was spacious with high ceilings and appointed very tastefully. The bed was luxuriously comfortable and the shower was wonderful. But that's where it ends! The most rude, unaccomodating staff from the front desk through to the dining room. Two room service experiences were pleasant...attendants were polite and gracious...food was disappointing. There is a fabulous full service spa on the mezzanine level, but don't expect to be told about it. Brochures were not in the room. I stumbled upon the tag board placard that was resting on an easel near the stairs to the mezzanine level. Apparently, there is no relationship between spa owner and hotel. Nonentheless, it is a wonderful amenity that each guest should be made aware of. When I approached the front desk about "why there wasn't a brochure in the room for the spa", their response was..."they're not a part of us." Their response led me to believe that there was a bitter battle between the two entities. We checked out today and chose to have breakfast in their dining room. We were greated by Mortisha (not her name, but was her posture). She slithered through the dining room past a dozen of open tables, landing us in the corner between two occupied tables. When our server approached the table I smiled and said good morning and asked how are you today? The server's response, or should I say, reaction was...."I'M BUSY." She stopped me in my tracks, dead! Minutes passed when two diners to my left asked me "Do you sense a little bit of an attitude here this morning with the service?" We shared reviews of both our stays and we all summed it up the same..."HORRIBLE". Luxuriously comfortable beds in a dancehall-size room with a postage stamp-sized television and a great shower. That was about it! Unforgiveable service!!

Reviews.Title: “King Eddy is Fine”
Reviews.Author: lawnshadow
Reviews.Content: While on vacation, I stayed at the King Edward for two days between Christmas and New Years. We were in room 893 and the two double beds were quite comfortable. The size of the room and the amenities were what I expected for this price range. I too objected to having to pay $15 a day for internet access. Given the room rate, I think it should have been included. The fitness room had a weight machine and several treadmills - adequate, but nothing special. Use of their sauna requires a reservation and a fee of ten dollars so I did not get around to trying it. Again, it would be nice if this were a little more accesible and included in the room rate. One thing that I have not seen mentioned is the artwork. There is an art gallery on the ground floor. Paintings and sculpture by their artists are on display in the lobby, the restaurant and the hotel's first floor windows. The quality is good and it adds a lot to the atmosphere. Another amenity that is somewhat unusual in its format is the bar. One wall is windowed and faces King street. The space is furnished with comfortable chairs arranged in living room configurations rather than restaurant-style tables. It reminded me of an English club and, from what I could see from the door, I had the expectation of finding elderly Etonians dribbling gin on their ties. But, when I actually got around to checking it out, I liked sitting in there nursing a drink and watching people walk by outside. The patrons ran the gamut from a trio of Jamaicans in dreadlocks to a successful-looking, 60-ish couple who were dressed like they just came from a Republican fund-raiser. The restaurant was fine but pricey with breakfast ringing in at $100US for three people. The artwork definitely added to the appeal of the room. The service was consistently polite but reserved, which seemed the norm in Toronto. The pressured effusiveness that has become the US standard doesn't seem to exist and, by comparison, the matter of fact service seemed almost grudging at times. But I think that is a perception distorted by the manic US style that I'm used to. The people at the front desk seemed to be chummier than the other staff. The front door is half a block from a subway entrance so it was easy to get to the trains and the underground warren of shops and passageways that goes on for blocks and blocks and can be a pleasant relief from walking in the weather. Food court joints run by a delightful spectrum of immigrants predominate down there. I liked the King Eddy. It has a quirky kind of class and I will probably stay there again the next time I'm in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Imagine20
Reviews.Content: After booking my trip, I read the Trip Advisor comments and got scared! I thought my fiance and I were going to end up with a European-style hotel with small, cramped rooms, or something really dirty and falling apart. This was not so. The rooms were clean, nothing was broken, and it's not in such disrepair as other people have said. The front desk staff was very friendly. We had a deluxe king room, which was bigger than I expected (after reading that some people got a room where supposedly the bed would fit and almost nothing else). There was a sitting area, and two windows. The bed was beautiful and very comfortable. The bathroom was divided so one could use the sink while the other had privacy in the shower. We spent two nights in Toronto. One night we did sit in the bar, and had a bite to eat and a couple of drinks. The lighting was low and there are many places to sit privately, so it was intimate. Everything was great. The King Edward is close to so much shopping and quite a few little restaurants. You can pretty much walk to wherever you want to go. We did not use the valet service so I can't comment on that. I did notice there was self parking everywhere. You could self park for less than 1/2 the price of the valet, if you are money conscious or don't like to call for your car every time you want to use it. The elevator was quick, and we never had to wait for it. The only thing I was not happy about was the fact that internet access was an additional charge. If you're looking for and would rather have the Four Seasons, by all means stay there instead. The King Edward has charm and a great location, and I will definately stay there again if I ever find myself in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Best thing about the King Eddy is its location. You can walk up to the Eaton Centre, along King St. or over to Queen West for fantastic shopping & eating. The room was dated & small, with a narrow but spotless bathroom. I was disappointed in the number of towels & unavailability of alternate pillows, but the bed was a King & comfy! We stayed here ten years ago for a night & I remember a wonderfully spacious room with a great washroom. Maybe I've stayed in too many hotels since then, but this room was small. No view, either. Guess I should've asked. If you don't need the location (and it's fabulous), find a cheaper/nicer place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: fortheride
Reviews.Content: stayed for 6 days on a leisure trip with my wife,booked a suite spacious clean & comfortable ,bathroom to small given size of suite but clean & funtional,breakfast included in rate was very good, bar still has excellent food choice & good atmostphere,restaurant not worth bothering with in evening instead use the excellent concierge for dinner reservations,staff are still very good at the eddy but meridien still have not bought the hotel back to its standards of the late nineties,we tried the eddy beacuse the four seasons so needs updating ,previous years visit,we would consider staying again or try the suites at oneking west,which has the same great location as the king edward

Reviews.Title: “Some good points but certainly problems that the hotel must sort out!”
Reviews.Author: denisjojo
Reviews.Content: Good points Hotel is in a good location, the service was cordial and friendly throughout, the lobby is very impressive. The bed in the room was superb (one of the best experienced) and breakfasts lovely. Bad points Rooms furnishings (other than the bed) were very tired. Our carpet had red spills at various points. blood? wine? The staff shrugged their shoulders - seemed to be aware of this. When in the room, you learnt not to look down... Shower lacked power. The water sprayed 180 degrees with little left to go straight down where you want it. Unfortunately we had to use a smoking room & it reeked of nicotine. Surely there must be a way they can air out a room.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights, room OK, staff OK, location OK Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Charming.”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few days and found it to be utterly charming in every respect. It compares very favourably with some 5 star hotels we have stayed in and really punches above its weight. The lobby is fabulous and there is a lovely ambience.Our room was very attractive and spacious and the bathroom had a very luxurious feel. All the staff we came into contact with were friendly, charming and helpful. Breakfast was delicious each day and enjoyed in a most delightful, light-filled room. The menu was very varied indeed. Toronto is a beautiful cosmopolitan city and when we visit again, we certainly look forward to staying at the King Edward.

Reviews.Title: “definietly not 4-5 star”
Reviews.Author: muddyjeep
Reviews.Content: stayed for overnight theatre outing romantic weeked very large rooms with no furniture in them filthy room very small bathroom with ceiling falling in would not stay again the lobby is very nice too bad the rest of the place is in need of a make over

Reviews.Title: “Classic Style in the Big City”
Reviews.Author: Aymeric
Reviews.Content: Superb location, close to the financial district downtown (so lots of suit-and-tie business people stay here) and steps from subway/streetcar stops. Reviewers are rightly "wowed" by the lobby -elegant and well-proportioned - in this century-old architectural treasure; unfortunately, the wonderful corner room at the far right, with all its stucco decoration and high ceiling, that used to be the hotel restaurant (try peeking through the street windows) is undergoing renovation and will become, they now say, a Ball Room: really too bad for us non-Ball givers or goers because the Cafe Victoria replacing it is not exciting... Efficient and friendly desk staff. Quiet, even subdued, ambiance, as one might expect from this type of hotel (no "hip" here - although a group of youngish entrepreneurs was having its meeting here during my stay, and elevator conversations suggest they really loved the place...). During my three-day stay, the elevators - there are five of them - were generally on the slow side (and at least one always kept mysteriously stopping on the sixth floor). My room was spacious and comfortable enough, with a queen-size bed, in a very traditional, English-style decor (dark woods, floral fabrics); one basically viewless window couldn't be opened (of interest to those of us who do not want air-conditioning all the time). Too bad there was no coffee maker (or CD player - the clock radio was pretty so-so...). Decent size bathroom with window; less-than-great lighting, slow flush and run-of-the-mill fixtures, but spotless. The Consort Bar has a great light-fare menu, with views on busy King Street but quiet corners, too. Credit-card only pay-as-you use internet access in the staffed Business Center. (I didn't use the fitness center this time, but remember it as being well-equipped and roomy enough; the spa is well-known in the city, I think). It seems the King Eddy - as a lot of the locals call it - has changed hands (and maybe direction) a few times in the recent past (currently it's part of the Meridien group); it still has a way to go if it really wants to attain the true top-level luxury category, but, then, maybe it doesn't want to quite get into that particular niche. The Meridien website might be the best way to go for a good deal. All in all, a highly enjoyable hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “King Edward-Caribana”
Reviews.Author: ctrese21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the King Edward over the Caribana weekend and I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel states that they are 5-star but I would give them a 3 1/2 star maybe 4 star at the best. The elevators are a bit small, but they are very fast. The lobby is very impressive. The parking, however is pretty expensive ($30) but you can find other alternatives. Do not use the lot on the corner from the hotel. I believe it's managed by Citipark and the guy working there tried to cheat us out of money, just because we were visiting. He tried to charge us twice the amount to park from what the overnight guy stated to us. Least to say we sought parking elsewhere that was cheaper and covered. The room was very spacious with two closets. We were in room 1410 that had a partial view of the CN Tower and a brick wall. It was ok because you don't come to Caribana to spend a lot of time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok but unspectacular”
Reviews.Author: viajante00
Reviews.Content: Great location: a block from the subway station, a 15-min walk to the CN Tower, waterfront, etc. The lobby is nice. The rooms are clean and reasonably updated but lacking in some amenities: what they call a queen bed is actually more like a double; there is no coffee pot in the room; the TV is small (20 inches, maybe). The common areas (and certainly the elevators) don't seem to be air conditioned. We got a very good deal on the room rate ($70 on Priceline).

Reviews.Title: “Old Time Glamour”
Reviews.Author: hsing115
Reviews.Content: I gave it an "above average" because of the efforts that the staff there put in. We got the hotels from priceline for $75 per night. Our 2 beds room was very spacious (even the washroom too). However, my friend's room w/ king size was relatively small. I have requested on the second day to have a room changed to a 2 beds near ours (882). The front desk, Jim, was very helpful, and got room 831 which has a sitting area that's pretty spacious, but the washroom was smaller than ours. Beds are comfortable, washroom is clean and big. It's an old hotel but still has its old time glamour. The things i don't like about the hotel is the elevator which is small and very hot. I wouldn't suggest for people who need the business center. There is a minimum charge for the computer use and fax which is not cheap. There is a charge for incoming and outgoing fax. The valet park is about the same as self park (a whooping CDN $29.95/day). High speed is $13.95 per day. Other than that, the location of the hotel is very good. There is a mall 3 blocks away, and a starbucks and drugstore w/ post office at the corner. You can always grab some breakfast across the street at Tim Horton or the bakery stores. You can have your lunch at the japanese restaurant across the street or you can walk 1.5 block to the Young restaurant (serves Thai food, buffet for lunch) on Church St. Prices are all reasonable and food is delicious. There is also a Hard Rock cafe by the mall. I love the location of this hotel, but the parking kills the deal. I think I'd rather stay at the hilton beause of my business needs.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant old world hotel”
Reviews.Author: mykel67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The King Edward for an excellent rate of $99 Canadian per night, as booked through Expedia. The lobby is warm and elegant, and check-in was very smooth. We didn't have high expectations for our room, given the low rate we were paying, but it was surprisingly comfortable. Small, yes, but nicely decorated and very clean. There is not much going on in the hotel itself (although we did manage to spend $113 on drinks in the lobby bar one night!), so if you're just looking for a comfortable place to sleep, this is a good choice. A resort or spa hotel, it's not.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rocketdog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the "King Eddy" while in town for a trade show and was very impressed at the level of service we received. It's important to remember that this is a very old hotel and that is a big distinction when comparing it to a newer place. Pro: excellent service, impeccable decor, general feeling of opulence, tasteful amenities, great location in Toronto. Con: room was rather small, bathroom was rather small, compared to a newer hotel. I personally expected this so was not disappointed. We didn't spend a lot of time in our room, but it was exceptionally clean and very nicely appointed. The staff was excellent, and even though we stayed in one of the less expensive rooms we never felt second class. Great restaurants and shopping were nearby. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed -”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Despite its 5-star rating, this hotel is sadly lacking and severely overpriced. Most critically, the cleaning staff certainly has a different definition of clean than I do. We checked into the hotel late and went straight to bed - it wasn't until the next morning, after parading around in our bare feet, that I discovered a small amount of feces on the bathroom floor - I thought it was a bug, so I stepped on it (shoes on) - you can imagine the rest of the story. The hotel was apologetic - upgraded me to a nice suite and gave me access to club services (only after I expressed my extreme disappointment in the hotel) - but they still charged me for that first room. Not what I would expect from a first class resort. If you stay here, be sure to wear your shoes at all times!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyrfriend and I spent a quiet new years eve at the king eddy hotel. We booked a few months in advance so we got a great deal for $189 which included a deluxe room, breakfast the next day, and a 3pm check out. The room was one of the most spacious and beautiful hotel rooms I've ever been to, and the furniture was very comfortable. The bathroom was massive, the walk in closet roomy, and I pretty much lived in the provided bathrobe for the entire length of my stay. We ordered room service for dinner...the food was delicious and arrived with friendly service. The only reasons why I gave it a 4 out of 5 is because the room service menu wasn't very selective, the tv was very small and there were no ice machines accessible. You had to call down for it. The first bucket was complimentary, but then it was $3 for any more that you wanted. Not exactly the best thing when you want to chill your midnight champagne. Other than that, our stay was most enjoyable and we'd certainly go back (with a cooler).

Reviews.Title: “Left a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Baby74
Reviews.Content: Disappointing. We were in town for a wedding and decided upon the King Edward as we thought it was one of Toronto's premier hotels. Were we ever mistaken. From the shabby room we were booked into to the poor service from hotel staff, we regretted moving from the Royal York Hotel, where we had been in residence for the previous three nights. The concierge was neglectful...leaving us waiting over half an hour for our car to be brought around to the front of the hotel. The doorman was a delight, the saving grace to a hotel that used to be a good spot to stay when in Toronto. I would, however, recommend the Royal York. Our room was decorated nicely, the service was incredible and our stay very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Nondescript hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: alainef
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at this hotel again. It seems something of a hotel whose time has come and gone. The lobby feels something like a ghost town. The staff was nice however, particularly the concierge. The room was like any other hotel room - OK, but nothing special. The bed had wool blankets in the hot September weather which made for an uncomfortable night's sleep. 6 oz. water bottles from the mini bar cost $8 - when I complained to the hotel manager, he said that all hotels in the area charged the same - this did not sound like a good reason to me, but he was convinced. Overall, the hotel is nondescript; there is nothing special to be said about it and I cannot recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4-star luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My overall experience was ok. I was there for 9 nts from Aug.18-27 and there was 3 rooms that my family stayed in. We got the rooms for $65 ea. on priceline and were placed in the twin rooms upon arrival. Two of the rooms are spacious and the 3rd is your average size. For a 4-star hotel it did not live up to its reputation. The lobby is gorgeous but once in the room the beds, furnishings, etc are very basic and bare. Everything in the rooms shows its' age. There was not even a coffeemaker and when I requested it and tea I was charge $5 for the tea bags each time. I did not realize of the charge until check-out. I also called ahead to request a microwave & mini-fridge and had also mentioned it at check-in. I come back to the room that night and still no microwave/fridge. I called several times the next morning and finally got them delivered to my room the next evening. Housekeeping is spotty. The whole time I was there we only receive shampoo in the bathroom. On the day of check-out the housekeeper placed shampoo, conditioner, and liquid soap. I thought the hotel did not provide them so I had gone out and bought them on my own. There are cards that you can place on your bed so the linings are not changed out. However, on days when I did not place the card on the bed the sheets are still not changed out. Two days before checkout I come back in the evening to find the door to my room open. The front desk blamed it on housekeeping but did not offer an apology. Thank goodness my family and I did not bring anything of value. The valet parking is pretty bad too. It cost $30/day but actually adds up to $40/day including tips each time you go in/out. They say to call ahead in your room for the car and to give them 15-30 mins. but each time I called for the car the line is busy or I get placed on hold. The one time I got thru I waited my 15 minutes then went down to the lobby. There I waited some more until I question the valet guy and he said no had one told him. This is not the kind of service I expect from a 4-star hotel. Overall I am disappointed with the service. The only nice thing about this hotel is location.

Reviews.Title: “great location and Royal Club worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great location if you want to be near everything yet out of the chaos of downtown ---a few blocks from St. Lawrence marketplace, one of the best food markets/eating places anywhere - also walking distance from everything...Rooms fine; somewhat dated but comfortable and good beds. Spring for the Royal Club and there are good drinks at night and a great continental breakfast and free internet. I would come back despite the somewhat faded quality......
